So the 10 out of 10 rating is mostly to balance out the overall rating - 3,7 is just ridiculous. I mean go look for other movies on IMDB which still have 4 or 5 stars and are waaaaay worse than this one - trust me, you will find loads and lots of them :DThe movie has some really witty and funny humor in comparison to the usual hollywood "comedies" which are usually all about di**, fu**, su** and so on. Yes there is some crudeness here and there but overall Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly give a really funny pseudo british performance :) The way the dialogues are acted out are funny - full stop!I also liked how the movie integrated many modern things and somehow made them Sherlocks invention or idea :DJust go watch it and dont be turned down by de 3.7 rating. I would give this movie a fair 6.5-7 easy!

reviews.review_title: A great SATIRE, not for the easily offended.
reviews.content: Let me start by saying I have NEVER been a fan of Will Ferrell, and seeing all the negative reviews I went into this movie with very low expectations. And I was pleasantly surprised. It reminded me of the hay day of slapstick satirical comedy. It felt right at home with other films of this nature, like The Pink Panther, Monty Python, and even some of Mel Brooks' films, albeit not quite as good as those.It never took itself too seriously and was very honest with the humor it wanted to get across. Satire and slapstick abound, the jokes were great and actually pretty clever and well paced.Will Ferrell did a great job portraying a satirically narcissistic Holmes and John C. Reilly did an amazing job at playing a "never good enough" Watson. All of the supporting characters were well cast and never felt out of place, or forced and added a great level of humor to supplement the titular characters.All in all, it's a satire by every definition of the word, and if you don't get that, or get offended by everything, stay away from it. Otherwise, turn your brain off and enjoy the ride, it's worth it!
Sometimes I wonder if people just write bad reviews without watching the movie.

Holmes & Watson is easily the worst movie of the year and quite possibly competes for worst movie of all time. It's unyeildingly bad. The jokes are often recycled and every single one falls flat. The story wanders almost aimlessly and the production value is bottom of the barrel. There is seriously nothing redeeming about this movie. Save your money. This is no Step Brothers. This is pure unadulterated trash.
Huge fan of both actors , i really loved their type of humor but this movie is just pure garbage, its embarrassing awkward and stupid

reviews.review_title: Hilarious fresh new take on a wornout detective genre. Hilarious American duo slaughters every bit of sacredness about Sherlock Holmes. And they slaughter it with great wit!
reviews.content: Incredibly UNDESERVED low Imdb rating. Probably due to the politically INCORRECT jokes about feminism, trump, childviolence etc etc. But all the (possibly) offensive jokes are being done with lots of originality, tact and charming wit.The other reason why it has such a low Imdb rating could be due to the wrath of the (older adult) english speaking audience who cant stand to watch 2 American actors slaughter every bit of sacredness of the english heritage of Sherlock Holmes. And that sacredness of Sherlock Holmes DOES GET SLAUGHTERED. Bravo! It needed to be slaughtered, to make a fresh new start. To bring back new life to this Sherlock Holmes detective genre, which was nearly bled to death with boring remakes.It is an actor's movie, and I mean that very complimentary. However silly everything may get, there is still lots and lots of good acting to be enjoyed by leading and suporting roles. Ralph Fiennes has a great suporting role and so do many other great English actors.Everything is pretty farcical, but executed with great attention for detail and with marvellous jokes and good acting.Yes, some of the jokes are obnoxious (vomitting, childviolence) but it is done in a very funny way and the obnoxious jokes are only used sparsely. I cant see any fault with this refreshing slaughter of the "sacred" Englishness of Sherlock Holmes.

reviews.review_title: Fantastic, but I know where te bad rating come from
reviews.content:
This movie was entertaining, a brilliant performance of Will Ferrell and John Reilly, full of humor, great direction, acting, really a great movie.
All the details are thought of, the way Homes pronounces Moriarty, the scenes where the deduction take place, all fantastic!
But, this movie is one giant statement against Trump and I fear the pro-Trump voters down-rated this movie, what is really a shame. Just go and see for yourself.

I dont understand the bad reviews, this is a comedy, a silly comedy of course because Will Ferrel is in it, you have to come in knowing that then you will find it funny, it is silly at times but you will laugh.

reviews.review_title: It's intermittently amusing but ultimately average.
reviews.content: There are some amusing moments but, on the whole, 'Holmes & Watson (2018)' is just totally average. It's not as bad as most reviews purport it to be but it's nowhere near as funny or generally accomplished as you'd expect from a reuniting of Ferrell and Reilly - who are both often hilarious in real life and made the excellent 'Step-brothers (2010)' together. The film is not as much a parody as it is a cash-in on the relatively recently lapsed copyright associated with the Sherlock Holmes character and his earliest of stories, making for a strange missed opportunity when it comes to where the laughs are (supposedly) coming from. The piece also leaves something to be desired in terms of its story - in particular, the central 'mystery' - and its character arcs, the latter of which are mostly rushed through in a bizarre (and lazy) musical moment towards the finale. I didn't necessarily dislike the experience while it was occurring, but it's almost instantly forgettable and the handful of successful jokes don't exactly make you howl, either. 5/10

reviews.review_title: Without doubt, the worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: I saw this movie a few days ago, well to be honest I saw the first 20 minutes or so and left. I couldn't take any more. The acting is so bad, I mean ridiculously bad. Two Americans putting on this fake English accent so badly, I assume for comedic effect, which failed drastically. The dialogue is pathetic and childish, and the the story poor. I'm surprised this even got a release. I expected more from Etan Cohen and the crew. This movie has no redeeming features at all. None! Utter garbage, and a waste of time money and effort. The biggest question is, why on Earth did they bother.

It's a great comedy. We laughed during the whole movie.
This is not a historical movie, also it is not a murder mistery movie, but it's one of the best comedies.

I was expecting far more from Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly.As the credits open and I saw that Etan Cohen had wrote and directed the film, I was like wow! This is a Cohen Brothers movie!? As the kids say, lit!.But as the credit linger I noticed it said Etan Cohen not Ethan Cohen who is the Cohen brother I was thinking about. Rumor has it Bill Murray made the same mistake when he signed up to do the just as god awful Garfield live-action adaption.I herd that this movie is actually based on a Saturday Night Live sketch. Well it's not the first time SNL turned a successful 12min sketch into a 90min disaster (not the first time in a long shot (thinking of MacGruber as the most recent.). I think I would have rather this flick be some sort of Christmas special that I could watch on NBC, rather than shelling out cash to see it in theaters during the holidays.Calling it mediocre, is just being nice to the usually amazing comedy team up of Farrell and Reilly.

reviews.review_title: This movie plays on an endless loop in hell
reviews.content: Here is my advice to you, if you are currently dating someone and want to break up with them but let them down gently, take them to this movie. I guarantee they will dump you before the movie is over for taking you to see this terrible film. If you are an 8 year old boy you will love this movie.

reviews.review_title: I dont know what people expect
reviews.content: This movie is getting bad reviews but I dont think people are being realistic, the laughter in the theater talks for itself, this was one of the funniest parodies I have ever seen, it is right up there with good ole Mel Brooks.Farells humor is not main stream simple as that but if you like Anchorman whic a lot of people do or Talledega Nights or even one of the best comedies ever made Step Brothers, then this movie is for you, I give it a 10 to even out some of the bad reviews, it ireally i a funny movie, but you dont need to see it in a theater.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't take a detective to figure out how bad this movie is
reviews.content: Everybody everywhere has been saying that Holmes & Watson is literally one of the most abominable pieces of garbage in cinema. And do you know what? THEY WERE RIGHT! THIS MOVIE IS ABSOLUTE GARBAGE! YOU THINK I'M RAGING NOW? WHEN I LEFT THE FREAKING THEATER, I FELT LIKE BLOWING IT UP! THIS MOVIE IS HORRIBLE!What's the story? Detective Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson join forces to investigate a mysterious murder at Buckingham Palace. It seems like an open-and-shut case as all signs point to Professor James Moriarty, the criminal mastermind and longtime nemesis of the crime-solving duo. When new twists and clues begin to emerge, the world's greatest sleuth and his trusted assistant must now use their legendary wits and ingenious methods to catch the killer before the queen becomes the next victim.So what's so terrible about this movie? EVERYTHING!!!!!- well, the worst aspect of this movie has GOT to be the HUMOR. Now, if you're the person who likes silly and mentally insane faces as well as dated pop culture references, then this movie is for you. If you don't appreciate those kind of jokes in your SHERLOCK HOLMES movie, then you're normal. Despite taking place in 1800s London, the things that pass on for comedy in this film is (and I'm not joking either) TAKING SELFIES WITH THE QUEEN. Not only does it make no sense because photography back then was absolute garbage, but it's just not funny. When I saw the trailers for this film, I legitimately thought it was gonna be funny! But it WASN'T! And that made me MAD! Another thing that really sucked about this film was the acting. Despite Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly being a great comedy duo, they were EXTREMELY UNFUNNY in this film. Like I said earlier, there's a ton of annoying and obnoxious pop culture references that aren't even funny in the film, and the duo are responsible for bringing in 85% of this messy dump. And you'd think that although there's all these unfunny jokes that there'd at least be 1 or 2 that legitimately worked, but you're wrong! NOTHING IN THIS FILM WAS FUNNY! In fact, the funniest part of the film was the MPAA screen after the film! So the funniest part of the film wasn't even IN it! MY GOD!In conclusion, don't watch this movie. It's horrible in every way. Just don't watch this. There's much better movies that you can get tickets to, like Bumblebee and Aquaman. And apparently, this movie is so bad, even NETFLIX doesn't want it! THAT should be on the POSTER of this film! Don't waste your time and watch a good movie instead.

reviews.review_title: To laugh or not to laugh - YES is the answer
reviews.content: In England, young Sherlock Holmes is sent to boarding school, where he is relentlessly bullied. UNTIL ONE DAY. Using his detective powers, teen Sherlock reveals his classmates faults and misbehaviors and they are mostly expelled. Thus Sherlock was the primary recipient of all instruction. As he reached manhood, his great knowledge continued as an aid to his solving crimes as the best of the best. One morning, Holmes - Will Ferrell -and Watson - John C. Reilly - are to appear in court to give evidence to convict Moriarty - played by Ralph Fiennes. But, hat choices and buzzing insects delay them to the last minute. Then, to the surprise and fury of many, they say the man in the box is an impostor and he should go free. Whoa. Then, Queen Victoria summons them to a party where clues reveal Moriarty is out to kill Her Majesty in four days. Can Holmes work his magic to prevent this? You may have heard this film is not so great. Don't believe it! There a plenty of laughs as Ferrell and Reilly send up the greatest detective and sidekick of all time. Fiennes and the supporting cast are great as well topnotch sets, costumes, and script. If you need to laugh today, give this one a whirl.

reviews.review_title: Would give 11 stars if I could
reviews.content:
Never in my life have I seen someone try to cut up queen vic, snort coke, and perform the 'Ghost' sex scene on a corpse all within an hour. While it might not have a "plot" or "writing" it was nice to see ralph fiennes in his place as an actor who got a maximum of three lines and existed only to Smirk.
This film is only improved by the fact that Pretentious snobs (who cream their own eclair) hate it.
In short, it was absolutely awful and I loved it. Will see again tomorrow.

I enjoyed so much of this silly comedy and only understood the hate to some extent. It's basically a period piece version of Dumb and Dumber mixed with Step Brothers so that's very important to note! I don't have much to say for this movie, it's just fun and stupid. It deserves a lot better but that's just me because I am a nice critic; also this is my 390th review.

reviews.review_title: Just As Bad As It Looks
reviews.content: As someone who considers Step Brothers one of the funniest films ever made, I knew what I was getting myself into when I bought a ticket to go see Holmes & Watson. This was neither going to be Will Ferrell at his prime, nor was it going to be John C. Reilly trying his hardest. However, with the insane critical backlash this one was getting, akin to legendarily bad comedies like Gigli or Chairman of the Board, I almost felt I had an obligation to see this. My Top 10 Worst of the Year list wouldn't be complete without it. In that respect, Holmes & Watson does not disappoint. It's stunningly awful.The best Will Ferrell comedies are the ones where all of the cast members have a genuine chemistry. They're all working and acting together to get the best comedic moments out of one another. Ferrell's presence inspires and rouses his fellow cast members, but he never tries to steal the limelight from them. Here, Ferrell and Reilly are pretty much in a competition to see who can scream the loudest (There is literally a scene where the comedic duo yells uninterrupted at the top of their lungs for a full minute. I recall myself slinking farther and farther into my chair the longer it went on.) The synergy these 2 had in Step Brothers and Talladega Nights is gone; they aren't acting off of each other, they're just trying to be as over-the-top and absurd as possible on their own. And it doesn't work at all.Ferrell and Reilly also seem to have no idea when to just let their jokes end. There are numerous grating, dragging, painfully unfunny running gags present here; one about Ferrell Sherlock vomiting at a morgue, one about Reilly Watson touching The Queen's hand, one about how eating onions like apples is good for your health. Every one of them is a chore to sit through and goes on far longer than it has too. Even a joke about Ferrell Sherlock poisoning Reilly Watson to test his potential as a detective that starts out pretty funny becomes unbearable by the time its run its course, with Reilly Watson giving unfunny poses and lactating his nipples...I'm as shocked as you are they botched a joke that badly.The whole premise is so confused. Sometimes, it wants to play on the idea that Sherlock Holmes is intelligent to a ridiculous, almost nonsensical degree; think the intellectual equivalent of Zohan Dvir. Other times, it's just Will Ferrell doing the blithering manchild act. There's no consistency between it, no actual direction that this character is going towards. Ferrell playing a comedic take on Sherlock Holmes is an admittedly intriguing premise, but my God, the movie has no idea where to go with it.It's also worth noting just how bad the ADR work is. Characters will frequently have dialogue that doesn't match up with their mouth movements, synced in a way that would be unacceptable in a student film. It completely reeks of a total lack of effort with the studio saying "To Hell with it, reshoots are too hard! Bring the cast to the recording studio to dub over their lines and if it kinda/sorta/not really fits, it's good enough!"I thought Robin Hood (2018) and The Darkest Minds were pathetic in their attempts at social commentary. That was before I watched Holmes & Watson, a movie that literally feels the need to mention Donald Trump by name ("You have the electoral college, which would surely prevent some Trump of a charlatan from gaining power!") This is, of course, after a reference to fake news, Ferrell Holmes wearing a red "Make England Great Again" hat and Rebecca Hall's character going off about how America would never elect a "wealthy tyrant who cares for nothing but himself" (A line that she, amusingly, seems almost pained to deliver) and this precedes Ferrell Holmes and Reilly Watson explaining how they'd want a "strong businessman" and a "showman" for President. I swear to you, I was dangerously close to screaming in the theater at this part.There are also times where Holmes & Watson feels oddly Seltzer & Friedberg-like in its comedy, making pop culture references seemingly out of thin air just because it can. In a scene where Reilly Watson has to fight a strongman in the ring in order to arrest Moriarty (Don't ask), Ferrell Holmes, out of nowhere, starts telling the audience they need to "pay to view" the event. And then Michael Buffer shows up to kickstart the actual fight. It felt like a cut scene from Disaster Movie and marks one of the worst comedic scenes I've ever watched.Other comedic lowlights include Holmes & Watson taking the first selfie with the Queen, Sherlock Holmes calculating the projection of his piss while drunk, a small child kissing a donkey's behind...It's bad. It's really bad, as bad as you can possibly imagine. I'll confess to laughing pretty hard at Ferrell Sherlock's speech about how Reilly Watson's actions allowed the Titanic to make its first voyage ("When you think of your friends and relatives on board the Titanic, just remember, Dr. John H. Watson put them there!") and there are a couple of other moments that are moderately funny (Reilly Watson trying to get rid of bees by shooting them, Rebecca Hall's medical achievements involving exorcising demons, an amusing Billy Zane cameo...Probably some others that I'm not remembering), but nothing that makes this worthy of watching. Stay away unless you need room on your worst list for one more movie.(All that being said, I still hate it less than The Incredible Burt Wonderstone and Bad Teacher.)

Similar to Zoo Lander 2... terrible!! Unfunny, stupid references to TRUMP (get over it) and long winded scenes that have you begging for them to end! I left about 50 mins into it. These guys are obviously great actors however their performance in this movie is lacking comedy and is more obnoxious. The popcorn was good.
If you have a sense of humour and love a good Sherlock spoof then it's for you. I love Will Ferrell and step brothers crack me up . 10/10 all the way
I wanted to watch because Will Ferral starred in it, but it's just aweful.
Big fan of all Sherlock films and series. This was very funny and interesting, actors were very good. Recommend watching this.

reviews.review_title: Critics and people are too harsh, just let yourself have fun!
reviews.content: I walked into this movie knowing the horrible reviews and have to say, it's funny and I walked away smiling. I actually laughed so hard at one scene that I almost had to leave the theatre as to not be disruptive, that is incredibly rare. John C Reilly is hilarious and underrated, Will Farrell is hilarious but even better when paired with John C Reilly. So, if you want a movie that will just help you forget the real world and make you smile and often laugh, hard...then give this movie a chance.

reviews.review_title: A masterpiece of silly, fun humour!
reviews.content:
You will not like this movie if you are:
1. a Trump supporter that gets butthurt over a small 2 minute throw-away joke.
2. A gun-toting American "patriot" who gets butthurt over some light-hearted jokes about America
3. A humourless (and might I say, obsolete) movie reviewer, who never gives comedies good reviews anyway (unless they are "indie" that is).
4. An obsessive fan of BBC's Sherlock who holds that version as sacred and sees anything having fun with the Holmes story as sacrilege.
5. Someone who just doesn't know how to have fun.You will like this film if you are:
1. Someone who knows how to have fun.
2. Someone who understands and enjoys this kind of light-hearted, silly humour.
3. Probably not American, and especially not a Trump supporter.
4. A fan of previous Ferrell movies like Step Brothers etc.
5. Just a stand-up, awesome person.

I have read so many bad reviews about this movie and it's obvious haters are going to hate.I thought this movie was absolutely hilarious.
If you loved Talladega Nights and Step Btothers, then go check it out.Thanks for the laughs Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly.
I am looking forward to watching it again so I can pick up on the jokes I missed the first time.
If you liked step Brothers and talatega nights then you'd like this one too. Period

Loved it! Saw it New Year's Eve in a full theater. It was absolutely hilarious and everyone was laughing throughout the entire movie. There was so much in the movie with jokes and sight gags, I want to see it again. I think the negative reviews are coming from people who didn't get the jokes. The movie will appeal much more to an older versus millennial crowd for that reason. If you love Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly, don't miss it. You will laugh a lot!

All I can say about this film is that it was absolutely terrible. Sure, every few years they attempt to redo the Sherlock Holmes story, and some of them are actually pretty good. The problem with this one was that it was trying way, way too hard. In fact it tried so hard that it completely fell flat on its face. Sure, maybe I was attempting to compare it to the Guy Ritchie version that appeared a number of years back, but honestly, even if I put that one out of my mind, this film still would have been incredibly bad.
In a way it is supposed to be a comedy, but as a comedy I found that it was just so not funny. Sure, I may have laughed a couple of times, and there were a few chuckles coming from people in the cinema, but a part of me would shake my hand and wonder what it was that they found to be funny. Okay, they did actually use that famous 'no s*** Sherlock' phrase that has since come into our collective consciousness, but honestly, it would have been so much funnier if it was muttered in Infinity War when Iron Man and Doctor Strange were both on stage at the same time (apparently they were going to do it, but decided against it).
In part, it is supposed to be that Holmes is a bumbling fool, and that Doctor Watson is actually the smart one - except it doesn't work. Well it isn't even like that because Watson comes across as stupid as Holmes was at times, and it didn't even work that way. Oh, and the whole 'Dr Moriarty isn't Dr Moriarty' didn't work as well, and a part of me was surprised that Ralph Fiennes stooped so low as to even appear in this movie despite the fact that he did very, very little - maybe he was just a little too expensive.
Yeah, honestly, this is another one of those films that I would highly recommend that you completely avoid because it is a complete and utter waste of time. Then again, it did mean that I could catch up on a but of sleep, not that I really needed it, but then again it was so bad, and so boring, and so incredibly silly, that I would have had a much more productive day if I had just stayed in bed.

reviews.review_title: Really not as bad as most think.
reviews.content: Seriously, if you like weird, slapstick humor, know anything about Sherlock Holmes and the late 19th century, you'll laugh more than a handful of times. Yes, there are dumb parts, granted, but some scenes had me rolling. It's enjoyable. If you don't want to go to the theater, rent it later.
Great film, perfect watching if you want a bit of fun.
I thought this movie was hilarious! Yes the humor was dry and simple, but we laughed from beginning until the end. Some folks need to just stop watching movies if they want to be so critical.

I really can't believe all the negative comments on here. This is a great comedy from Will Ferrell and John C Reilly. It is slapstick and silly but just what you expect from these two. It isn't supposed to be an accurate portrayal of Sherlock Holmes and I read one comment that read it isn't 'historically accurate'. No it isn't. It isn't meant to be. It's a COMEDY. I would say if you love slapstick and have enjoyed the other films from these guys then go and see it. I found it very funny and entertaining and that's all it's meant to be.

reviews.review_title: I don't understand why everyone is so upset
reviews.content: It really wasn't that bad of a movie. Everything was funny but it was family friendly. If people wanted stepbrothers they should've stayed home and watched that. It was PG-13 so people should've know what they were walking into

reviews.review_title: Very amusing if you have an open mind
reviews.content: We thoroughly enjoyed the movie. There is *no* way that it deserves to be eviscerated as it is by so many on here. It must be a mob think mentality or pro-Trump presidency crowd because there are a small number of anti-Trump jokes.Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly have excellent timing and really held the film together. Other reviewers on here have complained that the jokes were telegraphed as if that was a negative; I felt the fact that they were telegraphed made them all the funnier because we were in on the joke that these two were so clueless as to not realize what was going on. For example, when Holmes and Watson take turns slapping each other in the face to try to kill a mosquito. The timing is superb! With straight faces these guys slap away obvilious to the fact that they are becoming Moe and Larry Howard from the three stooges.OReilly's reaction to Holmes' "disguise" is uncommon in its sincerity. Watching Holmes create Watson's disguise is a hoot if you are not a stuffed shirt.Some of you maybe needed a cocktail to let down your walls. I predict this film will become a cult classic one day.It's definitely closer to a 10. than a 1. A 1? Nuts! Sad 1 Star reviewers missed out on the fun.

reviews.review_title: Wish I could give this a 0.
reviews.content: Probably the worst film I have ever seen and I have seen Disaster Movie. Will Ferrell has join the Adam Sandler tier of fooling audiences and stealing their money. John C. Riley deserves better- he's an actual actor. Oh, and, spoiler alert, if you've seen Talladega Nights, you've seen Holmes and Watson. Can't wait for Red Letter Media to tear this film apart.

It's terrible it really stinks badly. The jokes they try just don't come off at all.If you are looking for a comedy Sherlock Holmes movie, look up Without a Clue, it's from 1988 and very funny, everything this movie isn't.
Even in the sourest of moods one may fine solace in this movies' comedy. You will laugh dammit!!! I would love to see a sequel to this. The bit with the Queen at Holmes place. Omg. I just laughed.
Hilarious film. Laughed the whole way through. Can't understand the bad reviews. We need a "Holmes And Watson 2"

reviews.review_title: Way better than people are giving it credit for
reviews.content:
Normally, I would give this movie a 6 but to see that it was rated so low bothers me, so I'm giving it a 10. I actually laughed before the movie started! That's worth a 5 right there!
Yes, it's no Brother Where Art Thou..but nothing is. :) fun silly movie

Think of the worst thing you have ever smelled. Now multiply it by a trillion. This movie stinks worse than that. I'm tired of Hollywood thinking anyone wants to be subjected to politics when they pay their hard earned money to be entertained. This movie should come with a warning: Not Funny, Not Satirical, Boring, Political. They should pay people to watch it, not the other way aro.

Probably the worst Sherlock Holmes movie I've ever seen. It's probably the worst Will Ferrell movie too, but it's up there with Step Brothers. None of it was funny. It was just stupid. And it genuinely disrespected a great literary legend.

Really bad end to a wonderful Christmas day.I laughed 2 or 3 times during the movie but the laughs were very forced. I wanted the movie to be funny. I really wanted to feel like it was worth my time/money but had I not paid to see this I would have left.I'm 57 years old and this is by far the worst movie I've ever sat through. Almost no laughter in the theatre and tons of negative comments from others as we were leaving.Really beyond me how this "movie" ever made it to the screen.I was done bashing this movie but I just had to click a yes/no question as to whether this review contained spoilers. I have absolutely no idea how I could spoil this movie with a review. There is no plot to spoil. The Butler did it!? That may be a spoiler.....There is almost no comedy. There really is no movie to review. WOW!

reviews.review_title: I don't understand the hate, folks.
reviews.content: Its John C. Reilly and Will Ferell. Did everyone expect it to be serious? To me its of the same caliber as Talladega Nights. Wacky, Slapstick and just as good. If you know what to expect, you'll love it.

A great cast, production and costume design to be wasted on a played-out witless script. Applying the same humour from previous Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly 'Buddy' flicks seems to get lost in a period setting.If it wasn't for the minor positives such as the cast, e.g. Kelly M.acDonald, etc, it would have been a complete waste. Not the worst film ever but.

reviews.review_title: It's silly and a fun time
reviews.content: I feel like the bad reviews are from people who wanted to either see this be step brothers 2 or another version of Guy Ritchie's Sherlock Holmes. I liked it I expected not to but it was funny. Stupid? Yeah 100% but not in a bad way. It won't take you back in time on an epic Sherlock mystery adventure layered with dry wit, clever comebacks, and plot twists, but if you want to laugh and not think you are more intelligent than the movie go see it. Everyone in the theater I was in was dying laughing.

Holmes & Watson is a movie to be watched while keeping in mind that it will probably disappoint. There were some funny moments, not many, but at least there were some. The concept was kind of interesting as well. So, for a parody, it was fine.

Loved all the politics! Especially the TRUMP jokes, and American gun jokes. This is equally as good as other films. The talledega brothers have down it again. Didn't even need popcorn for this one. Just a hot soda.

Take your brain out, sit back and do not remotely think seriously or how it is so not Sherlock Holmes and doctor Watson. What it is, is a movie that is stupid, senseles and what! There are many real funny moments and it does sort of flow with a story. I have watched many movies and thought how I lost hours of my life but if you take it for what it is, it's ok.

reviews.review_title: Great cast, not so good script - again
reviews.content: Just like Coen & Ferrell's last collaboration, Get Hard (2015), this film has a great cast, but not so good script. The comedy is generated from the chemistry and talent of the actors, and very sparingly from the writing or director's chair.Ferrell has a pretty good track record on buddy comedies (especially with Reilly), Coen is now 0-for-2 with Ferrell. For the sake of their careers, I hope there is no third attempt.

reviews.review_title: You don't know what you're talking about.
reviews.content: Just watched this film, with no high hopes after reading everyone's 1 star reviews. I thought it was great. The start was quite slow, but with laughs throughout. The second half was great-lots of humour and John C. Reilly's acting being fab.People need to stop grouping together and rating it 1 star when it deserves 5 stars at least.

I am really not sure what people expected. I actually read one review that said it was "historically inaccurate"... LOL! Wonder what that guy was thinking??? My God, some of the negative reviews are really hilarious! "They were doing selfies in the 1800's" (Hello, "self photographs" were not a thing in the 1800's - that's why it was funny!) We saw the movie on Christmas Day, in a totally packed theater, no one left, no one groaned, people laughed (probably not as much as my husband, who happens to be English - he roared throughout the entire movie!) Simple, slapstick, movie... I loved the little musical number (another thing people complained about) It was totally unexpected, random, caught me off guard, for sure, and I laughed out loud - and it was composed by Alan Menken (who is an Oscar winning composer for several Disney movies) Any review with "I left after the first 10-15 minutes" should be deleted, because their review is not valid, they didn't even SEE the film. Yes, there were political jokes - which were hilarious! *seems a lot of the offended are Trump supporters, so keep that in mind, I guess. It wasn't Shakespeare - wasn't supposed to be. We enjoyed it.
Why all the bad reviews? Goodness me.. it's meant to be a holiday movie. Exactly that, we enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: Holmes & Watson - Cinema with CJ Review
reviews.content: Holmes and Watson does not offer high hopes going into it. The film currently sits at 6% on Rotten Tomatoes and at one point had the dreadful honour of being completely at 0%.Watching it confirms the fact that it is entirely rotten. Which is an absolute shame. Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly are comedy greats and usually together their humour is multiplied...but clearly the problem lies in the script and direction.Both duties fall under Etan Cohen, not to be confused with Joel and Ethan Coen and definitely not to be confused with Joel Cohen, writer of Garfield. Of all the Coen/Cohen's in Hollywood, we've found our Paul W.S. Anderson equivalent.Previously the filmmaker behind Ferrell vehicle Get Hard, it's amazing to see someone get worse, particularly this worse.Holmes and Watson has all the trappings of a Sherlock Holmes story and all the trappings of a potentially great comedy handled with the grace of the Running of the Bulls through the World's Largest China Shop. So inefficient and unfunny, it's definitely not great when you look around at the silence caused by the severe lack of jokes in the minutes before the opening credits (except one person in my screening, but there's always gonna be one intergalactic alien trying to fit in as a secret human).The film is severely bland and lacking, full of choices that seem completely misguided. Ferrell decides to put on a strange accent for Holmes that doesn't work at all, and Reilly's Watson is overly and unfunnily violent, yet these are choices never dissuaded by the director, which is concerning.Holmes and Watson has a story, if you can believe that, one where Moriarty (played by the criminally underused and probably overpaid Ralph Fiennes) has a presence, but is harshly pushed to the side in favour of an invisible antagonist you can figure out by spoilers by billing.On a completely unrelated note, Kelly MacDonald is in this movie and she continues to be brilliant and brilliantly Scottish in the things that she makes, and while her character is there for a bunch of anachronistic jokes and pushed to the side too, when her arc thins out it feels like it was a good idea made sour at the drop of a hat.Somewhere, in this movie, there is a joke. I guess. I hope. Much like A Million Ways to Die in the West and other films of that ilk, the only thing that made me laugh was a heavy reference to a much better film that had humour in the fact it took you completely out of the movie you were watching, because it's safer.Holmes and Watson is a hollow entry to round out the year of comedy movies. Alan Menken and Glenn Slater offer the second closest thing to a joke with an original song that's a parody of their work that's nothing compared to Vanelope's "I want" song parody in Ralph Breaks the Internet.Everything in this movie has been done better and bigger and funnier and smarter. Hell, even the overrated later episodes of BBC's Sherlock itself parodies itself better, even down to a drunk Sherlock scene that doesn't have to stoop so low as this movie does for an attempt of a laugh.It joins a bunch of movies I would give no stars to if I could, but the sheer fact that somehow this movie made it from conception to the silver screen is some sort of commendation. Plus it has a Titanic joke that makes no sense, but it makes more sense than the entirety of the film.And before you say something, yes, the majority of jokes in this film are indeed out of time. And out of this world.Which is not a good thing.1 Star.CJ

reviews.review_title: Stop taking this movie so seriously.
reviews.content: It's not legitimately intended to be a Sherlock Holmes movie... I mean, it's a Will Ferrell movie. Those are never serious. Ever. If you like him, his type of humor, and his other movies, then you'll definitely enjoy this one. It's definitely not Step Brothers or Talladega Nights level good, but I believe it's a step above Anchorman. I laughed out loud a few times and was never bored. Yeah, some parts were kinda icky.... BUT IT'S WILL FERRELL!!
Not only did this film live up the expectations that a Ferrell film would be full of idiotic, slapstick humour but it also made fun of MAGA lunatics, which is always a bonus.

What a waste. Ferrell and Reilly's previous team-ups were great, so it seems the lack of Adam McKay is the deciding factor here. This movie is so dreadfully unfunny that not even an inspired musical number can save this failure. The story is filled with lazy Sherlock tropes that have been done to death and don't forget about about the pathetic Trump bashing that had to be thrown in.

reviews.review_title: Jumpin' Jesus and Mary in a sidecar! What a fecal pile this movie was!
reviews.content: My wife and I watched it yesterday to a packed house. A house packed with vacant space. This should have warned me that the next 90 minutes was going to be minutes I am going to lose forever and have nothing valid happen other than reclining in the comfy theater chair and know my wife is by my side suffering with me.The best thing about this movie was the questions it brought up such as "How did this script ever get a green light for production???" "What horrible secrets do the producers know about Will Ferrel and John C. Reilly for them to sign onto this movie???" and "Did we really just blow $16 to recline comfortably and absolutely no other reason?" These questions and many others are what actually made this movie entertaining to us.I laughed exactly one time at a 3 second portion of the autopsy scene. So 0.000555% of the movie was 10 stars, so it has that going for it.All in all, go in drunk, bring some beers with you, expect absolutely nothing funny (except that 0.000555%) and look at your phones for the entirety of the movie and you have yourself a winner!

The low reviews on here say more about the IMDB crowd than the movie itself. Anyone reviewing this with one star is inaccurate and motivated by other influences.It's a silly movie. If you enjoy watching Will Ferrell, you will probably enjoy this.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie I've seen, but how does something fail so badly?
reviews.content: I've been known to skim a review or few before going to the movies, but I didn't before seeing "Holmes and Watson". Good Lord do I regret that move.This is ninety minutes of ill-advised and half-assed jokes, delivered in terrible English accents and seemingly with malicious intent. Any goodwill Reilly and Ferrell have earned from their previous outings is gravely wounded.Let me put it like this: even my wife - far more forgiving than myself - had to admit this was awful. Tired and mind-numbing, it's the kind of movie that left me wishing I'd just gone to "Aquaman" instead. And I'm pretty sure that's a rental.

Irony: "You'll laugh until you die." Post-Irony: "You'll wish you were dead." The work has not changed, the culture changed. How it weaves both post-irony and irony it confuses both audiences. As post-irony their failure was a rousing success. As irony. The consequence of hollywood's success dilutes the global culture as post-American. Meaning, Bush/Obama era idiocy and lampooning western prosperity expired with Trump where the lampoon became the story. So its subversion is life already, and then it's not useful. Look how it delivers the most preposterous rendition of its brand, because no one can tell the shades apart. The brand functions outside its delivery. This is very 21st century is the streamlining of brand. With its 'wearing of hats' as identity exchange which is transient about appearance selling the lie. The product is always the same it's just different hats. Like Taco Bell the same food across one hundred items on the menu but in different shapes. Holmes's convolutions were so frequently wrong but his associative non-linear thoughts were consistent with his brand, so still viable by the societal forces. "It's Holmes so it must be right." Apply this to everything and we have the vessel for complete societal failure. Moriarty was not Moriarty, Watson was not Watson, reality is not reality. None of it's plausible but it becomes real because he said it. It's the thinking itself, an entire film about funny ways of thinking, which is wonderfully abstract.
Seeing the ratings I was expecting a horrible movie, but it was alright. I thought I would turn it off after a couple minutes, but I ended finishing it because it did make me laugh a bit.

reviews.review_title: Ham with a side of Ham please
reviews.content: Absolutely EVERYTHING about this film was comedy genius from start to finish, Take a big piece of Hammed acting and a marrow along with the use of "unchained melody" in an eroticised autopsy and a moustache disguise and your golden.. If you like their films you will no doubt like this one also.

reviews.review_title: In the spirit of great comedy teams I counter your 1 star rating!
reviews.content: In the spirit of classic comedy teams this movie is brilliant in its own right. So many reviewers admitting that they only watched 5-10 minutes of the movie then being so arrogant and close minded to rank this movie with one star. Ludicrous, I say! This movie reminds me of a childhood classic with Don Knotts and Tim Conway, The Private Eye's. I think we could see more of these slapstick films from this comedy duo if they'd cut the budget down a bit, like quiet a bit. I'm pretty sure these guys can maintain the physical humor without all the C.G., just make these films to have fun and entertain us all the while still making a few bucks for the studio in the process. If you had ever had the pleasure of listening to the audio commentary by Tim Conway on the Private Eye's DVD you'd understand where these kinds of comedic duos are coming from. They really enjoy making these movies for their fans, and I for one like the way these two guys play comedy off each other. Well, I hope to see a Holmes and Watson 2; Coming to America, perhaps even running into Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall across the saloon. Ha Ha Ha, I know bad but that's why these two are making the big bucks and I'm just here reviewing the movie...lol.

Politics aside - there are a lot of really great laughs. There were a lot of "face-palm" moments. You have to ask yourself "did that really just happen?"
It was so funny!!!

reviews.review_title: First movie I've ever walked out of
reviews.content: Never have I ever been so bored, disgusted, and repulsed by a movie. My family and I collectively decided to walk out about an hour in, realizing what a waste of time this film has been. There are so many better movies in theaters right now- please, please, please stay away from this hot garbage.

This movie exactly what it claimed to be in the trailer: not a masterpiece with very expensive scenes, but a mild comedy.
Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly gave a reasonable satire of Holmes and Watson, especially when calculating situations.
Etan Cohen made an interesting innovation by bringing Billy Zane as himself in the movie and providing a good satire of the movie Ghost.
The selfie photograph scene with the Queen was my favorite.
I liked the movie because it was what I expected it to be.

Awsone movie people are giving bad reivews are just lonely people with out stuff to do who rather see other movies that came out this month make more money and boycott this movie so certain movies a get more veiws watch it see for your self

reviews.review_title: I walked out of the theater.
reviews.content: This is the first time in my life I ever walked out of a theater. This movie is total garbage. Both Will Farrell and John C. Reilly (both of whom I've liked in other films) humiliate themselves in this. I didn't chuckle once! All I was did was cringe at the dumb jokes and idiotic gags. The story was one of the lamest things I've ever seen and the acting just awful. This movie is simply unwatchable. Please do everything you can to avoid it!

If you go in with low expectations it's pretty good
Doesn't deserve the hate

The arrogance of two one notes (Will Ferrel, John C. Reilley) reappearing in different periods in different costume with the same exhausted heavy handed and abrasive routine to be found in previous works together is an idea that should have been strangled in infancy. Just who, where and how did the makers convince anyone that an already glutted Sherlock Holmes market would need this travesty featuring two crass American actors rewarming the insipid interplay found in all their other arch comedies together?Is anyone surprised that the film's genesis was an SNL skit. Well this is an extended one that runs beyond an entire show with about 2 minutes of laughs but without the hootin' and hollerin' urban moron audience to respond to an applause sign.
Ferrell's been washed up for some time and Reilley may still be a decent character actor but this teaming grew tiresome last century and given its packaged and stale routines creates the impression that producers, writers, and directors were hanging with Walt Disney and Ted Williams since the turn of it. A solid contender for worst film of the year.character actor but this

Honestly, I don't get how everyone doesn't get it?! Love both of these guys and I died laughing! Huge fan of Will and John and the movie was pretty solid. Definitely not Step Brother but didn't expect it to be!

This has to be by far the worst movie that Will Farrell and John C. Reilly movie haveeither done. It ranks as bad and Kung Pao: Enter the Fist. It wasn't worth sitting through the first 20 minutes. If you want a movie to put you to sleep, or just flat out bore you beyond measure, than by all means, watch it. If not, save your time and money and do something else. This is a flat out insult to the Sherlock Holmes series of books, movies and shows.

So many talented performers and such potential. All wasted. All of the humor is juvenal and odd, but not odd in a funny way, just odd. The writing is awful and there is nothing clever, just one lame gag after another. I'm a big fan of Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly but not enough to like this unfunny mess.

reviews.review_title: It's a comedy, not an Oscar film people
reviews.content: It's a funny movie, and I'm not sure why people are giving it hate. It's meant to make you laugh, not awe you or inspire you. The plot is odd and so are the characters but the movie is funny. If you don't find it at least half-funny then you probably have an awful and unsophisticated sense of humor. Those that are upset are probably triggered Republicans since they poke fun at Trump a few times! Got over yourselves movie snobs, take it for what it is!

I would begin this review by saying that everything is relative, let's think of abstract art, for example, at first glance you would be temped to say it was painted by a 5 year old child, but because it received the appreciation of some art critics, people have seen this current in a positive light, I think the same thing happened here, people read the negative reviews and the subconscious rated the film as a bad one from start.
I personally amused and laughed a lot, is not this the purpose of a comedy ?! If you have a cinematic culture, you're already familiar with the Will Ferrell style and you know the expectations, if you are alergic to peanuts don't eat them.
Haters gonna hate anyway.

reviews.review_title: Some funny parts (in my opinion), not the worst movie ever or as bad as some reviews make it seem. Not the best movie ever either.
reviews.content: It had some funny parts to me. The story is almost non-existent. The movie reminded me of Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby with that same type of dumb humor, except there wasn't as much foul language. The movie was good as long as you know what you are getting into, and it wasnt as bad as some of the reviews make it. My family (all adults) laughed out loud several times. Although afterwards, we all had the same opinion it was okay, and not our favorite movie ever. It was good for some laughs.

reviews.review_title: Attempting to Uncover the Secret Of Comedy
reviews.content:
Sherlock Holmes has many forms, some of which are immortalized in our minds and others we wish could get a face lift and some reinvigoration. Nevertheless, the eccentric detective of Scotland yard gets another revisit this holiday season, this time with a much more comedic direction than most versions tend to focus on. Can the legendary comedian team that gave us Step Brothers, step up to a new relationship? Robbie K is here to share his thoughts on the another review as I take a look at the film:Movie: Holmes and Watson (2018)
Director:
Etan Cohen
Writers:
Etan Cohen, Arthur Conan Doyle (Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson were created by the late) (as Sir Arthur Conan Doyle)
Stars:
Will Ferrell, John C. Reilly, Ralph Fiennes
LIKES:Quick Run Time
Funny At Times
References To Other Versions
Secondary Character Was Funny
The SongSummary: As the reviews come in, you are seeing a lot of negative components, but I can say that despite this not being everyone's cup of tea, the movie at least is short, running around the 1 hour and 20-minute mark, meaning you'll get out of there fairly quickly. In this short film, the movie manages to find some nuggets of well-timed lines that somehow held some wit behind the bantering. Often for me it had to do with the references to other versions of the detective, with nods to the Robert Downey Jr and Benedict Cumberbatch creations that are super popular. When it comes to these moments that is the component that I found the most entertaining. Well that and the secondary character of Millie, whose simplistic bouts of nonverbal comedy had some of the better time laughs than either Ferrell or Reilly could drum up. Of note though, the little song number that Ferrell and Reilly get to perform had some zest to it, so I give them props for including that.DISLIKES:
Paper Thin Story
Mystery Was Boring
Lazy Writing
Too Forced Of Humor
Missed Comedy Opportunities
Fixation on Banter
Diving Down Politically Heated Topics
Summary: Holmes and Watson's first weakness comes from the paper-thin story they tried to sell with the comedy antics. A very simplistic tale that tries to throw in shallow character development and a mystery, this version certainly did not focus its efforts on trying to have something to ground the comedy too. The mystery itself is lackluster and overshadowed by the ridiculousness of the film and given the obvious answer as to whom is the culprit, makes for a plot that will have difficulties standing up to the law of good movies.
Of course, most fans of Ferrell may not really care or expect the story, because he is after all known for being the king of slapstick, banter, and inappropriate comedy. While this movie follows that formula, it's writing did not quite match the quality of other Ferrell flicks and not just because of the missing story. Holmes and Watson had trouble finding its stride, forgoing classic one-liners for mindless banter and arguing between the titular characters, or extended bouts of over the top slapstick that didn't pack the punch the scenes sound effects had. It was comedy that was too forced for me, the lines blunt displays of stating the political injustice we still complain about, which doesn't have the intended prowess it wanted. When those styles failed, they switched to the obsessive self-pleasing jokes that although had good chemistry between actors, again treaded down the gross pathway instead of the funny for me. And the worst part is, all of it is in forced accents, the characters pushing into overdramatic displays of emphasizing the words in very forced accents. All of this boils down to work that either has grown too stale to work in the modern age, or was too forced and lacking the finesse earlier films held.The VERDICT:Holmes and Watson's trailers have not sold you any lies, it's a mess of predictable plot antics with overzealous comedic attempts that the two are famous for. Yet the film does not have the same quality that the duos first film had all those years ago. Is it because the comedy is stale, or is the focus on being too forced of comedy? I don't know the answers, but there is some serious need for plot development and better-balanced comedy to assist for any future installments. As such, the movie missed its mark on a lot of things, needing to step back to the clever tipoffs, and timing than overstuffing the film with comedic banter. Thus, I can't recommend this one for the theater, encouraging to hold out until Netflix picks it up. Sorry guys!My scores are:Adventure/Comedy/Crime: 5.5-6.0
Movie Overall: 4.0-5.0
After an early scene with a mosquito (which took a good five minutes of wasted air time) I knew, jolly good, to fast forward to the final five minutes already..and that was that.

First, I've never seen a movie with these two in it that makes me laugh. Ferrell is a hack at best who does the same stupid faces and idiotic laughs in every movie. Reilly - how does this one trick pony even get a job? I will admit that Sherlock Holmes does lend himself to parody, not stupidity. This movie goes on the "why doesn't imdb have a zero rating"? Just one of the worst, unfunny pieces of trash ever foisted on an unsuspecting public. Everyone who paid to see this should demand their money back.

reviews.review_title: Whatever remains, however improbable, must be FUN!
reviews.content:
Never mind the cynics, make your own mind about this. I'm not a huge fan of Ferrell - he can be terribly self-indulgent (and there are elements of that here), but when he gets it right he is very funny. Reilly is always good value. They make a great team in this, with some real belly laughs resulting (the accents especially made me guffaw - pronunciations reminiscent of the Gendarme in Brit sitcom 'Allo 'Allo!)
The plot is satisfying with a couple of neat surprises and a really good ending/coda.
It's exceedingly silly, knockabout fun. Put your brain in neutral and enjoy.

The reviews I've read about this film just go to prove you should never rely on others opinions, my gf and I thought it was funny all the way through, maybe the humour was aimed more at the English, if you like Ferrell and Reilly then watch it, in fact don't even read any reviews just watch it and make your own mind up....I like others would have probably given a 5 but because of the people giving a 1 I'm giving it a 10, just goes to show the rating system on here ain't worth s##t!!!

reviews.review_title: A silly take on the classic tale. What did you expect?
reviews.content: When I saw the trailer for this I laughed a few times, which was enough to raise my interest in seeing the movie. Then I read that all the reviews said it was awful and I was surprised because Farrell and Reilly are usually good together.After seeing it I can say that it's not nearly as terrible as people say. I don't get what all the hate was about. Sure, there are some pretty dumb moments, but I was mostly laughing throughout. It's basically a silly/slapstick comedy, which is clear from the trailer.Also, I didn't see any of the "sloppy editing" and "shots out of focus" that's listed in the trivia, and I don't get why people would have walked out en masse as claimed. I've seen far worse.All in all I don't know what people were expecting, but if you liked Farrell and Reilly together previously then you'll likely enjoy this as well. It's not quite as good as Step Brothers, but I definitely did not regret watching it.

There's no denying it that this movie is pretty bad but its that good bad, you know like Sharknado.
Ferrell and Reilly's accents were shocking, acting was terrible and the plot messy. Although some of the jokes actually had me laughing out loud, especially the post drinking scene, where Downey's Sherlock was lampooned.
No where as good as Step Brothers but it's still enjoyable, if I were you switch your brain off before watching, you might enjoy it too.

reviews.review_title: People, it's Will Farell, and you expected a good movie?
reviews.content: Seriously. The man hasn't made a watchable movie in his life. You went to this thinking it sounded good? Fool me once shame on you. Fool me for the 30th time shame on me for not getting professional help...

reviews.review_title: The Most Underestimated and Ripped On Movie of the Year!!!
reviews.content: Holmes and Watson, a comedic twist on the amazing detective that has also been portrayed by Robert Downey Jr (Iron Man) and the great Benedict Cumberbath in the English TV Series "Sherlock." Hit with the amazing duo Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly, it was built up to be quite the masterpiece. However as shown by the horribly untrue reviews, they gave it a fate worse then death, a terrible rating of 3.4! I think the duo did a great job giving the serious and intriguing series that so many of us have fallen in love with. I thought it was constantly funny and Will Ferrell brought a very heartily feel to the otherwise dark and impressive detective that is Sherlock Holmes. I was laughing several times during this movie and I was able to watch the whole thing without walking out. I had not even one single thought of leaving this movie. It was totally worth the money and if they made a sequel I would have no problem paying the money to see this again. When it comes out on DVD, I will definitely get it again to watch. I appreciate everyone else reviews to this movie but I definitely give it a way higher review than that! I give it a 7/10! I think you guys should give it a try too!!!
Watched the whole thing waiting for it to get funny. Never did. Do not recommend at all!

reviews.review_title: Entertaining if you have an IQ of 80
reviews.content: Can you imagine the script meeting: "We have no jokes, no plot humor, let's throw in some anti Trump stuff, and even though we all have armed guards, some anti firearm stuff and maybe people will be happy."
This was so pathetic...i'll give it a 9. Why? Because i think that they wanted people to vomit from the horribly bad film this was... Will F. doesnt disappoint in stupidity. Love that guy.

I'm going to be honest, I hated this movie. I read articles about people walking out of the theatre because it is so bad. I am a huge fan of Step Brothers and it is my favourite movie of all time. In my opinion, Step Brothers was made to be hated but people didn't take it seriously and they loved it.I'd like to think this was the same idea that went into the creation of this masterpiece. The main reason everyone is hating on it is because they took it too seriously. I went into the theatre with the mindset that this movie was going to be horrible and unfunny. I absolutely despised the first 30 minutes because I came in with that mindset.But then I thought, "What if this movie was intentionally made to be horrible? In that case, it would be hilarious!" And that suddenly changed my outlook on the entire film. I thought that the political jokes about the American government weren't made to be funny, but make the viewer very uncomfortable which I found hilarious.A movie like this isn't made to be liked, I mean they are spoofing a universally loved franchise and tarnishing its reputation. This incredible piece of cinema was made to make fun of the people who took it too seriously, just like how Step Brothers did.So go into this movie with the mindset that Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly are making fun of the people who give this movie a 1-Star review, and you will have an incredible time. If that wasn't their intention then yes, I'd probably give it a one star, but they've done this in the past with Step Brothers, and they likely did it again with Holmes and Watson.While it's not as unintentionally incredible as Step Brothers, it is a lot better than people say f you go in with the right mindset (don't laugh at the jokes, laugh at how bad the jokes actually are). <-- that was the intention for this film

Very British style humour, I liked the way it lampooned the BBC version.
It's different but fun.

reviews.review_title: Will Ferrel & John C Riely lose their Midas touch
reviews.content: No. No. No. This is abysmal to watch. This kind of slapstick comedy has no room in 2018/19.If this is what a 42 million dollar production gets you then I feel for the state of the SONY Executives that signed off on this.For a movie this bad, there are totally no "So bad they are good/funny" moments. The opening 20 minutes feel like an eternity and I'm afraid this is the last Will Ferrell movie I'll be watching moving forward!Terrible terrible movie.

I have been anxiously waiting for this movie. I am death and need CC, hence I had to wait until it's was released to cable TV. Viewing the credits I mistakenly thought Ethan Coen was the writer/directer, which added to my excitement. Just imagine, Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Ethan Coen. What an incredible combination, although what turned out to be incredible disappointment. I later discovered my first error. It wasn't Ethan Coen, but Etah Cohen. I was heart broken thinking one of the Coen brother's had written and directed this disaster. I didn't think it was possible. So you can imagine my relief it was some one else. But, there was still the question of Ferrell and John C. Reilly. What on earth would motivate them to be a party to such a disaster? And it was a disaster. From the beginning to the ridicules scene where Watson and Homes were at the morgue, were I quickly turned it off.

The movie was explosively bad. Other reviewers have said it, but it's so bad, it's worth stating again. There were a lot of people that made one bad decision after another to get this trash to the theatre. The film's inept writing, directing, and acting is really rather astonishing. The un-funny gags were telegraphed so badly you couldn't help but see the mediocrity coming, and when the gag came and went while the theatre went silent, I'm certain I've got allies in my review. I'm really disappointed because this movie could have been terrific and side splittingly funny but it missed badly at every level.My biggest gripe, however, was what seemed to be an entire movie made so the writer, Etan Cohen, and others I'm sure, could go political. What a total s**t show. I go to movies as an escape, to enjoy my self, and to take a break from reality. Frankly I'm more than a little bothered having spent my money so Etan can tell me about his politics. I may or may not agree with him, but that's not the point. Do you see my point?There's no spoilers here other than to say this is the worst movie I've ever paid to see; it's political, and I doubt there is anyone on screen I'll bet supporting again. Oh, the one redeeming quality? It's the amazing reclining leather chairs in the remodeled theatre, it was the only reason I stayed.

I'll normally watch any old rubbish, but this is by far the worst film I've ever watched. This is probably the first time I've ever stopped watching a film before the end just because it was so bad. I can't understand how some people are giving it more than 1 star, they surely must be blinded by their fandom of Will Ferrell.

I'm guessing some won't even read this, but for those who do, even though they feel offended by the movie and my rating: I get it. I felt similar when I saw the depiction of Bruce Lee in Once upon a time in America. And I'm not talking about how he fought or how he looked, but the way he was depicted. Arrogant is one thing (he may or may not have been like this or close to that), but the fact he was made to look as though he wasn't smart (to put it mildly).Having said all that, there is more to OuaTiH, something that can hardly be applied here. Because you have quite the silly and really quite questionable depiction of two beloved figures. Not because the filmmakers don't like them, but because they wanted to do something different.And boy is this different. Predictable still and quite the rude humor and a bit dull for some for sure. It's tough to see merits, like the amount of good actors involved in this in smaller roles. You may or may not care, but if you don't adjust yourself into what is going down with this movie, you will have the worst time ....
I didn't laugh a single time at this movie and left the theatre so early.

This is a very underrated movie. I saw the average of 3,4 and thought it's not worth seeing. But then I asked myself: 'How bad could it be?', so I decided to go to the cinema and watch it.
I had in mind from the very start the fact that it is a bad movie, based on previous reviews I had read but it this wasn't the case at all. I enjoyed this movie, it truly made me laugh. I saw good comedy!
It is worth watching, reviewers are way too biased. I mean, you expect to see the comedy of the year? Will Ferrell plays his part very well. So does John C. Reilly. I have seen some of their previous movies and their acting is as good as before.
Geez... to all of this movie's haters - better learn what good comedy is before reviewing...

I saw the bad reviews but thought I'd give it a try anyway just in case. So glad I did, it's hilarious, as someone else has said, the early reviews obviously don't get slapstick. If you like this pairs previous efforts you won't be disappointed. Given 10 to counteract the negative reviews, in reality I'd give it 7.5.

People need to relax! The exaggerated responses to a decent comedy are rather unnecessary. I enjoyed it. I love Will Ferrell movies and I love Sherlock Holmes. This was not the greatest comedy ever but it was funny.Relax people and drop the hyperbolic statements!
Good typical film by Will Ferrell. Kamu did not like the movie just not familiar with the style Will Ferrell. I liked the movie like the previous work of the actor.
Avoid, it will ruin your opinion of these two talented comedic actors. Maybe it's an American thing, I don't know. It's just dreadful.

The movie is hilarious, and as long as you enjoy the dry and slower humor of the Farrell Reighly Duo, you'll die laughing. If you go into this expecting a parody, don't. It is a classic Will Farrell film and is enjoyable all the way through for real fans of the comedy Duo. I would recommend it to any fan!
I was looking for comedy, not stupidity. I stopped watching after 45 minutes or so. There were several TRULY tasteless scenes that were just disgusting and really not funny.

😤. They own us our money back.
Hope they make up for this soon!

reviews.review_title: I'm a Sherlock Holmes fan and I loved it
reviews.content: Best Sherlock Holmes movie I've ever seen. I don't watch many comedies but I loved this

reviews.review_title: I thought it was a funny movie
reviews.content: When I first heard about this movie with Will Ferrel, I thought it would be an awesome and funny movie. I was horribly wrong and for more than an hour I tortured myself to finish the movie. Basically It was an hour an half long unrelated lousy jokes with references to current society and daily struggles.

Laughed all the way. Another classic comedy from Will & John. If your sense of humor is not tolerant and you consider yourself a conservative then sorry because a lot of jokes are controversial jokes which they do so well. Great movie, man. Just jokes all the way trough

reviews.review_title: Disregard the other reviews...This movie is great!
reviews.content: Movie was actually pretty good. I enjoyed every second of it. Acting was good. Everything was great in my opinion. However I think they may have got higher ratings if they didn't label it as a comedy. I did find it funny here and there but I more believe it was a crime thriller with a hint of comedic skits. All in all I liked it alot.
I loved this film and non-stop laughter in the movie theater.

I belongs to the AMC A-List and I'm so glad that I didn't have to shell out hard cash for this movie, I'm not a big fan of Will Ferrell, but I like John C Riley ,so that why I saw it. Anyways , In nutshell this is by far the worse movie of the year !
The humour is silly and slapstick but it works very well it's outrageously pathetic but very brave to poke fun of it self Will and John are the best comedic team ever since step brothers

I love Will Ferrell and John C Reilly, and I am a Sherlock fan, so when I heard this movie was coming out, it was a no-brainer: I had to see it! Prior to going to see Holmes and Watson, my husband checked the reviews, and found most of them declaring "thumbs down", but, hey, EVERYONE I knew LOVED the Titanic movie when it came out, but by the time the main guy in Titanic was going under for the umpteenth time I was ready to push him down myself, so I chose not to judge the Holmes & Watson movie through comments... as I'm sure 'you' are wise enough to do. So, we went, and we laughed, and we got the jokes, and we got the sarcasm, we even got the "TRUMPed" remark, and we laughed again. The easily offended may walk away with their noses in the air, but we got the humour, and we laughed again! Needless to say, we're still Ferrell, Reilly, Holmes and Watson fans!I must say, Ralph Fiennes plays his part so well! The accent he uses stunned me; I never expected that accent to come out of his mouth. I loved it! :D Well done, Mr Fiennes!And Kelly Macdonald!! Good call for Mrs Hudson. It was weird hearing her real accent, lol, but she was great, too!Hugh Laurie, Pam Ferris, Rob Brydon, and Steve Coogan... What can I say; I love them all!!!!!!All in all, a great cast, good plot, and a funny movie! I am hoping there will be a second one!

reviews.review_title: Do not understand all the hate?
reviews.content: So I am assuming this movie is one of those, you either love it or hate it. I do not get why there are so many people hating on this movie. This movie was amazing. It featured the classic comedy duo of Will Ferrell, and John Riley, and was hysterically funny. I will admit some of the jokes there were corny, or broke the 4th wall, but i personally find that funny. Even then the movie in and of its self was great. I guess it's no great Gatsby, but instead a comedy based on the original work of Sherlock Holmes. Honestly I think this was one of the better movies i have ever watched.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the worst film ever made.
reviews.content:
I have just watched this and now I wish I had used the time to have a root canal without any pain relief. This has to be the worst film EVER made. The "jokes" were stale and telegraphed from miles away. The acting even by Will Ferrel standards, was diabolical, don't get me started on the accents, or the weird musical number. I genuinely mean WTF?!?.
Made in similar style and 'homage' to the Guy Ritchie Sherlock home movies it clunks from one scene to another with all the finesse of a bulldozer trying to make a house of cards. If I was Guy Ritchie, I'd sue the film makers for every penny. Some genuine talent appear in this movie (Hugh Laurie, Steve Coogan, Ralph 'Commander Waterford' Feinnes) and all I can say, it must of been one hell of a big payday for them, because they would never be associated with anything this awful otherwise.
If you watched this high, you'd struggle to enjoy one minute of this gosh awful, stinker of a fetid vomit stained movie. It makes the worst of the worst budget movie made by film students, with no budget, no talent and no skill, look like 'Citizen Kane'. Please, please do not watch this movie. If there is any justice in the world every copy of this would be burned and all memory of its creation scrubbed from exsistance.

This must be the most unfunny movie of 2018. Being a fan of the Ferrell/Reilly partnership, I was hoping for something good. Most disappointed.
Holmes is played as some camp weird detective. Not helped by a very bad script, terrible writing and acting and you could tell not even the two main stars were enjoying themselves.
The potential was there for something big what with a major cast. But it fails on every level.
Don't waste your moneyM

reviews.review_title: Will Ferrell should never be the lead in any movie
reviews.content: One of the many problems with this movie is Will Ferrell is not a good lead actor. He's good as a supporting actor in movies like Old School, Wedding Crashers, Daddy's Home (Walberger was the lead), etc. As the lead, his humor gets old fast. Such is the case with this movie. Also, I do not find John Reilly to be particularly funny. Don't waste your money on low budget movies like this.

reviews.content: A very very funny, classic Will Ferrell movie.. Those who understand and appreciate the comedy style of comedians such as Will Ferrel, Andy Samberg, will definitely love this movie. I sincerely recommend

reviews.review_title: Classic Will Ferrell and John C. Rilley Comedy

Not too sure why the hate is so heavy on this movie. It's not groundbreaking by any means, but it still had me chuckling a decent amount of times. I was entertained by it. I didn't go in there expecting an oscar though, so maybe that's the problem?
I hope the ratings aren't due to the clear political jab of the current dude in office. I could just be being paranoid, but we live in marvaleous times. Who knows!Bottomline: it's not as good as Stepbrothers or Talladega Nights, but you'll laugh if you dig WF and JCR. If you're worried, wait until it hits Redbox.

This movie is not even worth the fifty words IMDb is making me write in order to leave this review. Will Farrell and John C Reilly must have been fulfilling some sort of contractual obligation when making this stinking pile of hot garbage. An hour and a half that I'll never get back.

Terrible movie. Just dont watch. Simple.A money grabbing cheap film. Hollywood hasnt released a truly quality film in the last 5 years at least. They realised that the mass population is so idiotic that they will watch anything and pay for anything. They make cheap comedies without true humor and make profit, make hundreds of boring cheap superhero films and make billions in profit, make the same cheap "possession/haunting" horror films and still make huge profit.We are to blame for their dissinterest in making quality memorable films.
