The Parody of mathematical planning during the fight scenes are particularly brilliant.
If you've got a British sense of humour you'll enjoy this. Certainly a lot better than Ralph breaks the internet.

Definitely worth watching if you understand an ounce of comedic parody of historic Sherlock Holmes!
The chemistry between the two lead characters is spot on!
Highly recommend

reviews.review_title: As always, don't listen to the negative reviews
reviews.content: This is your typical Will Ferrell romp. You don't go in expecting an award-winning feel-good film of the year. Some of the reviews labeling this as the "worst film ever" or "absolute trash" clearly haven't sat through anything The Rock has put out this year. Or maybe the Rock is more their bag? Who knows. This doesn't deserve any of the bashing. I miss the days of actual decent film critiques, not whiny, arrogant reviews from 57 year old guys who just figured out how social media commenting works. This movie is actually funny, like a 6/10 Will Ferrell-kinda-funny. Some big, silly awkward laughs. Enjoy the movie for what it is. Not awful. Calm yourselves, haters. I hope someone hugs you.

The only part of the movie that was unnecessary was when they broke into a musical and the Trump jokes about what a president should be. Why does all of Hollywood have to bring politics into movies. Stick to making movies not politics. Outside of that the movie was really funny. I laughed a lot throughout the movie. People must not have a good sense of humor these days.

reviews.review_title: What's the name of this funk?
reviews.content: Boy what a stinker this POS movie is. Old School, Elf, Anchorman, Bewitched, Talladega Nights, Semi-Pro,Step Bothers are comedy classics. Holmes & Watson blows chunks. I think I may have inadvertently snickered a couple of times before I walked out of the theater.It seems like there was no script--just a rough outline with Ferrell and Reilly ad libbing and falling flat 99.999 % of the time. You will be throwing away good money if you wait for it to go to DVD which it should in about another week.

It's not even funny. It seems that Will Farrell has lost his talent for comedy by using the same formula over and over again. I did try to watch this to the end and stopped when he broke out in song. The character of Sherlock Holmes is inconsistent throughout the entire movie. One moment he is a deductive genius and the next moment he is an idiot who stumbles upon himself. Watson's character is no better and it left me sad to see these two characters turned into fools for the sake of a couple of cheap gags. As the years have gone by I keep finding myself discovering that the newer comedy is not as funny as it used to be. It seems daft to me the attempts that comedians go to make the audience laugh these days. Homophobia, misogyny, drug abuse and physical abuse are not funny-in fact these things are crimes-but for some reason Hollywood insists in shoving this garbage to the viewer. The studios love it because it costs them very little and they expect huge profits with a formula that is outdated.

Really wanted to like this movie, but it was really not funny at all. We had about 60 people in the theater, and it was silent for 95% of the movie.The acting, staging, costumes were all good. But the humor was non-existent. Several minutes of puking is not funny. The story was tedious, with no surprises. Very disappointing.

I actually really liked the movie laughed non stop all the way up to 45 mins then it died down a little but I had a good laugh and so did the rest of the people in the theater soooooo I don't know why all the hate? Maybe because of the jokes about America? I don't know.
Good mix of moronic and witty humor. Ferrel and Riley in their element and at their best.

Simply put, the worst movie I've ever sat through in the theatre. I should have ditched my carpool and ubered home. After Talladega and Step Brothers, how did this happen? Words fail to capture just how dreadful and horrific this putrid dung heap is. It offends every human sensory faculty, even ones you didn't know existed. It represents the flogging, depantsing, humiliating, torturing, and eventual crucifixion of modern cinema.

It's my sincere hope that everyone involved loses money so that such trash is never produced again. I paid $12.50 for a ticket and almost want to take the producers to small claims court to get it back, it was that bad!

On a day trip out with my son we decided to go to the cinema and see what was on offer. unfortunately the movie intended to see wasn't coming on at a suitable time for us. So we choose an alternative, Which turned out to be one of the biggest mistakes of my life. We purchased our snacks and beverages headed into the screen not knowing what monstrosity we were about to endure. We took our seats which unfortunately was in front of a bunch of people of questionable intelligence and attire. So the movie began From the beginning it was unsettling. The juvenile repetitive unfunny jokes were non stop. The cheap gags and outdated humour which i don't believe was ever amusing, Not to mentioning the terrible acting from Will Ferrell and his counter part. The group behind us seemed to be amused chuckling and repeatedly Stating "it's so funny" Thus proving my point on their intelligence. Then came a part of the movie which was in my personal opinion the worst part and consisted of will Ferrell Consuming an onion at this point the people behind me were in hysterics as though this was the funniest thing they had ever seen. My son was becoming very impatient I assured him it would be ok and it'd be over soon. we came out of the screen absolutely mesmerised and confused as to what we just watched, and how we felt about it. The fact this made it to cinema put me off ever returning.

reviews.review_title: BIG Swing and a Miss From Ferrell and the Gang
reviews.content: I loved Will Ferrell's comedies as a teenager, the original Anchorman and Talladega Nights might be among my favourite comedies of all time. The last Will Ferrell comedy I really loved was The Other Guys. As the years have gone by, I haven't outgrown his movies, but I've realized Will always pulls from the same bag of tricks. When he has some decent material, you can count on him to be funny (the movies I mentioned above, Stranger Than Fiction) but if there's a crappy script or nothing to build off (Get Hard, The House, Daddy's Home 2) he just flails around and embarrasses himself. I don't want to let John C. Reily, Rebecca Hall, Lauren Lapkas, Ralph Fiennes or Steve Coogan off the hook either. None of them come out of this looking good, I felt sorry for them, but they took the cheque and agreed to be in this. I don't like to blame actors and actresses for a movie's failing, especially when its evident they didn't have material to work with, but this movie falls so flat it is embarrassing and nobody elevated themselves beyond the material.A lot of the material for the comedy isn't period accurate, there's jokes around things like selfies and outright allusions to Donald Trump (which I normally would have laughed at, but it was too obvious). That's okay but they contrast that with decent looking sets and costuming to make the movie relatively accurate to the setting in time. This movie had a decent budget and they put it to good use. It makes the movie seem off and pulls the movie out of the decent work that the set designers, makeup artists and wardrobe did.With all this complaining, you might think I'm a Sherlock Holmes purist or offended by the idea of a parody of Arthur Conan Doyle's work. This isn't accurate, I really dug the Robert Downey Jr. version of Sherlock Holmes and the Benedict Cumberbatch/Martin Freeman show. These characters are ripe for a comedic take but Holmes & Watson reeks of improv comedy. That can work but this probably wasn't the right property to do that with. This movie also does every gross-out joke including one where Watson is lactating from poison. Again, gross-out humour can work but it needs to be done with some tact and this felt like just pandering to the lowest common denominator.By the halfway point I was embarrassed to be in the theatre watching this. I'm not above admitting that I chuckled a few times, mostly from jokes delivered by Rebecca Hall and John C. Reily but this was probably the worst movie I saw this year. The stuff that falls flat doesn't just awkwardly hit the ground, it burrows into it. I was hoping that Ferrell and Reily working together again would break Ferrell's recent streak but that didn't end up being the case. Avoid this at all costs whether you're a Sherlock fan or not, I'm giving this a 3.5/10 rounding up to a 4/10.

reviews.review_title: A few laughs overshadowed by groaners and misfires
reviews.content: Holmes & Watson (2018) offers a few genuine laughs, but they are overshadowed by groaners and misfires. To the film's credit, it attempts to find humor at various levels and in various forms, from subtle situational irony to physical burlesque. One viewer's groaner may be another's belly laugh. For me, the fool-triumphant gags worked best, while the most tedious were the clumsy political commentaries and the homoerotic humor. The anachronisms were misses more often than hits, although one involving a camera and another a telegram were amusing. The movie tries too hard to make Sherlock Holmes into Will Ferrell, rather than making Will Ferrell into a caricature of Sherlock Holmes. Neither ever becomes sympathetic or likeable, as do Johnny English and Inspector Jacques Clouseau. The opening scene, where they meet, presents both as unlikeable with no chemistry between them. For that matter, none of the central characters comes off as particularly likeable.Part of the problem is that Watson (John C. Reilly) becomes the protagonist, while Holmes becomes a comic sidekick for much of the film. Watson's character arc is more akin to that of a protagonist. Often in adventure films, the sidekick saves the hero. Here, it is Holmes who must rescue Watson. Watson also does much of the hard lifting in defeating the villain.Some elements are allowed to go to waste. The Baker Street Irregulars are often present, but don't do much of anything. Usually, there is a character who realizes the protagonist is really a buffoon, such as Commissioner Dreyfus and Bough, but H&W has no straight man, other than Inspector Lestrade, who seems more frustrated with Holmes than in on the joke.Production values are excellent. The actors are talented and do as well as might be expected with the material they're given. Writer/Director Etan Cohen has been involved in funnier and more entertaining projects, including Tropic Thunder and Men in Black 3. He was also writer/director on Get Hard. Despite occasional laughs, much of H&W simply isn't funny.

My family and I, who detest those mainstream comedies such as The Big Bang Theory, Friends, Brooklyn Nine Nine etc. due to their reliance on one liners and lack of genuine comedy, were in stitches at this movie. You may see other reviewers on here denouncing the movie as mindless, plotless and crude, and they're actually not too far off the mark. As far as plot and moviemaking goes, this is no masterpiece. The real appeal of this movie is the hysterical comedy. There are some fantastic political references, some hilarious set pieces, and in general just great comedic moments. The reason most people detest this movie in my opinion is because they were expecting a Robert Downey Jr-esque take on Sherlock Holmes, in that the movie is serious, well-plotted and articulate. Well, what I say to these people is, you've literally got dozens of Sherlock Holmes films to watch for these qualities. What the director of this movie has done is thought outside the box a little, taken a vastly different take on Sherlock Holmes than the endless amount of filmmakers before this. This is a rollicking comedic ride, with the lack of plot more than compensated for by the consistent laughs that you get of it. People don't laugh enough anymore, and it is for this that this film is well worth the watch.

Normally love anything with Will Ferrell and John C Reilly, but I would have struggled to laugh if someone had offered me money to do so. And what is up with the audio dubbing?! It's like a badly adapted foreign language movie

reviews.review_title: After this film, my Fiancée looked at me and said "I didn't know a film could be so bad".
reviews.content: I'll begin at the end; upon leaving the screening of this movie, I was reduced to one word, "Wow". I was genuinely staggered by the fact that such a floating turd of a film had somehow managed to hustle itself a cinematic release.Until December 27th, 2018 I was of the opinion that I would watch Jon C Reilly in absolutely anything, "Holmes & Watson" proved me wrong.Steve Coogan, Rob Brydon, Rebecca Hall, Pam Ferris, Ralph Feinnes, Hugh Laurie and Kelly Macdonald will all have to wake up every day for the rest of their lives, knowing that they had a hand on this film, the stink of which must cling to them like metaphorical sh#t to a blanket.Sir Arthur Conan Doyle received a writing credit for this film. I just checked; he doesn't have any living descendants who could try to have this black mark expunged from his career.

Someone wrote a $40 mil + check to bash Trump. Wow.What a waste of time and a movie that some of the stars who put in time here will be eager to forget, then get angry when interviewers want to bring it up. Will Ferrell embarrassed himself with this...just to state his political view.....and you will think twice before seeing an Cohen movie again.And Hollywood wonders why the rank and file hate them, box office numbers are down, and folks are going to streaming.Jim Carrey now Will Ferrell...on the downslopes of their careers because politics became more important than entertainment. The ultimate self indulgence.

One of Will Ferrell's best comedies.
Well acted, great sets and non stop gags that work. Even the music was great.
Only someone who has lost their sense of humour could not enjoy this.

reviews.review_title: The Mystery of the Leaping Fish
reviews.content: At last, a movie that lives up to the hype. "Holmes & Watson" is as awful as audiences and critics forewarned. I'm not a fan of Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly's brand of comedy. Sure, they're fine when they've worked separately on something seriously clever (Ferrell in "Stranger Than Fiction" (2006), e.g., or Reilly in "Stan & Ollie" (2018)), and even their other picture teamings can produce a few laughs from me, but this one is a complete dud. Perhaps, Adam McKay (who directed the other Ferrell-Reilly movies, but not this one) is just a better director than I suspected. Regardless, together, Ferrell and Reilly are like the Abbott and Costello of today: broad slapstick, juvenile banter, flat jokes, and probably better off on TV. I imagine Abbott and Costello may've done something similar with the material of Arthur Conan Doyle. Strip the source of what made it interesting in the first place, pretend anachronisms are funny on their face, add an unimportant romantic subplot for no good reason, revel in regional differences between people (in this case, Americans and Britons) and, when in doubt, act stupid. Maybe if McKay did this one, the timing would've at least been better, or maybe the digs at the gimmicks of the Robert Downey, Jr. versions of Sherlock Holmes would've been amusing.There's a rich tradition of parodying detective Holmes and his stupid friend, surrogate author Dr. Watson, but you wouldn't know it from viewing "Holmes & Watson." And I have no plans to see the also-panned "Sherlock Gnomes" (also 2018) anytime soon... or anytime, really. One of the earliest in film history, if not the first, was the 1916 silent short "The Mystery of the Leaping Fish," which stars Douglas Fairbanks. In it, Doug effectively lampoons Sherlock's drug habit (as opposed to here, where the mere mention of "cocaine" is supposedly funny) while, ironically, employing his detective skills to thwart drug smugglers. I recommend seeing that over-100-years-old film instead of this soon-to-be-forgotten bore.

Their chemistry still works. Just as funny as Talladega Night, not as funny as Step Brothers. We laughed through most of the movie. The song was weird, but I'll definitely buy it when the Blu Ray comes out!

I cant believe some reviewers are comparing this to Peter Sellers and Monty Python stuff. What have they been smoking? This was so bad that it was....so bad. What I dont understand is who throws this kinda of money at these types of movies and How in the world did they get Ralph Finnes to be in this?
Will Farrell can do some good work and he can do some so so comedy but this giant steaming pile is neigher
Also the cameos in here Im betting alot of these actors will never put this on their bio

I watched it all the way through to see if it was as bad as everyone said, it isnt.
It's worse.
Bad script, bad filming terrible accents.
Ok, maybe this movie isn't a 10, but I don't know why the ratings are so low. It's silly and stupid and fun! I enjoyed it and didn't see anyone walking out of the theater.

Don't do it. Don't even attempt to spend another minute wondering if you should see this god awful movie, just to form an opinion of your own. I literally did you the favor for you. I made a conscious decision to see it, wasting $12 bucks and 92 minutes, neither of which I will EVER get back. Please drink a pint of motor oil instead. reviews.review_title: Will Ferrell is done. Just done.
reviews.content: Holmes & Watson is another comedic take on the iconic mystery series by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. In this movie, Sherlock Holmes (Will Ferrell) and Dr. John Watson (John C. Reilly) are assigned to investigate the perpetrator of Queen Victoria's (Pam Ferris) future death on the Titanic. The murderer is their housekeeper Mrs. Hudson (Kelly Macdonald), who is a descendant of Dr. Moriarty (Ralph Fiennes), but don't expect me to analyze her plan because the movie doesn't care. Holmes & Watson is nothing but a barrage of predictable slapstick, insultingly deadly sexual jokes and painful meandering Victorian versions of modern-day references. Not to mention, there's an out-of-the-blue song sequence written by Alan Menken, who probably cashed his big paycheck for a pension fund and must have been ashamed penning such garbage. As for pop culture references, we get numerous allusions to Donald Trump's America, mentions of Fourth Wave feminism, and a cameo from Billy Zane at the end. Speaking of, the most insulting anachronism of all, aside from the drunken telegram sexting and the selfie from the Queen, the RMS Titanic was constructed in 1908 and launched in 1912, several years after Victoria's death. Not only that, the ship sailed not in London but in Southampton, tens of miles away. I know it's pointless to rag on a movie with nothing but comedic anachronism, but the Titanic ship is intentionally part of the storyline, one set in the nineteenth century where most Sherlock Holmes stories take place. Holmes & Watson is not only a downfall for Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly's careers, but also an insult to history, Arthur Conan Doyle's legacy and comedic intelligence. (1 Victorian Selfie out of 5)

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as they say
reviews.content: On the one hand, having read lots of negative reviews I was first afraid of going to watch this movie but on the other, I have a strong trust in John C. Reilly as a brilliant actor and always like his characters. Moreover, I love this Sherlock Holmes stuff and cheap humour, so I decided to go and watch the movie. And you know, I liked it very much. In my opinion, first of all, it is very beautiful by its picture and costumes, secondly, there were no certain naked body parts and downright insults. On the contrary, there were a lot of silly and primitive jokes which I laughed at tears. Yes, there were two moments for me that may seem a little too much but still okay. I loved the interaction between the characters of Holmes and Watson and the actors' play as well. This movie is sure not the worst movie as it is said. I really enjoyed the beautiful picture, good actors' play and simple gags - I cannot ask for more. With my review I would encourage you not to be afraid of watching smth only because it gets negative evaluation.

Everything within this movie can be summed up as lazy, unfunny and incompetent at its very worst. The writing is just as miserably generic, clichéd and atrocious, the humor is downright-flat, the performances are terribly hammy and awful, not to mention wasting much of the remarkable talents of John C. Reilly, Rebecca Hall, Steve Coogan, Ralph Fiennes and Hugh Laurie, with some phoning it in for a paycheck. Will Ferrell gives a lousy yet incompetent performance, that can only stated as downright terrible. Worst, even the costumes and production design are terribly cheap-looking. Everything bad about this garbage makes it as unwatchable.This travesty is gonna end up being the worst movies of 2018. Also, this movie is a downright insult to all the previous yet superior adaptations of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes, including the remarkable Guy Ritchie - Sherlock Holmes adaptations.

reviews.review_title: "May I present to you, the greatest detective of all time..."
reviews.content: The few professional reviews I read of this movie basically said it was terrible. They were wrong. It's worse than that. What could have been a well conceived parody of the Sherlock Holmes franchise actually resulted in a sophomoric treatment that aimed for the lowest common denominator. Quite honestly, the film could have been titled "Dumb and Dumber" and no one would have known the difference. The only bright spot I could pick out was the cleverly written musical rendition of Holmes (Will Ferrell) bemoaning his ill treatment of Watson (John C. Reilly) by sending him to the gallows. I'm in full agreement with IMDb voters on this one, a 3.8 rating as I write this is about what the movie deserves. At least John C. Reilly had the good fortune to redeem his good name by portraying Oliver Hardy in "Stan and Ollie" around the same time this aberration came out. Small comfort though, in the grand scheme of things.

So... less than 4 on average, and heaps of 1s... What's wrong with people nowadays? Why can't you just think rationally about something and judge it accordingly? How can something truly be a 1 (utter crap with no redeeming qualities whatsoever) or a 10 (absolutely perfect in every aspect)? Unbelievable...The production value alone would save this movie from being a 1... and personally, I found the acting quite decent too (for a comedy), and the parodies of the Downey/Law's Sherlock funny (with a music score to match).Someone cried foul for the interspersed references to contemporary politics (and politicians), but that's no reason to dish out 1s; just plain and brainless hate obscuring reason and objectivity. Pity that behavior goes far beyond movie tastes and taints many aspects of real life as well...This movie is no comedy masterpiece and can be quite silly, but deserves at least a 6/10 in my opinion.

Still in the theater. If I could give no stars I would. Never had a problem staying awake through a movie till today. I find myself checking my phone for the time. There is a reason there are only 4 people in the theater including my wife and I.
If you were hoping for another laugh fest like Step Brothers, just watch Step Brothers again. This movie is awful.

reviews.review_title: So much potential was lost that this is the real crime it should be investigated
reviews.content:
A comedic take on Detective Sherlock Holmes and his partner Doctor Watson.I wasn't offended by this movie but I wasn't really entairtained. There's so much that could have been done with this premise and this is mostly lazy jokes. So much potential was lost that this is the real crime it should be investigated.
It is overall not as bad as depicted but 'just' painfully average. Anacronistic elements (the Titanic and Queen Victoria... really?) are odd choices and not exploited at all for comedy (it should be used in a clever way and not as other lazy / almost inert elements).
I really like these actors (Reilly is outstanding in "The Sisters Brothers", a serious role filmed in the same period and Ferrell has been good in comedy and some serious role as well) but here they do their best with deeply uninspired material.

I normally am a fan of Will Ferrell's movies, but this one just wasn't up to the level of his other works IMO. Many of the jokes fell flat. Some went too far too be funny. I actually thought about walking out during the first 30 minutes- not a laugh in the theater. But eventually things got a bit better and some people seemed to be enjoying the movie better than my group. Most of the laughs I could pinpoint where it was coming from in a packed theater. Overall more people not laughing though. So some will still like this, but definitely not all.

Holmes & WatsonFor criminals, the only benefit to having Sherlock Holmes on the case was that he could be easily bribed with cocaine.However, in this comedy, the great detective is even more formidable when he has snorted nose candy.When Holmes (Will Ferrell) and his partner Watson (John C. Reilly) discover a plot by Holmes' archenemy Professor Moriarty (Ralph Fiennes) to assassinate Queen Victoria, the unorthodox detective only has 4 days to prevent his rival's plan from occurring. But in order to do that, he must seek help from his brother (Hugh Laurie) as well as a female physician (Rebecca Hall).Relying solely on humourless anachronisms to propel its overly simplistic story, this is not the first comedic take on the darling detective, but it is certainly the laziest and most cringe-worthy adaptation.Incidentally, crime scene investigation was so rudimentary in the 1880s that most murders were blamed on solar eclipses. Red Lightvidiotreviews.blogspot.ca

After that we see the grown up H&W and from then on the film shambles from one chaotic skit to another with no real point to the whole thing and a bunch of unrelated characters who might in the end get knitted into a narrative. reviews.review_title: Possible career killer for Will Ferrell?
reviews.content: This is another movie spoofing the popular Sherlock Holmes character but into a comedy. Initially when this was announced, was looking forward since having enjoyed several of Will Ferrell's work and along him and John C. Reilly which made Stepbrothers a classic. Then once the trailers came out, we could see that the film didn't look too funny but keeping a positive outlook we perhaps thought they were saving the best for the film.As a whole this film isn't funny in the least and is quite forced at times. The slapstick doesn't really work here and the jokes don't hit. For being a supposed mystery film, there weren't clever jokes and the payoff in the end wasn't worth it. At times rather boring.Perhaps not completely bad but this may be a new low and a serious career killer for Will Ferrell. After the House (2017) flopped and was panned, this film was supposed to be the step back in the right direction but as it turned out, Holmes & Watson was an even bigger flop and received worse reviews. We don't know how many more chances Ferrell will get but if he isn't careful, his time may sadly be coming to an end.Fast forward to several years later and we may be looking back and ask ourselves what happened to Will Ferrell's career, and this film may be the answer to that question.

How could someone make such a pathetic disaster of two legendary characters is totally out of my mind.
It is simple; either you make a Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson film or you make a comedy. There is no way these two things could be combined.Yes... it is really, really bad and under all circumstances should be avoided. I would prefer to watch EMOJI MOVIE instead.God only knows what was going on in the minds of the writers and directors of the film that they actually decided to work on this script.
Not at all funny, did someone actually read the script. I am amazed at it's 3.8 rating.

(Flash Review)This had a good comedic tone if you like Ferrell. There was actually a genuine plot to hook a bunch of gags on. The two guys act like amusing buffoons around the Queen and things don't go smoothly as you would imagine. There were some funny unexpected gags and a consistent smattering of solid humor. reviews.review_title: I would rather throw myself down stairs than watch this again.
reviews.content: Was expecting so much more from the step-brothers duo but they gave us pure S#!+. Dont waste your time or brain cells.
How do you possibly ruin getting these two guys on the screen together. The epitome of what Hollywood has become. Embarrassing for them they thought people would like this.

I don't know how this film got made. Was it the fact that Will Farrell and John C Reilly had two huge movies beforehand? Did Sony really think it was a guarantee to win with these two? Talladega Nights is so good (I like the extended version better) and Step Brothers is one of the most quoted films of all time. But that doesn't mean every film with them is going to do well. Even if this film came out five years ago I don't think it would have helped.I'll admit I enjoyed the first trailer. Then the reviews came out. Then that infamous time when the film had a 0% on Rotten Tomatoes. I never trust Rotten Tomatoes but that's hard to get out of the head. Could the film be as bad as the word of mouth? Yes, it can be. I actually think it might be worse.Farrell and Reilly star as Holmes and Watson. They are tasked with protecting Queen when a new threat emerges as classic villain Moriarty has fled to America. Goofiness ensues, but goofiness started the film and finishes the film. This is not a direct parody of the Guy Ritchie film but it might as well be. There is a running gag of Holmes strategizing specific situation before he takes actions. It gets old after about the second time.That's the issue with the film. There are about five jokes that are recycled throughout the film. Most offensive is the joke about women doctors when Rebecca Hall and Lauren Lapkus show up. Every time they show up it's "you are women, you can't be doctors". Even five years ago this joke wouldn't be funny. Ralph Fiennes plays the Moriarty role in what plays out like an extended cameo. Steve Coogan also has a useless cameo. I'm not sure if Farrell just asked some friends to be in the movie or they were actually cast in the film.Most of the film features current jokes or somewhat current jokes played out in this time period. There is a one the nose joke about the political climate today, where one of the characters nearly breaks the fourth wall to stare into the camera to tell the audience something. It's not creative, but obvious and needless. I don't know if the creators thought the audience would be so stupid they needed to be beaten over the head with ideas. The film gives off the aura that they wanted to make a Mel Brooks type spoof film. But the film comes off in the laziest spoof of all time. With the talent around the film, it's not disappointing but more embarrassing.Holmes and Watson is a predictable, jokes that all fall flat film, that I think Sony just dumped to get out. The rumor is that Sony offered it to Netflix and they turned it down. That's pretty rough if Netflix who usually takes everything turned down an offer to stream the film. That's not a good sign at all. This is definitely the worst film for the duo and might go down as the worst film either of the main actors has been in. There is nothing redeeming about the film. No saving grace and silvering lining to actually venture out to see this. (Even if it was streaming, I think most people would have only watched it to see how awful it as)
The only way this movie could possibly be considered funny is if the joke was on me for paying money to watch it. Can I give it a negative rating?

You have movies that are so bad that they manage a cult following, and then those that are so bad that Netflix won't even touch it. This one falls in the latter category. I only even gave it 3 stars because 1) You have to put at least one star 2) it held my toddler's attention during the singing portion 3) Billy Zane getting on the titanic in the end was the saving grace.

reviews.review_title: Rob Bryden is a comedy genius, Will Ferrel's never seen a joke
reviews.content: No, I'm not Rob Bryden, but actually have a wide range of comedy. This movie is horrible and really could do with a comedic actor or at least a writer. Wait, that joke about a women doctor early so much less than a male was absolutely hilarious, unless you've heard it over a thousand times, which you would if you had a wider experience with comedy than just US. The Ghost parody was hilarious, that is unless you saw it 2 decades ago in the vastly superior comedy Naked Gun. Is any more of this execrance worth commenting on? NO. It's a giant plop. If anyone thinks Ferell is at all funny should check out British comedy, and no, I'm not a Brit, I just like comedy-- S. Martin, M. Short etc. etc. Ferrell has no talent. 3 stars because they were at least intelligent to give some money to actually talented comedian, that is not "Holmes" nor "Watson". (By the way Ferrell was funny in Spoils of Babylon (someone must have told him how to be funny then).
Very funny film, I don't understand the bad reviews. It's a silly film but it's meant to be

I just didn't find it funny at all. Look, im not going to qualify my opinion with crap about how long I've been watching movies or how highly you should regard my sense of humour above all others. I'm just an average guy who, like many of you just likes movies and enjoys a good comedy. Its why i went to see it. But, i didn't find it funny. Not one bit. I was bored throughout. I can honestly say it was the poorest effort of a comedy that i have had the misfortune to sit through. Its only my opinion though.One thing though, i have noticed more than one 10/10 reviewer admit that it wasn't worth a 10, but they felt compelled to balance the ratings. Please don't. Give it what you think it deserves and let it stand. If its as good as you think, it will become a cult classic, like so many underrated movies from before.

This is one of the worst movies that I have ever seen in my life. Off the top of my head, I can't think of a film that is more awful than this trash. It would have required an enormous amount of audacity to put this into a theatre and ask for people's hard earned money.

I've put this off for almost a year because my brain has finally returned from retardation. This movie is incomprehensibly awful. Remember step brothers and Talladaga knights? Well this is nothing like those. I remember vividly 3 moments in the movie where I considered leaving because the comedy was unbearable. This is the second worst movie I've ever seen which misses out on the top spot only to The Night Before with Seth Rogan. May God have mercy on your soul if you watched this whole movie.
Turned it off within the first 5 minutes. don't watch

reviews.review_title: horrible boring and absolutely not funny
reviews.content: Simply not worth one minute, 3 people did not laugh one single time...

I watched out of curiosity, but this was as terrible as everyone says. Scenes include continuous vomiting, getting attacked by killer bees, and sensually massaging a cadaver. It's humour that's better suited to the likes of Family Guy, as it was not funny in the least. The whole terrible display stems from the awful script. The lead duo's chemistry isn't bad by any means, but without anything to work with its wasted. The whole plot is pieced together by random skits of slapstick and bodily fluids. Even as a 'period' piece, it dates itself with unnecessary references to Donald Trump, i-Hop, and selfies. The wider acting was okay though, good costume department too. The real question is how on earth they got any of the big name actors to agree to star in this mess.

reviews.review_title: Anybody who rated this film over 1 star either has the patience of a saint, or loves horrible movies
reviews.content: I couldn't even get though 16 minutes of this film because it was so dumb.Don't get me wrong, I'm all for cheesy, horrible movies but this is so stupid that it insults your intelligence. The 16 minutes I watched, and there is no way to prove this, I feel like I lost brain cells as well as valuable time I could have spent watching, or even doing, something more productive.Will Ferrell needs to take a long break, and Ethan Cohen needs to stop offering to direct the horrible films he's been in lately. Where's the funny Will Ferrell? Did he die and get replaced with this unfunny, messy version of him? Adam McKay needs to stop producing his horrible films and start writing and directing them for him again, even then I don't really know if Farrell can even pull it off anymore. It's sad, because I loved Will Ferrell as a kid with films like Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby, and even Step Brothers. I want the Will Farrell who could pull off a role like Buddy in Elf. I don't think he could ever repeise that role as he is now.

reviews.review_title: I wish I could like this movie
reviews.content: I am a huge Will Ferrell Fan, even better if he is working with John C. Riley, another amazing talent, but I just couldn't even hate-watch Holmes and Watson.If it's possible to hate a setting or scenery for a movie, I did, and that should have been my first clue that this wasn't going to be a fun 1.5 hours for me. The location was drab and boring, the supporting characters weren't any better, and sadly, my two guys didn't even appear to be trying.There were about two gags I enjoyed, one when they shoot at the bees, and I can't even remember the second one, I just recall laughing twice. I have enjoyed a lot of stupid movies, but this wasn't even stupid, it was just dull.I have been waiting for this specific movie for a while, ever since it was rumored to be taking place with Sascha Baron Cohen. I even used my limited movie pass to see it when there are a lot of other movie options I'm waiting to see.The two stars have got to be for the two actors, just because I can't count them out, without partially blaming the writers and the director, but they are getting by on the skin of their teeth.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your time or money
reviews.content: My son (13 yo) picked the family movie for his birthday. In the first 15 minutes of the movie I thought to myself, "Am I missing something? This is horrible" we were the only people in the theatre 5 days after it released. I took out my phone in the middle of the movie, which I normally don't do as I think it's rude to the other people around me. I looked up the rating on IMDB and saw the rating of 3.3. There has only been 1 other movie that has prompted me to do this (In the Name of the King) I spent the next hour warning my friends not to waste their time on this movie. The jokes were predictable and boring. They went for the easy punchlines and they fell flat every time.

I don't write many reviews but when a film is as bad as this one it's necessary. I managed to sit through about 45m of it on Netflix but then had to turn it off. I like Ferrell but this is truly appalling with no redeeming features. The so called jokes are terrible, I think it's meant to be spoofing the Downey Holmes moves but falls flat on that front too.

reviews.review_title: Why was this even made, I really want to know!
reviews.content: I am a big fan of these guys, laughed for hours at them being silly together and apart. I really thought people were just being too harsh on it for whatever reason. They were right to be. I didn't laugh once in this entire movie. If I had seen it in theaters I would have walked out. If I wasn't sitting here with my friends who are high and giggling I would have turned it off. I gave it a 3 because the costumes, set design and other tech aspects; which still seems high but 1 gets thrown around way to often on here just because people didn't like the movie.
The movie was clearly poorly made, however, I believe some of the negative reviews are from trump supporters whining about the few trump jokes.

This is very badly written. Will Ferrell can at good when he wants to. Most of the time he does not. And this is no expect ion. This movie it not funny. It is sick and awful. Will Ferrell is not Sherlock Holmes he just Will Ferrell again. 1 is underrating this movie. But this the same I give it 2 out 10.

reviews.review_title: Utter Rubbish & Should've had a Minus * Rating
reviews.content: Total and Utter Rubbish Of a Film, What a complete and Utter Waste Of Time, Money & Resources. Don't even waste a second of your time On this Disgraceful offering of Codswallop which is an insult to Codswallop as Codswallop can at least be used for Manure.

If you sit down expecting some theatrical masterpiece, then I suppose you've never heard of Will Ferrell. But I think I've figured it out. People tend to hate what they don't understand. Therein lies the problem. This is perhaps the most nonsensical idiocracy since, well, Idiocracy. The masses just might be too stupid to realize and then comprehend the sheer stupidity of this movie. They even nailed the satirical representation of Robert Downey Jr.'s iteration of Holmes. I didn't last 10 minutes before I was BELLOWING with laughter. By 30 minutes, when I read most had left the theaters, my sides hurt and I was in tears. It's hard to fathom having such a lack of a sense of humor, but then again, I've met people. People suck, as does this movie. And that's the point. If you don't get it, you don't get it.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely as bad as they say.
reviews.content: I went to see this without having seen a single review beforehand and expecting it to be somewhere in the ballpark of Stepbrothers humour-wise. Walked out after less than an hour. My girlfriend who will never walk out of a terrible film pretty much grabbed her coat as soon as I mentioned leaving. It is not funny in the slightest and painfully predictable. I normally get frustrated reading 1 star IMBD reviews because in reality there are very few 1 star movies, but this one 100 percent is. The people giving this movie 10 star reviews must be living on a different planet. A trip to the dentist or a child's funeral would be a better option than going to see this film. Everyone involved in making this movie should be ashamed. And shot.

reviews.review_title: It gets one star because you can't give it negative stars.
reviews.content: What. A. (S)hit. Show. Totally not funny. They try to make their lame jokes relatable to the current political climate and it just wasn't funny and didn't work. John Reilly should stay away from will farrell if he wants to be considered a respected actor.Wow. Just wow. That's not a compliment.

reviews.review_title: Terrible! walked out after 30 minutes and went bowling
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of Will Ferrell and John C. Riley. I have watched Step Brothers five times and still find it funny. This movie was terrible and should not be watched even if someone offers to paying you to watch it. The movie theater for was completely quiet for this stinker of a film. I was amazed at how bad this movie was and I was embarrassed after convincing my girlfriend to take a chance on it. We left after 30 minutes and went bowling. This movie is not worth watching even after it goes to Netflix or HBO.

reviews.review_title: I didn't wait until the end
reviews.content: This film is a completely pointless waste of time, I thought it was supposed to be a comedy but non of the jokes are remotely funny, the acting is beyond terrible and the script is so poor that I suspect it was just ad libbed.This was only the second time where I have walked out of a cinema before the end of the film because it was painful to watch.Don't waste your time with this dross

Ferrell and Reilly have limited charms at the best of times, but this movie manages to put them in contention as the unfunniest comedy duo of all time.I'm not even sure the 14-year-old pimple-faces who surely are their largest fans could stomach this movie for its entire running time.In the first 20 minutes they offer up mast3rb@tion jokes, lots of pointless shouting, dumb-guy antics, and a disgusting puking scene. At which point I shut it off.This movie is so terrible I'd actually be surprised if they let these two star in a movie together ever again.
What a complete waste of time! Laughs were few and far between. I was ready to walk out.
Tried to watch this on 2 seperate occasions and got 30mins in.

reviews.review_title: Not step brothers or talladega but still pretty funny...not sure why everybody hated it.
reviews.content: I saw this movie with my family on Christmas and none of us left the theater disappointed. We weren't blown away or anything. There wasn't a plot that left us in awe or anything like that but I wasn't really expecting one. For all the people who left 1 star reviews calling it the worst movie they've ever seen...not really sure what kind of expectations they were walking into this movie with. I was expecting a Sherlock Holmes spoof that made me laugh and it delivered on those expectations.
This is my first review here. I've seen lots of bad movies but this just REALLY BAD.It's not funny, it's not anything.Having a colonoscopy would be more fun.

reviews.review_title: This is NOT Even Laughably Bad
reviews.content: My girlfriend and I went to see this movie despite the reviews. We love stupid Will Ferrell comedies and figured that other reviewers just didn't "get it." We were wrong. Right from the start, this movie is uninspired, boring, graphic, and inconceivable. What sucks the most is that the set is great, the costumes are good, the music is actually incredible, but the writers and the actors were all apparently horribly ill while writing this, because it is nothing but an absolutely horrible fever dream from start to... I'd say to finish, but my girlfriend and I walked out as soon as we hit the "morgue scene."Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly were so funny in Step Brothers, because they played stupid versions of themselves. Here, Will Ferrell uses a downright offensive British accent, and the directors apparently thought that this would be humorous in itself? This is the only explanation for why anyone thought this movie was funny, because the "jokes" are certainly not funny.It's like a bad SNL skit that went on for an hour and 30 minutes too long, because there is one joke the whole time, and it never lands; Holmes and Watson are stupid. This doesn't even remotely make sense, let alone make me laugh. I chuckled once. Ok, twice. But I got nothing more than a "heh" out. Otherwise, this is not even a film to be laughed at. As soon as Will Ferrell came on screen, I leaned over to my girlfriend and said "Oh my God... is this going to happen the whole movie?" I didn't finish it, but I'm pretty sure it did happen the whole movie. That's what I saw.How many more times do I need to say it? I LOVE stupid Will Ferrell comedies! I love Step Brothers, Blades of Glory, Talladega Nights, etc., But this movie is uninspired and IN NO WAY IS IT FUNNY. Save your money. Or if you want to put your cash to better use, rip it into pieces, turn on your fireplace, and incinerate it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as they say
reviews.content: Its simply not as bad as everyone wants you to believe. Im guessing most of the bad ratings here were left by people that read teh bad ratings instead of seeing the movies. People enjoy jumping on the band wagon. Its not hilarious, but it is funny. Its not Reilly and Farrells BEST work by any means, but if your a fan of the duo, watch it. You'll have a decent enough time.

I saw "Holmes & Watson", starring Will Ferrell-The Daddy's Home movies, Elf; John C. Reilly-Kong:Skull Island, Step Brothers; Rebecca Hall-Professor Marston and the Wonder Women, Iron Man 3 and Ralph Fiennes-Spectre, The Grand Budapest Hotel.
This is a very bad movie. It's dumb, silly, political and down right unfunny. I'm not a big fan of Will Ferrell. He is funny sometimes and not so funny other times. This is one of those other times. It's written and directed by Etan Cohen, who had a hand in Get Hard, Men in Black 3 & Tropic Thunder-I don't know what he was smoking or drinking but he must have been blitzed when he wrote this movie. I even heard that after disastrous screen tests, Sony tried to sell the movie to Netflix but they declined. There were a lot of walk outs in theaters during the opening day showings, too. I was tempted myself but I like to give a movie a chance, in case it gets better-but no such luck here. Anyway, Will plays Sherlock Holmes, the great English detective created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and John plays his trusted confidant, Doctor Watson. They are trying to save the Queen of England from being murdered by Ralph, who plays the villainous Moriarty. Rebecca is an American doctor that becomes a love interest for one of the heroes-and if you guessed Will, you would be wrong. I read that it's based on an SNL sketch that Will starred in, back in the day. There are a few cameos but they don't help much. It felt like they were doing the cameos because they owed Will a favor or something. One of the many political jabs taken involved Will putting on hats-one of them said, 'Make England Great Again'.
It's rated "PG-13" for violence, drug references, language and sexual material and has a running time of 1 hour & 30 minutes.
It's definitely not one that I would buy on DVD. I wouldn't rent it, either. Even if you are a big Will Ferrell fan, I would wait until it comes to cable tv.
If I could give this a 0/10, I would.DO NOT GO AND SEE THIS MOVIE.There's really not much else to say.

reviews.review_title: Love Sherlock Holmes. Love most Will Ferrell movies
reviews.content: I could not like this. It was unwatchable. I made it 30 minutes. No laughs. Nothing redeeming. It was awful. Only movie I've seen worse than this was jack and Jill with Adam Sandler.
Not funny, awkward and a waste of time, I lasted 30 minutes, I was being charitable because I loved them from step brothers

I made the same mistake as many many other people thinking all the bad reviews of this film mreally meant it couldn't be 'that bad', I was wrong.Being a fan of Ferrell & Reilly I thought the film would be at least entertaining low brow fluff, again I was wrong. I had two small giggles at the start of the film then it was just pure boredom from there onwards.There is no real plot & the dialgue is exceptionally unfunny.Ferrell & Reilly made a very bad choice agreeing to do this film, they';re both much better than this.

What was going on? I didn't understand a single thing in this damn movie. Even Sony didn't like it, so they tried selling it to Netflix and they didn't want it either. Why was this made? It is an unfunny, poorly made, terrible mess which shouldn't have even been in the pre production stage.

reviews.review_title: Bad. But not as bad as a Tyler Perry comedy.
reviews.content: Holmes & Watson isn't as terrible as I expected it to be, but that doesn't mean it's a good movie. It's not. It's pretty bad. The plot is ridiculous and the jokes are elementary-level humor. This comedy also can't decide how dumb it wants to be. At times, it attempts witty satire, and then it falls over itself while trying to do slapstick. But at least it's better than any Tyler Perry movie I've seen.

Absolutely terrible
Bad cast
Bad comedy
Bad story
I'm ashamed that I watched this and a terrible Sherlock movie the characters are not like his at all you should watch the RDJ Sherlock movies or Benedict's Sherlock tv show.

reviews.review_title: Very funny xD xD don't listen to old people reviews
reviews.content: So funny showing funny side of holmes, others are just jelous because they make fun of their childhood heroe and from british most famous detective tale. Don't listen to angry old people its amazing movie to watch if you want to laugh. If you obsess about sherlock then this movie is not for you, but if you are sensible, this movie is legend it should be at least 8 IMDB.

This was directed by the guy who only directed one other film, the below average "Get Hard". Somehow that qualified him to direct not only Will Ferrell again, but the equally talented John C. Reilly, as well as many other talented actors. I don't understand why. But either way, I knew this movie would be terrible the moment I heard that song "The Boys are Back in Town" in the preview. I knew it would be bad since they had already been over-advertising it, but that song made me realize they're desperately trying to market the amazing comedy duo from Step Brothers and Talladega Nights. When you have the names Ferrell and Reilly side by side again, that should be enough to draw a huge crowd. Unless word spreads that your movie is a complete pile of crap, which this absolutely was. So I guess it makes sense the marketing team would try to save face and make a little bit of the budget back by revolving the trailers around "the boys", but this movie is still painfully unfunny. This director should seriously consider moving into a new genre or out of filmmaking altogether.

reviews.review_title: Don't know why Will Farrel keeps making movies
reviews.content: I generally avoid the movies he does, but I think this one deserves the golden raspberry award.

*no spoilers*
Went in having watched many of Ferrell and Reilly's past films knowing/believing most of them to be very funny. This wasn't even close to anything they have made in the past. It was written terribly, the story line had too many characters that weren't properly introduced, there was audio issues with words being spoken and mouths not moving, the accents were bad and weren't funny, and the movie had too much political bs in it.But my biggest issue was the political statements made in the movie. I don't care if you're Right/left/middle when it comes to politics...movies, especially comedy, is what people use to escape. An evening to just relax and have fun. This movie was used to poke fun with an agenda that some agree with and some don't agree with that had literally nothing to do with the plot or story line. Pathetic.My favorite comedy duo has seriously let me down. This movie wasn't comedy, it was garbage.

reviews.review_title: "Holmes & Watson" is a deep dive into stupidity.
reviews.content: "Holmes & Watson" has the potential to be a smart buddy comedy with a twist, but fails at it and becomes a pile of junk on top of junk.In this comedy, Detective Sherlock Holmes and John Watson must find the person who threatens to harm the Royal family.Here's the thing, I found myself laughing during a few scenes in "Holmes & Watson", but just when you think it has potential, it takes a deep dive into dumbness and downright stupidity. Ferrell and Reilly have really downgraded themselves to star in this film that is horrible. It should've died in development hell 10 years ago.Skip it.
The plot was all over the place, the comedy was forced and the acting was woeful.I really wish I didn't bother with this.one.

reviews.review_title: Walked out of theater about half way through
reviews.content: I didn't bother reading reviews here before going to see this, and I've kicked myself every since. 100% complete boring garbage. No humor, no real plot, you don't give a damn about anyone or anything happening. I knew 10 minutes in it was a wate of time but we stayed a little longer. Finally decided to walk out and salvage the rest of our evening, but honestly, I was in a bad mood the rest of the night.

reviews.review_title: First movie I have EVER walked out of
reviews.content: Absolutely ruined my day, There is nothing REMOTELY Funny about this awful film. It took an odd 15 minutes for me and my father to realise the only thing keeping us AT the cinema were the bloody food we were eating.
Gave it 10 minutes. Worst movie I have watched in a long time

reviews.review_title: Without any doubt, the worst film I have ever seen
reviews.content: In 55 years of cinema going this has to be the worst heap of utter garbage I have ever had the misfortune of witnessing. If I could give it a minus 5,000 rating I would, I have seen a fair few awful films in my time but NOTHING even comes remotely close to what I have just watched. My wife is still in a state of shock after watching it after so looking forward to it all day.

I think this film is made solely for the people who thought the last film those actors did together was good.This film suffers like so many other comedy films where the leading actors become famous and the get paid and allowed to do whatever they think is funny. And it's not. Unless they get reigned in by a script and director, it just ends pitifully.

38 minutes in I paused this movie having thoroughly enjoyed it. I sent a message to a movie buff friend of mine and asked...am I watching the correct movie as it was slaughtered....he came back immediately and said he had loved it but was terrified to admit it due to the poor reviews. This is a short. Silly but fun fun movie. It's not historically correct in the same way Airplane is not a disaster drama.... honestly enjoy it for what it is. Really put me off reading IMBD reviews a bit now as I put off watching this movie based on low rating. I think this may be a future cult classic.
Everyone involved should be ashamed. I made it 10 minutes in. It was a relief to switch it off.

reviews.review_title: A terrible film in disguise as a run of the mill guilty pleasure Will Ferrell Comedy
reviews.content:
Recently there appears to be a trend of surprising films, surprising not in their content necessarily but in their ability to defy expectations, much wasn't expected of Bumblebee however it turned out to be a solid
enjoyable film, Spider-man into the spider-verse was met with scepticism due to its ambitious plot and peoples strongly held views on past spider-man cinematic efforts however it turned out to be a truly excellent film whereas with Holmes and Watson one could expect another run of the mill guilty pleasure if not great Will Ferrell comedy maybe heightened by the impressive skills of John C. Reilly instead it was one of the worse comedies nae films in recent memory failing to be funny or entertaining or even bearable for that matter.About here I would probably be expected to write a synopsis of the film I will do this but I am going to keep it brief as just recalling this films contents causes my blood to boil. Will Ferrell stars as Sherlock Holmes an incredibly gifted private inspector. He is accompanied by avid admirer and assistant of sorts Dr Watson played by John C. Reilly, Together they must catch the bad guy in order to prevent the death of the Queen.Holmes is one of my biggest problem in this Film more specifically the inconsistencies in his character. When it suits the plot he is a self and Watson assured moron who fails to see obvious clues and happenings however one moment later and he holds the abilities expected of classic Sherlock Holmes finding the most subtle of clues and saving the day not to mention he is incredibly unlikable but not in a love to hate way or comically flawed way more in a oh shut up and go die way.I could pinpoint many other flaws within this film but the vast majority of these are flaws for the same overriding reason that makes this film so poor. That not only does it rely almost solely on worn out comic tropes and ideas but it fails at executing them instead falling flat without fail every single time.This is a truly terrible film that I would not wish even upon my worst enemy, do not pay this film the respect of your time or your money. Trust me its really bad it will sadden you, it will dampen your belief in cinema and it will lessen the quality of your life in the same vain that it has lessened the quality of Planet Earth simply by existing within it.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen!
reviews.content: This is honestly one of the worst movies ever made! The plot is terrible, the acting is unwatchable. No idea how this movie was made!

After reading a whole bunch of bad reviews on IMDB, we nearly didn't go to see this film but we'd already booked the tickets so went anyway.
Glad we ended up going to make our own minds up instead of listening to the other cretins, just jumping on the bandwagon.While this isn't a patch on Step Brothers or Anchorman it's not bad and worth a watch if you usually like this kind of film, even if it's just the one viewing. Plenty of funny cameos and enough laughs.
I was prepared for the worst. I like their movies. But this? This is awful.

This film is bad. It so bad, "bad" doesn't do it justice. No amount of words before the word "bad" would be enough. This film is so bad, other bad films are embarrassed for it. Like, if a group of bad films were sat having a nice drink in a pub garden on a warm summer's evening, and this film showed up, the evening would be ruined within seconds, and Assignment Earth along with The Room would be so disappointed, they couldn't show their heads in public for a decade. Avoid this film at all costs, unless you enjoy the pain of bad movies or are simply quite mad.The bit with Billy Zane was funny though.

reviews.review_title: Worst film that I've seen in a decade
reviews.content: Wow, this truly is a trash fire. Oh my god. Like I read the reviews and thought, "maybe they are wrong." Nope, they were spot on. There were several times that I thought about walking out of the theatre while watching this. I actually took an extended 15 minute bathroom break just so I wouldn't have to sit in the theatre and cringe. I usually will give a film some sort of respect before I straight up walk out of the theatre and I did. But, god I wish I didn't with this one. My friend wanted to see this film and was genuinely curious about just how bad this film was. Please skip, skip, skip, skip. Do not let the curiosity factor of this film make you see this in theatres. If you are even a bit curious of how bad it is, Redbox it. But honestly, I wouldn't even do that.

I should have taken notice of the bad reviews this film has had but some actors I really like are in it, John C Reilly, Will Ferrell, Hugh Laurie and Ralph Fiennes also two of my favourite British comedians Rob Brydon and Steve Coogan (a local lad just down the road from me). So I didn't think it could be as bad as it was made out to be, how wrong I was. A few weeks ago I saw the marvelous Stan & Ollie in which John C. Reilly was magnificent, how did he come to this?People who like the film are saying that those who do not have no sense of humour. I assure you I do have a sense of humour and I know a funny film when I see one and this wasn't one.I was looking forward to seeing this film when I first heard of it as I am a big Sherlock Holmes fan and I love a good comedy, how dissapointed I was.

NOT STEPBROTHERS or TALLADEGA NIGHTS! Not even close . Reading the mixed reviews, we decided we had to at least try this movie for .99 on ITunes . WRONG! We struggled to continue watching and finally gave up about 40 minutes in . Don't punish yourself, just say no!
Made me laugh a few times and was slightly amusing but it's also really bad and had some really horrible jokes (1 viewing)

This movie only makes sense if you assume the people who made it hated Sherlock Holmes their entire lives and we're looking for some revenge against this character.It isn't remotely a loving satire or send-up of Sherlock Holmes, it is pure spite.It was a competently filmed and created movie. The crew is not at fault.
This is by far the best movie I have ever seen in my 68 years of Livin.

I have a short list of movies that, whenever I am having a serious case of insomnia, I put on to fall asleep. This movie put me to sleep in record time! If you're having trouble dozing off, I highly recommend this one!
What an epic letdown. The plot was a mess, the jokes weren't funny (save three or four), and the political humor was polarizing and weak.
The movie was boring and filled with juvenile humor. l walked out before the movie was over. If you have seen the trailer, you have seen all you need to see. Stay home.

reviews.review_title: How does will Ferrell get work , worst comedy actor ever
reviews.content: Utter garbage and thats very polite about it , worst film of all time , Ferrell just makes rubbish films and is the biggest con artist in movie history.

reviews.review_title: Holmes & Watson Unclever nonsense with little entertainment value 3/10 stars.
reviews.content: My mistake was in not reading up on it first. Yet, it was naivete that led me to believe Ferrell and Riley were going to portray Doyle's famous characters seriously. From the very beginning there was nothing to take seriously, and, as a result, absolutely nothing to provide the temporary escape we seek as moviegoers. Confronted with this sad reality, I and my poor wife sat through what was obviously meant to be entertaining only to a profoundly small segment of moviegoers. We would have followed two others out of the auditorium, but since the city had temporarily turned off our power, we had no other place to stay warm.

Watched the first ten minutes so far and it's hilarious how they take the piss out of everything.No idea if the dubbed parts are deliberate (i think they are) but they add to the hilarity for me.2 Americans shidding all over a holy saint of a character like Sherlock Holmes.Amazing...Will update later.Part deux (that is french for part 2)
Funny at times. Good actors and acting. A movie to watch with company and with a beer.
Lol....jokes.....well done the writers....they must of put alot of thought in too this

Will Farrell has fallen into the Adam Sandler phase of his career by making awful movies after starting his career on a upswing. This movie has nothing to offer the movie fan and makes diehard Farrell fans cringe at every turn. The screenplay seems as if a child wrote it and the acting has a lot to be desired too. This movie makes the Robert Downey films look like classics and that's bad. Absolutely pathetic piece of work.

reviews.review_title: We walked out of the theatre it was so bad!
reviews.content: Stupid, stupid, painful to watch! Literally the most stupid movie we've ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Comedy for people with two digit IQ and stoned teenagers.
reviews.content: Stopped watching after 11 minutes, it was that bad. Someone compared it to "Naked gun" but it's more like a clown show with tripping over ones shoes and water spraying flowers. Not even close to a comedy. More like a pastiche of 80's/90's comedies and a bad one.

Loved these two in step brothers and talladega nights, hilarious, but really, this film is awful beyond belief, the main problem is, it just isn't funny. I don't know how some people on here give it 10 stars, it's really, really bad

BELIEVE EVERY HORRIBLE REVIEW OF THIS FILM, they are all true. "Holmes & Watson" is the worst movie of all time.When are moviegoers going to realize that Will Farrell makes garbage films. He is the white equivalent of Tyler Perry (who makes horrible black films).EVERYBODY WALKED OUT OF THE THEATER. I forced myself to sit through this puke of a film just to see how many people would still be watching it at the end....and NO ONE WAS LEFT, so I got up and walked out also.IT IS HORRIBLE!

reviews.review_title: Burn your money, or dig a big hole in your backyard
reviews.content:
This is the movie you'll watch on Stan in six years time then 10 minutes in you'll decide to watch ANYTHING ELSE, or go and dig a big hole in your backyard.Save your money, or do something more useful with it, like burning it for heat!"Does this review contain spoilers" IMBD asks!!!
Bahahahaha
Yep, I call it the worst, most unfunny boringly cheap cinema ever produced.

I have always been a huge fan of Will Ferrell but I think he has finally hit that point that we have seen from some many other once great comedic actors (Sandler, Stiller, Chase, Murray come to mind) This movie is painful, not funny.
What is it? Is it because they outgrow being funny? (Because they "get old") or do they just hit a point in their careers where they phone it in and just want to cash checks?

Why? Why would they do this
Worst movie of the decade

reviews.review_title: Sheer Lack of Appreciation for Corny Humor
reviews.content: The absurdly low scores on this movie, by critic and public alike, are evidence that people have lost the ability to let loose and enjoy absurd comedy and parody at its best. Shame on those of you who scored it anything below a 6.Opinions are opinions but sometimes there was obviously no rationale included in your reviews.

Studios spends millions to advertise on every media platform available, I wonder if that might extend to the review sections of these "open forum" type review areas?? We have all seen it on sites that sell products.On to this odd flick, I laughed outloud twice during this clunker and thats it... this sunk like the Titanic.
To be honest, the obvious failed attempts at laughs by throwing in political bias and virtue signalling (as if anyone agrees with these Hollywood goons as they exist in a bubble of like minded limited thinkers that are out of touch), I know alienated half of the US audience instantly, and likely much more. It sort of killed the vibe for the entire movie.
We go to the movies to escape, not have some sniveling SJW sneak subtle messaging in movies and shows...not interested in it at all!If Ferrell is going to go the route of Jim Carey, DeNiro, Sarandon, Baldwin, or any one of the other whackadoodle bigmouths, I will not waste a speck of time or $$ on anything with him.

I haven't walked out of many movies in my life, but I walked out of this.The reason I hate it most is that it makes me look at Step Brothers and Talladega Nights differently now. I have always considered Ferrell and Riley to be comedic geniuses. After seeing this movie, I'm having to reevaluate. Did they just stumble into something in those others movies? I hate that I'm asking that question now. How could this movie be SO bad? I didn't laugh once.

reviews.review_title: Funny! Hilarious! Forget ratings and critics!
reviews.content: Hands down this is a laugh fest! Forget the ratings and critics. Will Ferrell and John C Reilly are a modern day comic duo and I hope they make more films together. I really do not get the poor ratings and reviews on this one. Nobody is making films like Airplane or Top Secret or Naked Gun anymore these days. Thank you Will Ferell and John C Reilly for keeping this comedy genre going and for making audiences laugh hard. Bravo!

I have never written a review on IMDb. But this move was truly disappointing. I am a massive Will Ferrell fan. I have enjoyed every one of his movies (even Land of the Lost and Casa de mi Padre). But this movie was truly unfunny. I historically, as my wife and friends tell me, laugh at everything. However, I only laughed once during this entire movie, and I forced myself to do so. I really wanted to love this movie, as I have loved everything that Will Ferrell has put out. I even found ways to call Zoolander 2 enjoyable. But this was painfully unfunny. I can only think that Ferrell was somehow contractually obligated to make this picture. As excited as I was to see another Ferrell and Reilly "masterpiece" (Talladega and Step Brothers are both in my top 10), I really hope they find another script worthy of their talents and chemistry. Save your money, see something else.
Worst "comedy" I have seen in a while. Just awful.

I rated this 2 stars for the number of times I laughed. I knew that this was not going to be a Talladega Nights or Step Brothers but I expected some fresh, easy-going, down-to-earth humor. Instead you get stale plot and thoughtless politically driven jokes. I want to watch sports, movies, TV, or anything that stays away from politics. Whether you're left, right, or just don't care; watching something that steps away from politics would be refreshing and this movie sinks to the level of not so subtle jabs at political topics. Ferrel is a great comedian but this was just an attempt to put him back on our radars by appealing to trending "hot button" areas.
Well, I fail to see any humour in this truly awful film. I watched expecting it to be on a par with Step Brothers or Blades of Glory but was sorely disappointed.
I think Will Ferrell jumps the shark here. I have a low bar for humor but this one is limited in laughs.

Yikes. This movie is an absolute trainwreck. I normally love stupidly funny Will Ferrell movies but this was not one of them...it was just plain stupid. Not even the talented John C. Reilly could save this. It's not worth detailing all the ways this movie is a failure, just do yourself a favour and watch something better!

What a train wreck, Will Ferrell and John Reilly are usually a decent laugh but here they're abominable, utter trash. The other actors try their best but there's only so much you can do with a rubbish plot, you can't polish up a dead rat.The plot's terrible and it doesn't even make sense historically, I could perhaps excuse it if the film was funny but it's not. Some jokes go on too long, some are too predictable and others disgusting, I lightly laughed a couple of times but my friends could tell I was trying to force myself to enjoy it.2/10: A disgrace to cinema and comedies
But I felt the need to make it known I would have given it 0 stars if it would have let me.

A film with no redeeming qualities.The plot is simplistic, but the script, the dialogue is worthy of the onanists who created this crock of feculence.All those who appeared in this misfire of a movie will have irrevocably damaged their careers.Sad... so sad...
I wish I could back in time and blow the f'n filming set out, so this movie would never existed. That bad.
Turned off after 25 minutes and I'm surprised I lasted that long. If you're looking for a step brothers type film... watch step brothers again.
Excruciatingly bad. Humour was dreadful. I couldn't take anymore than 30mins of this awful film. Did they have a script or just try and make it up as they went along.

reviews.review_title: Just see it for what it is.
reviews.content: I started watching this movie already knowing about negative ratings, scores, reviews and comments from people all over the internet. With that in mind, I didn't think it was that bad as the majority puts it. It's not good, but it's definitely not the worst movie ever, I'll leave that title for something else, but not a Will Ferrell/John C. Reilly comedy. I won't deny that it has its moments, very few, but moments nonetheless where it succeeded in making me burst out a few laughs. It's a parody, I watch it and took it for what it is, not expecting to be hilarious and have some sort of deep story.Some users in here took it very seriously, and completely bashed this film harshly writing reviews that seem to be pages long; I mean come on, it's a Sherlock Holmes parody where Will Ferrell is Sherlock Holmes. Lighten up for goodness' sake.It's light years away from a good film, but if you don't take it seriously you might enjoy it a bit. Let yourself be the judge.

I took a chance on a opening day movie, which I rarely do. But it's a comedy with Ferrell so what the heck. The humor was very shallow and forced. If I weren't with friends I would have walked out and asked for a refund.

Even John C Reilly and Will Ferrell cannot produce more than a couple of mild laughs in an otherwise long movie.Comedy is the ultimate justice, it's either funny or not, and you instantly know. 90% of this film was not funny.The premise is solid, that Sherlock Holmes is a bumbling detective, and therefore causes far more problems than he solves. Unfortunately, the film's writers do not know how to write more than a couple of funny scenes thus voila!... an unfunny comedyAn unfunny comedy belongs in the same category as an unscary horror movie, a boring thriller and a non-musical musical. The elevator goes to the bottom for these kinds of movies.These two actors deserve far better material than this movie gave them to work with but then again, they did see the scripts before they took the parts ...

It's cringy and unfunny. It's also weirdly sexual at times It doesn't need to be, I feel like it's counting on teens to go see this becuase they say sex in it. It's not funny. And It ruined sherlock holmes. DON'T WATCH!

If I could give less than one star this movie would get it. Not because they weren't a few cheap laughs inbedded in an otherwise lackluster comedy, but because there are two good comedians who have done and know what good work is that totally sold out the people who pay good money to watch their movies. Everybody involved in distributing this movie should be embarrassed but most of all Will Ferrell should be heading back the money he took from his fans. I'd like to say it a different way, but in my opinion he knew well before he released it that this was a dog...same for Reilly.
Why spend money on this film. It would be better used in a charity.
I went to confirm if it was as bad as the reviews made out and it didn't disappoint but was watchable. A bad movie but not as terrible as Mary Poppins

Don't get FOMO (fear of missing out).This was not a good movie. It's a poor amalgam of Step Brothers, Talledega Nights, Blades of Glory and Anchorman. I mean really poor. We felt like we were in the theater for hours, not so, the film is only 90 minutes in length.Heed the reviews. If you see this movie you'll be wasting money you could've used for food, clothing or lodging.
How on earth did this get made?! Its so bad it's just mind boggling - they must have paid Ralph Fiennes a mountain of cash to ruin his legacy...

Wth people? This movie was funny. This is a satire of the legendary duo. After reading so many negative reviews I don't think they realize that. I really enjoyed the performances,story and directing. Definitely worth a watch and see for yourself.
You seriously cannot comprehend how god-awful this movie is.

The tag line on imdb is "a humorous take on sir arthur doyles classic mysteries." they must have missed the mark, since after 33,000 votes, it has a 3.8 rating! Will Ferrell and John Reilly star as Holmes and Watson. There ARE some really funny bits in here. All their mistakes when they meet the queen. Mrs. Hudson's various lovers. And when Holmes meets Doctor Hart. Granted, there are some silly slapstick bits and editing issues. And a duet sung by Reilly and Ferrell. So the queen assigns them the mission of tracking down Moriarty before he can cause more harm. For a good laugh, check out all the razzies for which this film was nominated or awarded. Screenplay and direction by Etan Cohen. He had done Idiocracy and king of the hill with mike judge. Idiocracy is awesome. Check it out, if you haven't seen it. This one... Not so good.

reviews.review_title: Not amazing but not as bad as others make out
reviews.content: I've seen far better than this but the overall reaction is a bit over the top.
