There are a few decent laughs and overall the story keeps it watchable I didn't feel particularly bored at any point even if the acting through was way to overly exasperated. An average comedy that passes the time with a few chuckles

They are making fun of Sherlock! That brilliant mind and detective, they turned that absolutely genius character into a big clown! Humour was good 6% of the time, otherwise, that movie was a disaster! Definitely not recommended, probably a 2 year old would like it. One of the worst movies ever made. They made the great DUO, Sherlock And Watson a big Joke!! The story was kinda good, that's why I am not giving it a 1, I am giving it a 4. If you really want to watch it, then go ahead, maybe some people will like it. But for me, I give it a maximum a 4,5/10!

Impressively, if I may say so myself, I managed to get through 20 minutes of this insufferable dreck.Toilet humour of the lowest order. It is not funny. It is not a comedy - it is a form of torture, which ought to be prohibited by the Geneva Convention. I would not wish this on the inmates of Guantanamo.Like all Will Ferrel movies - I am not a fan to say the least - the 'comedy' aspect is predicated on stupidity passing as comedy. It does not. Jokes are funny, being thick isn't.Some films are so bad they are funny. This is a degree worse than that. It is so bad, it is poison to the senses.Avoid at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Terrible - can't believe it made it to the cinema
reviews.content: Wow if I made this movie I would be embarrassed- I can't belive that it made it to the cinema. I love everything Ferrell he is a comedy genius. If it's a Ferrell movie I know I'm going to laugh for at least 1.5 hours but sadly not one laugh just shocked looks shared between my husband and I. I don't know what else to say if this was an annual student school play you'd feel sorry for your kids. Surely when they saw the daily takes they knew this one wasn't going to make it?
This is an absolute shocker of a movie. Not funny, bad acting, bad script, bad characters, messy direction and painfully outdated humour. Avoid at all costs, there is not one redeeming feature.

reviews.review_title: These utter morons must just laugh at audiences
reviews.content: The ego these 2 "actors" must have must be wider than the Grand Canyon.Fiennes should be ashamed.All extras in this are just pathetic hacks desperate for any gigAll crew just prostitutes. Why call out the emperor has no clothes and lose your job? Smile and tell them how funny they are. They will believe itI bathed after enduring 30 minutes if it. Yes, will Ferrell really was seriously. He and Reilly and others truly do think they are funny

I have just walked out of a packed cinema and the funniest part of the film was that, in this comedy romp, no one laughed the entire film!There were 2 awkward cringe worthy moments with John C. Reilly that warmed you up to a laugh as Ferrell brought it home, but Ferrell fell flat everytime!There is a musical number, Ferrell is decent but if you can get past him, Reilly's voice is beautiful!Loved seeing Hugh Laurie, a shame he was under utilised... Laurie could teach them how to stay relevant! Or atleast boost the story and fun!Kelly McDonald and Ralph Fiennes, again, brilliant actors whose talents were completely wasted on this contrivance.I think this is my favourite Steve Coogan role, he was a joy to watch and used well.Pam Ferris and Rob Brydon were both a delight and I'd love to see them in the same parts again, in a straight version!Sadly Coogan, Ferris and Brydon are not enough to save this trainwreck!As for the "American Ladies" Rebecca Hall and Lauren Lapkus, they did an admirable job! Managing to make the film watchable if not funny or enjoyable...So much high quality talent from both sides of the pond and this flick is an utter waste of time and money for both the viewer and ultimately the poor folks who have their names and money tied to it!

reviews.review_title: I'll never trust a review again
reviews.content: I guess reviews are not real anymore in this world. SAD.

reviews.review_title: New age funny, clever jokes & twists
reviews.content: Another masterpiece from Gary Sanchez Productions.Witty and smart, doesn't let your attention take of a minute break. Naysayers, you've been punk'd ! The jokes are well hidden between carefully crafted scenes and conversations, Etan Cohen excels in smuggling the humor in front of you, and John C. Reilly clearly gets the direction.Like the stand up comedian, who botches well-known and overused cliché punch lines on purpose, I dare to say this piece of comedic art will represent a new chapter in the history of court jesters.Thanks to all contributing to this new era of ingenious entertainment! It has been a privilege to become part of modern art history.

reviews.review_title: I'm truly amazed with people's sense of humour!
reviews.content:
There are many good comedies that have very clever humour... and then there's this garbage.
This film was horrible. It has the kind of humour that makes 15-year-old boys laugh hysterically. I think the one thing that's even more disappointed than the film itself is the fact that Ralph Fiennes decided to be part of it.
It's a travesty, I love Will Ferrel, but this is just awful
I was a bit disappointed. I expected a bit more funny parts.

It'll make you laugh sometimes, but it's mostly cringe-inducing. I went in hoping for something ALMOST as good as the classics provided by Will Ferrel and John C. Reily. It's nowhere close. Don't waste your money, stay away

reviews.review_title: Not funny, not original, not interesting, not worth it even in the background
reviews.content: Disturbingly poorly made movie. I am a Will Ferrell fan, John C Reilly can be funny, and I always root for comedy films to do well. But this was poorly made, written and executed from every angle and shows you comedy writers are not alive and kicking like they were during the previous golden era. Do they even exist at all? It's all a bunch of nerds with cliched, tapered one liners in the terribly formulaic superhero movies running the show. Hopefully someone comes along and starts making us laugh again.
Hard to believe a movie about Sherlock Holmes could be this bad. Simply not worth seeing. The occasional funny moments weren't worth the price of admission.

reviews.review_title: How is a film with this cast so bad?
reviews.content:
This film is so bad it gives me energy.I now feel compelled to warn people who, like us, may be tempted to part with actual cash to watch a Will Ferrell film, purely because it's got Will Ferrell in it... It must be at least 'OK' right? Surely he, and the likes of Coogan and Fiennes wouldn't sign off on this?
I can only presume to think this is some sort of social experiment in which everyone is in on it apart from me and my secretly-filmed reactions are all going to end up on Jimmy Fallon...
The supposedly untouchable Ferrell spends most of the film wrestling with the English accent at the expense of any glimpse of humour.
Old English satire is unforgivingly beyond him, even if the writing had afforded him any chance of making a funny. He simply resorts to the odd Ferrell-esque shriek which comes off as just desperate. It's a painfully damaging blotch to the Ferrell brand.
As for Coogan, Lawrie and Fiennes - they all feature very little (and presumably since have collected their pay checks, run for the hills and will claim they were never involved - I would).Seriously, who wrote this? It's career ending stuff all round. It will win all sorts of 'worst film' awards no doubt.
Ferrell, what are you doing?!
Embarrassing mate.

So much had been said about this abomination already, but I just had to give my input. I rarely get upset watching a movie, but this is the worst I've seen in many years. I hand't even seen the ratings and the reviews before I watched it.It's amazingly unfunny and I litterally didn't have a single laugh in it, not ONCE. And I consider myself a silly dude, who bend over laughing at movies like Step Brothers, Your Highness and Team America.Lets put it this way, the movie Norbit seems like a 10/10 compared to this. This is infact worse than Jack & Jill, true story.I know comedy is subjective of course, and if you like the worst garbage Hollywood has procuded, which is anything from from Jason Freidberg and Aarron Seltzer, like Disaster Movie, Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans etc , you might like Watson & Holmes, cause it's almost as awful as those.

reviews.review_title: I say dear Watson, this film is crap
reviews.content: Here's a turkey, that's for sure, and we know this film has earn't a reputation as a real stinker. I haven't seen a movie this bad for years, as Ferrell and Reilly really make asses of themselves in their quiet dissing of two legendary characters. There are funny moments, granted, and they are great, but most of the film comes off corny and ludicrous, as are most of misfiring gags, because of them being so stupid. There are just long incredulous, droning stretches, where I said to myself through the duration, "This is so bad", or "This is so s..t". The fine supporting score of players are so wasted, as are the others, and that includes almost everyone. Especially Fiennes as the chief Baddie, it's painful to see him in this. One of very few funny moments, is in it's starting. We also have a Titanic moment near the end, with a memorable cast member. Horrible.2.5/10

I know there are plenty of people who are watching the movie without watching. I did watch or at least as much as I could. Just because Ferrell is in it does not mean it will be entertaining. Ferrell's brand of comedy just does not appeal to everyone. Do not waste your money. Wait till you can watch it at home or at the dollar shows and smoke a joint. It might help.

If you're hoping that this will be a funny movie and the critics just don't get it, don't. This is truly terrible.
None of the jokes are funny and you'll be counting down the minutes until the end credits!
This could possibly have had potential if they didn't try to stick to the PG rating.

reviews.review_title: 2 stars because I love Will & John c Reilly
reviews.content: But whoever wrote & directed this for them really sucked this time. NOT another talladega nights or stepbrothers as another reviewer said or any of the other FUNNY movies they've both been in. My boyfriend and I both didn't really laugh once?!!? And we like them and love comedies which this is not. Even the make-up is done badly. Sorry Will and John C Reilly but idk where all the good reviews are coming from on this one.
I tested my powers of endurance but could not last any longer than halfway through this movie before I walked out. If there has been a worse movie made heaven help us

This duo has always been a classic for me, but for the first time in my life I need to write a review and warn people not to watch this movie
Even stoned out of my mind, this movie could not entertain. Just not funny at all, it's like two terrible actors trying to make a movie showing how unfunny they are. Just a terrible snooze fest of a movie don't watch!

Please do not waste your time. I'm a fan of their other movies (step brothers) but this one fell flat. It's sad that today's political climate has affected our movies this much. They should stay out of politics and stick to funny movies. I would say this should be a lesson for them to reflect on but we all know that's not going to happen.Very disappointed this movie had so much potential

reviews.review_title: John Watson devoted his Hamburgers to the Guilty Milly
reviews.content: Sherlock Holmes used to be great. I mean, the books were nicely brought to me by the Illuminati mind indoctrinations of Walt Disney's "The Great Mouse Detective" and now leading to scum Robert Downey Jr and so many others in mummifications of the world's greatest fictional detective. Here all bs comes from the mess all genius of Doyle's creation comes together in all nonsense without the wonder if gather in compulsion. Anyone who would expect the impression of a crown could rewrite the smallest part on each impossible improbability of blood and truth. So sad, for it was capable of a chance to take more violent matters.

reviews.review_title: THE WORST MOVIE I'VE EVER SEEN
reviews.content: I went into this movie with high hopes and was utterly disappointed. Who ever greenlighted this abortion should be fired immediately. This piece of crap surpassed Eyes Wide Shut as the worst movie I've ever seen. How do I hate this movie, let me count the ways:1. The dig at Trump. Yes, we get it, Hollywood hates Trump. It's not shocking anymore, it's not edgy to make fun of him... it's just pathetic. We go to movies to escape from all the political nonsense and yet here it comes... and not even in an entertaining manner.2. The dig at rich white guys. Again, we get it... Hollywood, a town of rich white guys, hates rich white guys. Again, another pathetic attempt at social commentary which falls flat.3. The story absolutely sucked. It started out bad, and just got worse. I've taken more creative dumps than this movie. I kept waiting for something to happen and it never did.4. The acting was absolutely atrocious. Ironically, Ferrell and Reilly can actually act when they want to, but this movie was just garbage and gave them nothing to work with.5. The jokes were incredibly stupid. Not even funny stupid, just stupid. There were a couple of scenes that had a brief moment of humor, but it was shockingly brief.6. Shoehorning Billy Zane in at the end? What was the point of that?I literally left this movie angry. It was a complete waste of time and money, I stayed til the end hoping it would get better and it never did. It deserves every ounce of hate that it receives. And if you think this movie is funny, good or entertaining, I have to ask how much the studio is paying you for a good review, how you sleep at night and what is your actual idea of good entertainment.Avoid this movie like the plague. A colonoscopy would be more fun than sitting through this piece of dog crap.
Another brilliantly funny film from these two masters of comedy. Just what the world needs right now, a good laugh. Unfortunately many have become so uptight, they don't remember how to.

reviews.review_title: Waste my life on watching crap like this
reviews.content: Full of dull humour. Embarrassing story. Holmes looks like an idiot. Totally waste time.
You have to really try to make something this bad.
NEED I SAY MORE? Not funny, not entertaining and not worth even talking about. Some people need to know when to retire.

Ordinarily, i would say: this movie is stoopid funny - that is, when it's stupid and funny. this movie is only stupid. the fact that it is not funny only compounds how gross the childish and repulsive gags (literally) are.i gave it one star with an invisible minus for will ferrell 's sake, whom i admire and whom i can usually count on to make ordinary shirt funny, but he really stepped in it this time.this movie is a dirty sanchez shame and sure-locked down the oscar for don't watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Everyone involved in this film should feel shame
reviews.content: This is beyond terrible, a real low point in careers

reviews.review_title: Where's the bar on this canoe?.......
reviews.content: Detective Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson join forces to investigate a mysterious murder at Buckingham Palace.It seems like an open-and-shut case as all signs point to Professor James Moriarty, the criminal mastermind and longtime nemesis of the crime-solving duo.When new twists and clues begin to emerge, the world's greatest sleuth and his trusted assistant must now use their legendary wits and ingenious methods to catch the killer before the queen becomes the next victim.......Released when no one really bothers to go to the cinema, H&W came out of nowhere and had flip written all over it.And while in some senses it is an unmitigated disaster, when you compare it to the casts other bodies of work, it's still a curiosity piece that needs to be seen, just so you know how ludicrous the whole film is.But, and this is a very loose but, see the film with the lowest common denominator of expectations, and you can revel in the fact that the film has so much potential, and throws every aspect of it out of the window.It's always good to see Ferrell and Reilly together in a film, and here they do have the chemistry that they always have, but as the old adage goes, they are clearly having so much more fun making the film.Add a wonderful British cast, and a very bizarre cameo from Billy Zane, and you truly have one of the most mind blowing films released in 2018.There are a couple of laughs to be had, but they are so childish, you can see the punchline coming before the chicken crosses the road.It's not going to tarnish anybody's career, because it's never going to be remembered, but I feel it will become something of a cult classic in years to come, due to the awful PPV jokes, Trumpisms, and an amazing cast really trying hard to accomplish something
Hardly anyone in the theater laughed at this. Boring.
Just, no. Don't do it, you'll wish you were the murder victim.

I think the dynamic duo officially ended with this complete turd. If you're wanting shake and bake, this ain't it... what a complete waste and no question there is a Million other flicks to watch before this stinker.
One of the worst móviles I've seen. Characteres very idiots, to a insuportable level. The worst is the script. Not recommendable.

reviews.review_title: Should have just gone to the Catalina wine mixer again
reviews.content: In the course of cinematic history there exist a select few grand comedy duos whose careers become inexplicably tied. I'm talking about Bob Hope and Bing Crosby, Abbot and Costello, and Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor. However, perhaps none have come to influence my childhood more than Will Ferrell and John C Reilly. The two are legends now with comedies like Step Brothers and Talladega Nights, and walking into the theater I was hoping the duo had performed their hat trick of excellence. For that optimism I was rewarded with the worst movie I'd seen in a theater all year!Holmes and Watson is a hollow corpse of a movie that lacks the charisma, charm, and raw energy of their other collaborations or even their solo ventures. Its got some jokes worth a Netflix veiwing but definitely not worth your money to see them.As a testament to the lack of quality in this film I heard way more snores than laughs coming from my 3:45 (15:45) showtime. Not a good sign.23/100

reviews.review_title: Not sure what others have watched!
reviews.content: Definite laugh out loud moments but I suspect some reviewers aren't fans of slapstick.
It's bad beyond words..... two complete pollocks pratting about basically. Dated and boring yawn. You need a seriously low brain cell count to sit through this

reviews.review_title: Why did people forget that stupid movies are supposed to be stupid?
reviews.content: The entire point of this movie is to be illogical. It succeeds wonderfully and is hilarious. People have seem to forgotten what comedies are like.
It's not the worst film ever made. Probably not in the worst 100 films ever made. I counted 6 good laughs, even spaced throughout the film, so there was at least that.
This guy generates more carp than a field of cows. Why does he keep getting hired?!

reviews.review_title: I AM SICK OF BOTS VOTING 9 AND 10
reviews.content:
Well, I am sick of people who are rating moviens like this with 9 or 10.It does not make sense anymore. I hate bots!!
In politics, on IMDb, in life!This is just a BAAAAAD movie!!! Should have warnning sign : YOU WILL LOOSE 1 HOUR 30 MINUTES OF YOUR LIFE!So sad how low can actors go.

reviews.review_title: I did not like this movie
reviews.content: The duo of Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly come to the big screen, but in a disappointing way this time. Holmes and Watson boast a solid cast but lack a solid script or plot to entertain. Boredom struck at multiple points in this movie, and with jokes falling flat, it wasn't an enjoyable theater experience.
They should play this on a loop in prisons to punish inmates a bit more. Absolute garbage.

Oh boy... oh this is embarrassing... I've never cringed so much in my life. You could hear the awkward laughter from others in the cinema. Almost like we had to chuckle just enough to be polite. Kinda like when your grandparents tell you a joke that isn't funny but you laugh anyway. Quite literally within the first 5 mins, I wanted to leave. I've never really been a fan of Will Ferrel and this has just reminded me of why that is. I'd rather watch paint dry than sit through this again.

When i saw this movie i thought "haters gonna hate"... But i like it.
It's a simple parody of the Robert Downey Jr/Jude Law movies. It doesn't try to be more than that.
There are some pieces of the old Zucker Abrahams Zucker parodies.
The actors are good enough (specially JCR), the story is funny and the sets are great.
Don't be reluctanct to watch the movie because of the reviews. Everyone is entitled to their opinion and i respect them all, but i thing that many people expected a "serious" and accurate movie and this is not the case.

The Holmes character is closer to his arrogant, narcicist character of Talledega nights without the goofy, careless fun. (Aka Hipster target group). Trying to add politics to comedy doesnt help when fans expect carefree goofyness. It maybe funny to real Sherlock Holmes fans who dont know Will ferrel movies, or college aged sheltered liberals who get permission from their professor and mother. Older Holmes fans; theres some sexual humor
Couldn't wait to see this movie. These two are always hilarious. I was wrong. This was the first time I almost walked out of the movie. But pushed through praying it would get better. It didn't.

This film is awful!!!Not funny and a stupid Sherlock Holmes just does not fit!!Will Farrel is a terrible actor and I forgot I do not like him. Should not have started the film in the fork at place really!!I just could not face watching it to the end and I think I managed thirty minutes of agonising pain before turning it off!!I am not sure what the storyline was supposed to be because nothing made any sense!!If you are thinking of watching this, do not waste your time and find something better to watch!!One star is two stars too many!!How this has three stars I will never know!!!

Never in my life I was tempted to leave from the cinema halfway through, however I stayed hoping for a joke or two that could make me smile...., most likely you would cringe instead of laughing.
If you want a funny take on Sherlock holmes watch 'Without a Clue' with Michael Caine and Ben Kingsley
I am a fan of both actors and they stole my money and my time. I will never go to the movies to see these guys in the future. Do NOT waste your time.
Will C. Reilly was not too funny. Bad writing + Bad acting.

Being the first people to leave after this pitiful excuse of a movie. The political jabs started in the beginning and didn't end until the end. The most annoying part of the movie was when Ferrell and Reilly were yelling for their chamber maid. Annoying and useless dribble. Etan should refund everyone who wasted a Christmas day on this garabage he calls a movie.

In order to start my review with something positive about this movie I am only able to reference one scene, that being the one which was a well-executed parody of the most famous scene from 'Ghost' (1990).Beyond that I found this movie to be a tediously clumsy attempt at comedy, neither clever enough to be a parody in its entirety nor witty enough to be considered a spoof. I cannot say that any of the anachronisms worked comedically and to my mind they were an annoyance that added nothing to either the characterisations or the plot, for example, transposing The Titanic to the Victorian era was quite simply, totally pointless to any aspect of the movie and had no comedic value at all so, why do it?I expect this movie will feature strongly at the next annual Raspberry Awards and I would not be at all surprised if, in time, it becomes a cherished cult film in the manner of 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' and 'Attack of the Killer Tomatoes'.

reviews.review_title: I don't know why everyone's complaining!
reviews.content:
I was sat at the back of the cinema screen, and I could see that 3 people walked out half way through, although I don't know why. Maybe they went expecting to see a serious take on Sherlock Holmes? Or maybe they just can't appreciate sarcastic comedy?
This film made me laugh out loud on more than one occasion, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. It wasn't meant to be a serious film, and the comedy was meant to be forced and spoof-like. That's just the type of comedy that it was! That's why I don't understand why some people are complaining so much. I mean, fair enough if that's not your style of humour, but that doesn't mean it deserves a 1 star.

reviews.review_title: Waste of my time and money
reviews.content:
I usually like any movie with Will or John but as soon as I heard they were making this movie, I was hoping it was a joke or that it would never reach full production. Then I saw the trailer and knew I needed to avoid it at all costs.
Unfortunately, as much as I love my girlfriend, about 90% of what she watches is terrible. Suffice to say she gravitated towards wanting to see this particular movie on date night and I immediately started loathing it. And for good reasons.
Usually the pairing of Will and John results in ridiculousness of the comedic kind. This was opposite. It's as if they no longer know how to make good jokes (even if through improvisation) and have resulted to making juvenile scenarios or something that's so odd that it was likely hoping to come across as comedic but lands on unsettling or confusing.
I could say more but I just wanted to say AVOID THIS MOVIE AT ALL COSTS!!!!
Terrible, TERRIBLE movie!
Didn't need all the anti-Trump references and other barbs toward our Country, i.e. American gun jokes.
This has to be the most stupid movie i ever watched. It really is too funny. U have to love dumb humor tho

reviews.review_title: Not an empty movie after all
reviews.content: I went into this with really low expectations after all the negative reviews. It turned out that the comedy was using unoriginal stink and gross jokes including feces, pee, puke and whatnot.It had a few good and original moments, but they're not very numerous. Another pro would be that it actually has a plot, and the character play their roles well at least. But too bad such an important was wasted, this would have delivered such a cannon.I can't believe that the one who wrote these jokes got hundreds of grands of money5/10, didn't bore me at least.
Why anyone who saw that trailer would think this would be worth seeing even for free is beyond me.But then, these are people who think Will Ferrell is funny. And even they were unimpressed.
Had funny moments but was expecting so much more from a Will Ferrell movie. Was very lacking and some of the humor was super weird.
Just not good writing. Both are brilliant comedians but the accents were horrible and the jokes were lame

How many people here actually paid to see "Holmes & Watson" over the holiday weekend? I did, so I feel very special, because my sister, who got dragged along, won't let me forget it. I looked at the cast, and thought, "How bad can it be?" Let me tell you, there's no conveying how bad. There aren't enough English words -- hell, words of any language -- to adequately describe it.

It's great and exactly what you'd expect. When we rented it, the first review that showed up accused that this was "another liberal elite" blah blah blah....
Be smart and watch this movie with smart people. It'll be great. :-)

This movie would of gotten a 7, but I deserves higher than a 3.8, it is hilarious and I thought the ending had quite the twist. If you are expecting a serious take on the character, watch the Robert Downey Jr. movies, if you are looking for a Step Brothers type movie, look no further.

Even if you're a fan of Ferrell and Reilly (I am) DO NOT waste your time. This movie would have been hilarious if it was condensed into a 3 minute sketch on SNL. As a full length feature movie, it's a complete flop. I couldn't wait for this travesty of cinema to end.

This movie is an utterly baffaling waste of money and time. This movie relied on tasteless and tired humor that was more disgusting than funny. Never have I ever walked out of a movie but this is the closest I have ever come.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have seen in the last 15 years!
reviews.content:
There should be a movie police, that can arrest and send them to a movie court, where a critic aka movie judge can charge them for conning the public and the movie industry.
I want my 8 dollars back please

When I saw the trailer for this movie I figured it would be as hilarious as Step Brothers or Taladayga Nights. But this is a sad attempt to mascaraed political ideology of there is a wage gap, Electiral College is bad, Orange man bad, women don't need no man and that all white men are the problem in the world. Basically every NPC talking point with a sprinkle of comedy. If I wanted to see all of these talking points I would have watched the news. Hollywood has gone off the deep end with this one do yourself a favor, avoid this monstrosity and a buy yourself an enema. It will be better then this movie.

reviews.review_title: How a soundtrack can ruin a movie
reviews.content: Just what you would expect, some very funny scenes. But the choice of music totally ruined the whole movie. They should have used an original score, plan and simple.

Watching this right now and wishing I could do taxes again to avoid watching this. Step brothers or Talladega nights it's not. Also the political bad mouthing of the US is disrespectful, but that's Hollywood living in their own bubble.

I literally created an account so I could review this "film". It has no real storyline, no real humor and no real point. If it would have at least TRIED to keep the same formula as previous films these 2 have done, it would have been much better. The whole film is a series of one liner, crass toilet humor that isn't even funny. Could have been great but was complete trash.

I am stupified by the negative response to this film. The laughs were plenty and often and anyone who is a fan of O'Reilly and Ferrel's brand of comedy will get exactly what they are hoping for. I can not for the life of me imagine the harrowing trauma experienced in a previous life of anyone who rated this film down to a 3.4 average!

reviews.review_title: I Honestly couldn't believe how bad the movie was
reviews.content: Alright. So I loved Will Ferrell and John C Reiley in a bunch of previous movies (Dewey cox story, Talledega nights, Stepbrothers, Anchorman). So when I saw both of them in the same movie, I was expecting a very good comedy with lots of random situations and hysterical laughter. Unfortunately this was not the case.The movie was very slow paced. This movie could have been easily done in 65-70 minute run time however they decide to throw in filler for 80% of the film.The trump jokes, while somewhat funny, we're kinda lacking any connection with the story at hand. What does Sherlock Holmes have to do with 2018 pop culture and politics?The fight scene in the movie with the Perrenal WWF Jobber Braun Strowman, looked about as out of place as Arnold fighting the Big Show in "Jingle All the Way". More Robert Downing Jr Ripoff during this scene with the math equation "that didn't work".The one doctor being a cat had no place in the storyline. What was her purpose other than standing there? Why cast that role in the first place?There was only 6 people in attendance for the film. 3 people walked out leaving me and my friend Joe and some random woman towards the front. I then started to pull out my dab pen to try and stay focused on the film. The final scene with Morarity dying the way he does and Sherlock saving his friend Watson that he had betrayed and accused him of killing everyone was very lackluster. A musical number made no sense hereOne F bomb the entire film. Clearly a phoned in performance by both men. Will Ferrell might be on the down slope ala Jim and Adam.

reviews.review_title: Tried too hard to be dunny
reviews.content: Onlybone character made me laugh and it wasn't Will or John. Everything about the movie felt forced and the jokes fell flat. Disappointing tonsoend xmas night on this garbage

QUITE SHOCKING my dear Watson that this only got 3.8 stars at the time of Feb 2022.I laughed hard. It's childish and brilliant. Maybe have a few glasses of wine first. A travesty that this is rated so low. I can't express how much more it should get.6 to 6.5 at least. Just goes to show that if I'd listened to the rating I wouldn't have had tears rolling down my face.Giving a 10 to boost the score.

reviews.review_title: A Disappointing Unfunny Continuation of One of My Favorite Duos
reviews.content:
Holmes and Watson has the potential to be at most a fun silly/stupid comedy, something these two stars are usually brilliant at succeeding together. However, Holmes and Watson somehow manages to squander its humor at every turn. What may seem clever on paper, is nearly executed in the worst way possible every time. It is almost brilliant how well the film falls flat so often, and seems most of all to serve as a reminder of how truly awful some comedies can be when you have screenwriters and actors who hardly seem to try. Though he is hardly in the movie, Steve Coogan as the films suspected tattoo artist seems to be the standout in the film, and is the only chuckle-esc moment the film has to offer. The acting is nearly horrible, and terribly on the nose. The film can never decide what it wants to be, how insane it wants to be, how it wants to act, or where it is going. The only positive thing it really has to offer, is a surprisingly fitting setting and set pieces for the background, though in the end some fitting pictures are hardly what makes any film worthwhile.
My Rating: 2.5/10

reviews.review_title: This would be my least favorite movie... if it could be recognized as a movie
reviews.content: True story: A car hit a transformer and knocked the power out in my block. I checked the movie times on the app as I figured a movie would kill time. I saw this was starting within 20 min so I grabbed my popcorn bucket and headed to the theater. Thirty minutes in and I opted to head back to the dark, quiet solitude of my home.It's just Will Ferrell and John C Reilly yelling because they're in a fish-out-water scenario. Like Will Ferrell in Elf... or Will Ferrell in The Other Guys... or Will Ferrell in a Will Ferrell movie.

A Trump gag in a Sherlock film? Seriously? Hollywood is out of ideas. People walked out for refunds. If I wanted to watch trash I would be still watching snl or late night bs. Good riddance to bad rubbish.

Surely this is not a master piece, and surely it's not a complete trash either.
Prepare yourself for silly humor, don't contain your laughs no matter how silly they look like. Forget these hysterical haters and their exaggerated low ratings. Simply, have fun and let it flow.

reviews.review_title: How This Crap was Funded is Beyond me
reviews.content: The most cringworthy, unfunny smoking pile of horse manure.Don't waste your precious time by watching this garbage.

When this film was released and it got bad reviews I was like no way is it that bad especially with Will Ferrell and John c Riley the stars as they were amazing in Talladega nights and step brothers. After watching it I thought what a waste of time wouldn't recommend it all.
Sad to say that this is probably the worst film I have ever paid to watch! Plot line was so lacking even for a slapstick film. Especially do not watch if you are a fan of Sherlock Holmes.

reviews.review_title: I so wanted a Stepbrothers laugh, but none
reviews.content: I've loved all their work together. Physical humor. Crude language. Fresh humor. This was such a disappointment. Jokes were forced, predictable and not funny. Better luck next time, boys. And next time I'll read the reviews before spending good money on a movie theater ticket.
Ed wood was a master movie maker compared to this film. This is not watchable on any level.

reviews.review_title: 65/5000 Somehow it was just expecting something much better about this, but no.
reviews.content: Yes, you noticed it right from the start, something very bad is coming.Usually such good Actors probably did their best, but when the script was so lousy.Frankly, at almost no point did I seem to laugh. The only good things I find in the staging.Don't waste your time on this.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie in a long time
reviews.content:
I normally love Will Ferrel's stuff. Step brothers was actually funny.
This movie was not.
The only reason it got 1/10 was because of Hugh Laurie being in it.
I was expecting good thing from that duoBut holy cow its bad... really badFelt bad for johnc riley to be stuck in that junk

Seriously why did this turn out so bad.
It has the perfect ingredients of 2 of the comedy geniuses of our time and my favourite detective of all time. How this turned out to be such an awful mess falls down to the poor writing and poor direction.
The writer and Director need to be layed down with their balls exposed just as a herd of wild buffalo stampede through the area.

reviews.review_title: Will Ferrell is way past his prime.
reviews.content: I couldn't even produce a fake laugh for this train-wreck of a "comedy" if I tried. No redeeming qualities here. It is painfully unfunny, stupid and lazy.
Horrible movie honstley a disgrace to Sherlock Holmes was not funny at all.
Wanted to ask for my money back. The 15 people in the theatre who also didnt read reviews never laughed. The general comment of people discussing the movie on the way out... were that wasnt funny.

reviews.review_title: I'm only giving this one because I can't score it as zero
reviews.content: This was the worst movie I've ever watched. I didn't walk out but I really wished I had! Full of bad innuendo, uneeded bad language. Especially because they had kids saying it. Too many unfunny references to recreational drugs that was supposed to make you laugh, but didn't. Will Ferrell seemed to be still trying to ride on the success wave of Elf but failed miserably in this picture. It is filled with good and well known actors which I feel are probably now cringing at the reviews. Definitely give this a miss.
I don't know why people are hating. It's funny and a good movie, yes it could have been better but come on. They are kinda making fun of the whole thing.
This is hands up the most boring film I have seen and it's not worth your time at all! The jokes is not funny!

reviews.review_title: You are awful, but I like you
reviews.content: Um, well its a rubbish film. I Mean Really Baaad. But it is amusing all the same. Plenty of cheap humour but I'm certain everyone would laugh at something during the film. And it has a strong cast so 4/10 to me says it's still watchable even if it isn't a classic Will Ferrell - or maybe it is!

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie I've seen
reviews.content: I was expecting to completely dislike this movie but there were points throughout the movie that I chuckled so I give it a pass

reviews.review_title: Recently dubbed by the "Rancid Potatoes" site as . . .
reviews.content: . . . "surely the worst flick of all time," it will come as no surprise to learn that HOLMES & WATSON has been disgorged by the nefarious fiends from Sony, the official propaganda arm of a Japanese "government" still livid over losing a World War Two which IT started with its infamous sneak attack upon America. This morally bankrupt Gang of Ghouls delights in mocking our Beloved USA Heroes, including Uncle Sam, Robin Hood, and--now--Sherlock Holmes. This wretched, raunchy, rotten riot of excessive poor taste gobbles up any glimmer of good will with gluttonous glee, as it glories in dragging down even Leader Trump explicitly by name with frequent anachronistic citations. At the very least, HOLMES & WATSON proves the case that Sony must be permanently dissolved ASAP. Certainly under the existing International Slander Statutes and our Geneva Conventions, Leader Trump would be well within his rights to complete a thorough, final, comprehensive nuking of Japan, as well as to immediately liquidate Sony's North American Fellow Traveling Collaborators with "Extreme Prejudice."

Poor narrative, script, cringy jokes and not even the Witt of John and will could make me laugh more than twice ( and the audience was silent throughout the film, making it more awkward to at least laugh once.

This movie had potential with some great movies both these actors have done. The writing and directing really let this down, dont think i managed to smile or laugh once. It was like a 4 yr old directed this and had no common sense. probably go down as the worst movie i have seen in a long time.

A friend obtained a copy of this and invited me to watch it with her. We turned it off after 20 minutes. Painfully over-acted and an unrelenting stream of lame gag after another.I feel like I wasted my time and my gas money driving over to watch this turkey. At least lunch was nice.

Certainly not the reunion I'd hoped for. If you're hoping for Step Brothers 2 you'll be sadly disappointed, it's not even Anchorman 2 and that's saying something. I only found myself laughing the once during an amusing homage to Ghost. Other than that the whole film was decidedly rather dull and entirely forgettable.

Nothing fell into place on this one. The jokes were bad, there was no thrill to the plot, and there was absolutely no need for another Sherlock Holmes adaptation. Being a crime-solving movie, you would think it would at least be clever. But no. It was dull, uninteresting, and not funny. I found myself pity laughing at times, but other than that I wanted to leave the theater the whole time.

reviews.review_title: A blight on the careers of everyone involved
reviews.content: This is about as atrocious as cinema comes. It's a shame, but this a blight on all of the people involved. Why Ralph Fiennes agreed to be in this diabolical piece of trash I'll never know. If I could rate it 0 I would.

reviews.review_title: These two should've just stopped after Step Brothers
reviews.content: Even though I never found Step Brothers that funny, let alone Ricky Bobby absurdity, this one tops them all. There's just nothing more to say about this movie.P.S please stop with "comedy duo" flicks and same goes to Tina Fey and Amy Poller.

reviews.review_title: Hysterical if you're not a millennial.
reviews.content: Great movie. Very funny, but I can see how the humor would be lost on today's "triggered " soy babies.

reviews.review_title: As bad as the reviews say
reviews.content:
Extremely basic "jokes" that you've seen in 15 other films.
About 6 recycled political jokes that aren't clever and really just out of nowhere sometimes.The case Sherlock couldn't solve is how to write a good movie.
It's simply refreshing - perfect comedy in unique view to Holmes.

reviews.review_title: Not great but still had some laughs. Very average.
reviews.content: This IS Will Ferrell so if you're expecting high quality entertainment forget about it. With that being said this movie is better than some he put out (somewhat raunchy but tamer than some) and has a few laughs. If you can overlook the political potshots for what they are then you won't see this movie as a complete wash.

reviews.review_title: One of the most talented comedic duos of our time wasted in this horrible parody.
reviews.content: Political humour and immature jokes are peppered throughout this movie. The script is awful and the plot is basic and unoriginal for the source material Etan Cohen had.Nothing about this movie besides the cinematography is worth it - and what was striking was how short this movie was at a mere 89 minutes (although it did save me from the torture I was enduring). Plenty of people were walking out midway through.All in all, a stain on the original source material and the character of Sherlock Holmes, no matter if it is a parody or not.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst comedy films
reviews.content: Terrible movie, no funny jokes and a terrible sly dig at donald trump. Such a terrible movie

From start to finish, the movie was poorly done. The jokes were overused, crude, and repetitive. The best part of the movie was the three minute song that showed that this movie should have been a musical from the beginning. Save your time, skip this one for sure.

reviews.review_title: Forced Attempt at Humor - Not Funny
reviews.content: We walked out after an hour. The attempts at humor fell flat. We were bored and got tired of waiting for it to improve. It just kept getting worse.

reviews.review_title: Snakes on a plane has better laughs than this and they were unintentionally.
reviews.content: Okay from the beginning, I wasn't expecting this to be good. I went in thinking it was going to be okay at best. This is without a doubt one of the (if not) the worst comedy's I have ever seen. If you listen carefully throughout the film you can hear Sir Arthur Conan Doyle roll in his grave.I honestly don't know where to start with this movie. The writing was terrible, the comedy was forced and had no effort put into it, both the leads were incompetent and cringe worthy and worst of all you had a cast of some of the best tv comics ever and you barley use them. I feel sorry for the DVDs that had this burnt into them.All and all avoid like the plaque

This is most assuredly the worst movie i have seen in years. It is a horrible telling of Sherlock Holmes. Ferrell and Riley make an absolute shambles of the story with their over the top exaggerated acting.
Did not make it past the 15 min test. Which is,, at the 15 min mark I am not into the movie, or even annoyed with it, it gets turned off.

reviews.review_title: Ashamed I couldn't walk out (watched at home)
reviews.content:
I 100% believe many people walked out, and just surprised that it doesn't happen more often. I can see why the concept was thought to be good because there are several other films that are similar that have done well.
If one goes in to watch this not knowing it's a STUPID comedy, then one will be very upset. Once you can accept that it's an attempt at a Pink Panther like film that misses, then one can at least not vomit.

I like Will Ferrell and John C Reilly and they have both been in some good comedies but this unfortunately was not one of them.The writing is horrendous with very amateurish attempts at humour that really did not work and the whole film had a low budget feel to it. The plot was ridiculous (but not in a funny way) and Ferrell/Reilly were wasted in this rubbish. The sets and background CGI even looked basic or bad and unrealistic and the average episode of Ripper Street looked more like Victorian London that this.
If you want to see a humourous version of Sherlock Holmes then watch the Robert Downey Jnr versions as at least they are entertaining and look much more polished than this rubbish

Well...they can't all be winners.I know that Will Ferrell is an "acquired taste" - either you like the "all in" comedy of this man, or you don't. I happen to like Ferrell, his comedy has aged on me like a fine wine. I find that some of his most recent films like THE OTHER GUYS and THE HOUSE are very funny (maybe not as funny as ANCHORMAN...but what is). I think this comedian still has his fastball.But, sometimes, wine doesn't age well, it turns into vinegar. And for Ferrell, this vinegar is the comedic dud that is HOLMES & WATSON.Partnering with familiar on-screen partner John C. Reilly (who paired with Ferrell in films like STEP BROTHERS and TALLEDEGA NIGHTS) this film is a parody of the multitude of Sherlock Holmes films - this time showing that not only is Holmes and idiot but so is Watson. But, somehow, they manage to solve the crime and save the day anyway.Ferrell is (typically) over-the-top and obtuse as Holmes. Usually, this combination works for him (see ANCHORMAN) but it just falls flat here. Same thing for John C. Reilly's Watson - he is just as over-the-top and obtuse and (I think) that's the beginning of the problem here. The two just bounce off each other without the joke landing on either of them - nor does it land of the audience.Ralph Fiennes (Moriarty), Rebecca Hall (potential girlfriend), Rob Brydon (Inspector Lestrade) and Kelly Macdonald (Mrs. Hudson) all fair poorly with poor material to work with.Writer/Director Etan (that's Etan, not Ethan) Cohen (IDIOCRACY) does nothing to help things here with either his writing or his direction. My only thought here is that he thought that Ferrell and Reilly could improvise themselves into a good film.It didn't happen.Letter Grade: C (because I guffawed out loud - despite myself - a couple of times)4 stars (out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

Will Ferrell is a beautiful and amazing transgender actor who does not deserve the hate she is currently recieving. We are living in 2018 and it is time for Christianity to finally hault on all its hate. Yes I understand a lot of you are less progressive than myself but in the future is it my kind which will be known for creating the positive future of tomorrow. Not you people. And in that future the entire works of Will Ferrell will be our Bible and great leaders will carry around USB sticks with our beautiful transgender God to signify his importance.

Couldn't sleep.Then we tried to watch some more. It's just so bad. Not funny at all. I think they made this movie for themselves so they could hang out. I can't think of any other reason. It sucks so hard. It's so bad. Please don't see it. It's terrible.
This is one of the worst movies I have ever encountered. Managed 11 minutes in the hope that Will wouldn't be caught dead doing this infantile nonsense.

The worst movie ever.The worst movie ever

reviews.review_title: Not a good movie at all
reviews.content: Will Ferrell and John C Riley speaking with English accents was bad enough, but the plot was terrible and predictable. The few puns at making fun of President Trump and depicting Americans as gun hungry, blood thirsty killers was about enough to make me get up and walk out. Since this was a period movie, playing a record with 50's music was a stab and comedy, but didn't really work. There wasn't much of comedy in this movie and I was glad the movie ended. While Will Ferrell has made some good movies, this is by far one of the worse ones he has been in. I highly recommend not wasting your money on this movie.

reviews.review_title: It's All About the Script, Stupid: A well made but mostly unfunny Sherlock Holmes comedy
reviews.content: Friday Night at the (Netflix) Movies: Holmes & Watson. It's been on my list for a while mainly because of Will Ferrell and John C. Riley. Not the worst comedy I've ever seen, but more smiles than laughs for me. As the years go by, there are fewer and fewer truly new yarns to be told about Sherlock Holmes and his companion, Dr. John Watson.The production values were very high. Top notch cinematography, set design, costumes and acting talent. They even had former Akron Devo band member Mark Mothersbaugh write the musical score. I fault the film's Writer/Director Etan Cohen for providing a mostly predictable and unfunny script as well as the 10 Producers - which include Ferrell - for not insisting on better. Marginally recommended.
I was sceptical before watching this, but have to say it made me chuckle from start to finish. I think the film got a bad press which was undeserved.
I lasted a whole 26 minutes. nothing funny at all. lame, boring, annoying.

I really don't get the hatred this film gets. Whoever voted this Worst Picture and John C. Reilly Worst Supporting Actor and this years Golden Raspberries, obviously didn't realise it was a spoof, in the same vein as Naked Gun and Airplane. From beginning to end I didn't stop laughing. Will it be remembered in 30 years? Probably not but at the moment, if you want a good laugh, check this one out.
Watch it. Don't read reviews. If we we listened to everyone we wouldn't do anything
Will Ferrell is like tripe you either like him or hate him. I fall into the later and this film falls into the same unfunny standard I've come to expect from him
Drink a handful of beers first and you'll have a few laughs. It's not good, but not quite as bad as the reviews it's been getting.

reviews.review_title: WHy do people never appreciate all the effort?
reviews.content:
So what one will about this film, but it had some hilarious parts, and plenty of good old fashioned , just plain funny in an good enough way, parts.
The amount of attention to detail for the clothing, the scenery, everything was a testament to the determination to make a movie set in the late 19th century, England. Following loosely along with the latter Holmes tale concerning the ever present villain Moriarty, THe ffort was there, yet at times the pacing felt off and the acting of everyone present was not good enough. Opinions vary on so many matters, and speaking personally the combination of Farrell and Riley was not the best duo I have ever see, but this movie was in my mind, again, due to the effort therein, at least better than the pile that was step brothers. I really was so bored with that film. Again, the comparison is not meant to make one think this film is that worth paying for, and it felt kinda hollow after the movie was over, and that the film had been more of an filler for the 3rd real Sherlock moive that Robert Downy Jr just hasnt been able to make cause of the shackles marvel/ Disney has on him. BEen a while since I saw a flick that NEEDED nudity in it, but then pg 13 films these last couple years have been a monumental disappointment, so its no surprise. Trying to boost viewership with a lower rating, only hurt this film the more. Personally I liked it enough, but still have to give this film a 5.5/10 ( 5)

Holmes & Watson is a lazy and pathetic cash grab that insults the Sherlock Holmes brand to the point where I think Arthur Conan Doyle is rolling in his grave as I write this.This movie takes the genius character of Sherlock Holmes and the empathetic companion of Dr. Watson and turns them into bumbling buffoons so they can be 'funny'. Sherlock Holmes as a comedy doesn't really seem like a good idea, but this movie is the worst possible scenario.All the comedic bits can be 20 seconds to 3 minutes long, and they are just so repetitive, stupid and pandering. Like in the trailer, the leads try to take a selfie with the queen, and they do platypus lips and stuff, I don't want to remember. Thing is, the people making the movie are too lazy to actually get the camera to take a picture, so they just get Sherlock and Watson to whack the queen with it. After that, they think the queen is dead and it's just minute after minute of them being idiots. Nothing changes, there's nothing clever about it, no one in the theatre laughed at it. That scene was pretty much the entire movie in a few minutes. If you found it funny, I guess I'm happy for you. Me and everyone else who watched it with me in the theatre got little from it.There's the music as well, which is just annoying pop music that doesn't fit at all with the time period, characters and sometimes what the characters are doing. It's just there so the audience can recognise it. I don't know if it was meant to add to the comedy, because I think it detracts from the tiny slither of comedic value the movie might have.I'm glad that Will Ferrell is getting a lot of money from being in these awful 'comedies'. But, if movies like this keep being released then most people will be burnt out on this. I hope those who keep making these movies have some kind of change of heart, or just anything to get them to stop.This movie is horrible.
I wish I got my money back, there was no a main plot and direction to the movie. Was expecting a lot more from the main actors and the acting was very bad and hard to watch.
The movie was dull as dirt. I thought the entertainment couldn't get moly how worse and then they started singing. Script was bad all the way around.

Yes, unfortunately, another pure "comedy" let-down. It was funny for a brief time, but not that I would recommend spending time and effort. Quite blank and pointless movie.. I checked phone at least three times! Skip it.

Seriously disappointing. Disjointed. It feels like it's trying to poke fun at today's society through the historical framework of the Holmes era but it just feels like a couple of good gags with a lot of dress ups in between. The selfie gag sticks out as funny but the whole queen gag just left me astonished rather than hysterical, which should be their intent. It's in the satirical vein of naked gun and scary movie but for me it's just not that funny. I love Will Ferrell and he gives it a crack but something's just not right with this movie.

The worst movie of 2018 or lets say 2019, gringey toilet humour that wasn't even funny. The jokes are taken too far and fall flat on their face. Will Ferrell should just quit acting of this is the garbage he is going to churn out. My husband fell asleep in the cinema and starting snoring, the movie was that boring. Recycled jokes, bottom of the barrel stuff, this movie would of ended up in the bargain bin if video stores still existed !!

reviews.review_title: An absolute insult to the cinema
reviews.content: I Went to see this film on Boxing Night with the wife. I have been a regular cinema goer for 50 years and thought I'd seen some utter tripe but this heap of garbage really does take the biscuit. People were leaving in droves. The only so called comedy film I have ever seen where no - one in the auditorium laughed. Most of the audience were either asleep or walked out. If I could give this a minus 500 rating I would.

reviews.review_title: Made me laugh because of how god awful and dumb it is
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of the earlier Will Ferrell and John C. Reily films Talledega Nights and Step Brothers with the latter being one of my favorite comedies of all time. Around 2018, there were rumors (but only rumors and not even good ones) about a possible sequel to Step Brothers. When I saw a trailer showing clips from Step Brothers, I was estatic. And then I was dissappointed..... Not because it the trailer was bad (and it was) but rather because I would rather have had a sequel to Step Brothers rather than this film. Holmes and Watson was released on December 25th of 2018 and the film was pretty much panned by critics and audiences. I could not tell you how many stories I heard of people walking out and stories of what movie theaters did in response to this movie being a pile of garbage. Though, I tried to keep an open mind. It would not be until nearly two years after this film's release that I decided to buy this film on DVD and watch it. Was it a waste of seven bucks? Perhaps... but at least I have the Holy Trinity of Will Ferrell and John C. Reily films.The film follows Sherlock Holmes (played by Will Ferrell) and Watson (played by John C. Reily) who are investingating a murder that happened at Buckingham Palace. All kinds of dumb stuff happen and well.... that is pretty much it.I honestly try my best to give a brief description of the film without making it sound bad, but this film does make it very hard for me. With that being said, this movie is bad but bad in the way that an Adam Sandler movie is bad. It makes me laugh, but only due to it's absurdity. Nothing is really clever about the humor at all and the only way that one can somewhat enjoy it is by taking your mind off of everything else and just focus on the movie and at least keep an open mind about what you are watching. I did exactly that. I am not mad for watching this film. The comedy is fairly strange. First thing that this film opens up with is a fake Hannah Montana quote. Due to it's absurdity, I laughed at it. This film does that a lot where it makes references to things today. The only problem is that this film takes place in the late 1800's and it is a problem when this film decides to have the Titanic in it. Wow..... great job movie. Clearly, this movie was not made for the intellectuals. Some of the jokes drag on for a long time and there are pointless scenes that add nothing to the story other than to make an attempt to make people laugh. Nothing is really memorable about this film. Will Ferrell and John C. Reily give a performance that is bad and honestly it feels like they improvised all of their lines. Stuff like this was funny in Step Brothers but in here, it is not really funny. Will Ferrell plays the worst Sherlock Holmes ever and that might be the joke here. For a smart guy, Sherlock Holmes is really dumb. Sherlock Holmes stories in general are supposed to make your mind think and here, there is no mystery. There is not even a big focus on it in my opinion. When the "mystery" is solved, it is not very satisfactory and it is dumb. Professor Moriarty is supposed to be a very smart bad guy in Sherlock Holmes stories and he is not used at all in this film. Which just makes the ending even dumber. I will go ahead and complain again about how modern references are in this film. The whole soundtrack is your typicall bad rap hip hop music that is in every bad comedy. Ugh...Holmes and Watson is a bad film. It is far from being the worst comedy ever (films like the Larry the Cable Guy movies are such examples). I would not even say that it is even close. Rating it a two would mean that the film made me laugh once and I laughed more than once. So a three star rating shall suffice.

Did someone mentioned that this movie is bad? Oh yes all the reviews were all the same! Well, I'm not going to sugar coat it, IT WAS HORRIBLE! I am a huge fan of Will Ferrel and I have seen almost all of his movie but this was not I was expecting. I have so many questions to why did this movie even shown in the Cinema much more opened up on Christmas Day! I hope Will Ferrel and John C. Reily can still redeem themselves after this movie and come up with something that will surpass their 2 previous blockbuster movies. Here's to hoping!

reviews.review_title: As stupid as you expect, but terrible.

Almost all of the jokes were forced humor and I couldn't stand their English accent they put on for the movie. Wait till this is on cable television, which it will be in a month or two. Highly disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Objectively, maybe not the worst I've Seen but, actually probably the worst
reviews.content: I did not go into this expecting much. I figured that a laugh or two would be enough to make it worth my time. It wasn't worth my time. I did not even smile for the first 40 minutes of the film and at that point decided it was time to leave. I can't imagine how anyone could have possibly have thought it was a good idea to okay spending money to make this movie. Just goes to show that the people making decisions in Hollywood may be the dumbest on the planet. The only movie I can remember that was nearly as bad as this one was "Cyclone". Although, I probably shouldn't insult "Cyclone" like that.

At least it's a comedy and not a dramedy. Also I was relieved to find that it wasn't a shot for shot parody of Guy Ritchies Sherlock Holmes which the previews led me to believe. There's some good stuff here. It's no worse or flat than a Mr Bean or Johnny English. If you're in a good mood then this hits the right notes. Was better than Mortecai which was a british-ish comedy. If Ferrell and Reilly keep making these I'd watch em. The story wasn't bad. Better than watching the news. Had a lot of uncomfortably unfunny moments, but also some lol ones. Good try i say.

Too put plainly and too save time. This movie is easily one of the worst movies that have ever been made, Watching the twilight franchise would seem a cinematography master piece to this. Thought would relax on boxing Day & have a good laugh. Not the case, not funny at all. Left cinema after 30 mins. Absolutely Rubbish.
I actually found this film pretty humorous and I'm sad I'm just now watching it in 2020 and not 2018. Wasn't like big belle laughs belit definitely some good chuckles

reviews.review_title: What did you expect? It's Ferrell and O'Reilly
reviews.content: It's not fantastic, marvelous, hilarious, or any other hyperbole you could apply. It's juvenile, stupid, silly, sarcastic and wink-wink sly. I got what I expected from these goofy guys.

Directed by Etan Cohen. Starring Will Ferrell, John C. Reilly, Rebecca Hall, Rob Brydon, Ralph Fiennes, Kelly MacDonald, Lauren Lapkus, Steve Coogan, Pam Ferris, Hugh Laurie, Michael Culkin. (PG-13)Broad, anachronistic comedy version of the relationship between Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's indefatigable characters Sherlock Holmes (Ferrell) and Doctor Watson (Reilly); here they try to solve a rather pedestrian murder mystery and assassination plot against the queen. A scattering of laughs in the hit-or-miss early-going, but they dry up quick; far too many dated gags, lame contemporary references (selfies, MAGA hats, "Unchained Melody," etc.), and uninspired slapstick routines sour the experience. Cohen's script is especially lazy, using puerility as a crutch and even botching a Billy Zane cameo. The stars are typically funny together, but they don't even try to play actual characters here (no matter how thinly-defined), and settle on being vaguely dumb, pompous and socially awkward; the supporting cast is littered with talent but they're largely wasted (Lapkus hardly even gets to speak until the denouement). Not quite as awful as initially reported, but still not worth anyone's time.32/100
Who on earth thought this was funny. Absolutely diabolical.
This is a will ferrel movie and this was me the whole movie ..😑

Mr Ferrell and Mr Reilly, your detective logic should have helped you deduce that despite an all star cast a film with a nonsensical story and predictable jokes is going to bomb. What you have created is a crime in cinema. Think yourself convicted!

reviews.review_title: How could our favourite Step Brothers do this to us :( ?
reviews.content: I had to do it, I had to see what all the fuss was about, I had to watch Holmes and Watson!How could a film starring two of the best comedic actors of the last decade, the men responsible for genre gems Step Brothers and Talladega Nights, knock out a film that dominated nominations at this year's Razzie Awards, stunk it up at the box office and was derided by critics the world over?It's not that I didn't believe it was possible, you could tell very early on from trailer's and the hush hush approach by its studio Sony that there was very little faith in the end product of Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly's reunion, but surely it couldn't be as bad as everyone was saying, surely these two seasoned pros wouldn't allow themselves to be a part of such a dire and comically bad misfire?Sadly all the bad things said about this genuine dud from director Etan Cohen (who somehow managed to make a film worse than Get Hard) are true, our dreams of Ferrell and Reilly teaming up and mining comedy gold shattered, by a film that fails in all of its intentions to create a crass, innuendo filled Sherlock Holmes adventure that would have audiences chuckling into their popcorn or rolling around the isles in fits of laughter.There could be an in-depth analysis of why Holmes and Watson is such an epic failure, from a lactating Reilly, horrible miss-uses of comedy legends and fine actors such as Steve Coogan, Rebecca Hall, Kelly McDonald, Rob Brydon, Hugh Laurie and Ralph Fiennes and other various cinematic crimes but at the end of the day, you can't help but feel a lot of the films failings fall at the feet of Ferrell and Reilly, who should've known a lot better.No doubt it was great for the two to reunite and spend some quality time together but after creating such a strong repertoire and chemistry together in their hit film's, it's hard to imagine Ferrell or Reilly would've felt good about what they were producing on set each day as their timing is flat, their performances devoid of any creative spark or imagination, instead falling time and time again for an easy gag that may at times raise a slight chuckle or wry smile but mainly just induces cringes and rolled eyes.It's a terribly sad state of affairs witnessing two performers we know can do better flail about in Cohen's lifeless and charmless exercise, making Holmes and Watson not only hard to watch but hard to fathom, questions now must be asked around the fact that is this the last time we see Ferrell and Reilly on screen together? Dashing hopes many had of seeing the long talked about Step Brothers sequel.Final Say -Aside from a few very minor chuckles and tiny moments of potential, Holmes and Watson is a film deserving of its extremely low reputation. Tarnishing the on screen partnership between two of the modern eras most likeable comedians, Holmes and Watson is a crime against cinema, that isn't worth investigating.½ an autopsy out of 5

I do not know why didnt i listen to the reviews. i thought it would be silly or something that i know about those 2 actors...
turned out to be one of the most awful movies i ever saw
yes i had a few laughs but hell noin conclusion:
do not dare to waste valuable money and time on this

The stage curtains open ...After strong outings together in "Talladega Nights" and "Step Brothers", this third movie starring both Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly is a head-shaking disappointment (and yes, I know John C. Reilly has an uncredited role in the second Anchorman movie, but I don't count that). Though the film has its moments, they are very few and very far in between. Ferrell and Reilly come off as stumble bums in their roles ... not funny, and not invested.The film starts with a small segment showing Sherlock Holmes as a young boy and the bullying he received from his classmates, causing him to become the emotionless, yet intellectual giant that he was. Okay ... so far, so good. Not a bad start. Enter Ferrell as the modern day Holmes and Reilly as the modern day Watson - and almost immediately, the movie deflates with antiquated gags and jokes that hardly raises an eyebrow. It falls upon these two to root out a conspiracy to take the Queen's life and discredit Holmes at the same time.This movie fails on so many levels and was truly a big disappointment, especially considering their previous work together which was fresh and funny. In this film, Ferrell and Reilly seemed to be more concerned with trying to make things LOOK funny instead of just letting them BE funny. Staging and posturing is the order of the day - nothing flows naturally in the movie. It is completely stilted and forced. The script is terrible, the jokes are old and just plain bad.This is not a recommend. In fact, I would recommend for you to pass on it. If you are a die hard Will Ferrell or John C. Reilly fan, then I can understand your wanting to see this - as I wanted to, even though it was receiving bad reviews. This is one of the worst movies that either of these two have ever made - and certainly the worst one that they've made together.

This was hilarious. I truly can't understand why people would go to a parody film and complain about it's sillyness. It's like complaining that "scary movie" wasn't actually scary.
If you want a goofy slapstick silly parody of the original books (which I can tell from the reviews many people haven't read, otherwise they'd understand the drug jokes)
There quite possibly is a worse movie out there, I just haven't seen it. This is so lame with attempted humor of the most banal kind. There is nothing to appreciate except being able to turn it off.

This sucks more than anything that's ever sucked before!

I find him very funny, even when the movies are not great pieces of art, I always have fun and lots of laughs with his shameless comedy.
I'm a Will Ferrell fan but this was by far one of his worst films. I would not recommend it, even if it was on Netflix.
