Will Ferrel and John C Reilly(aka Dr.Brule) were brilliant in this rendition of Sherlock Holmes. As a British person I especially enjoyed their over accented fake accents and the play on old Victorian language they used. It was funny. It created comedy in itself. 
The plot was simple and moved quickly, allowing for the pair to go about their adventure in a whimsical manner without too much focus on problem solving or anything too complicated. It was a plot made for old fashioned jokes. In their typical style, there was lots of shouting of humorous lines and strange facial expressions that could not fail but to make you giggle. The very well established role of will ferrel as an egotistical protagonist was not only maintained in the character of Sherlock but brilliantly juxtaposed by his faithful  friend Watson, who desperately sought Sherlockï¿ 1/2(TM)s approval.

The cameos in the film were a fun added extra for anyone who is a fan of such a thing, although I didnï¿ 1/2(TM)t find them particularly funny. They envoked a pleasant sense of familiarity and most definitely aided to the comedy, however  the duo led the way through the majority of the jokes.

The film was not perfect and it wasnï¿ 1/2(TM)t as belly achingly funny as step brothers, but MY GOD PEOPLE, chill out, be happy and open your mind to the film as being a couple of dudes doing some pretty silly jokes making for a hilarious hour and a half. Donï¿ 1/2(TM)t go in with expectations of a grandly comedic adaptation of the great Sherlock Holmes. No. It was definitely a mystery who the killer was, which is an important anecdote to make, but itï¿ 1/2(TM)s not meant to simulate Sherlock Holmes or your regular spoof. Itï¿ 1/2(TM)s a film and story all of its own, using the characters as a vehicle to create their own familiar spin comedy.

Go to the cinema, download it, wait for it to come on Netflix or whatever you like, but give it a chance. 

Remember, itï¿ 1/2(TM)s a film full of jokes so sit back and try and have a laugh!

Holmes and Watson does not offer high hopes going into it. The film currently sits at 6% on Rotten Tomatoes and at one point had the dreadful honour of being completely at 0%.

Watching it confirms the fact that it is entirely rotten. Which is an absolute shame. Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly are comedy greats and usually together their humour is multiplied...but clearly the problem lies in the script and direction.

Both duties fall under Etan Cohen, not to be confused with Joel and Ethan Coen and definitely not to be confused with Joel Cohen, writer of Garfield. Of all the Coen/Cohen's in Hollywood, we've found our Paul W.S. Anderson equivalent.Â 

Previously the filmmaker behind Ferrell vehicle Get Hard, it's amazing to see someone get worse, particularly this worse.Â 

Holmes and Watson has all the trappings of a Sherlock Holmes story and all the trappings of a potentially great comedy handled with the grace of the Running of the Bulls through the World's Largest China Shop. So inefficient and unfunny, it's definitely not great when you look around at the silence caused by the severe lack of jokes in the minutes before the opening credits (except one person in my screening, but there's always gonna be one intergalactic alien trying to fit in as a secret human).

The film is severely bland and lacking, full of choices that seem completely misguided. Ferrell decides to put on a strange accent for Holmes that doesn't work at all, and Reilly's Watson is overly and unfunnily violent, yet these are choices never dissuaded by the director, which is concerning.

Holmes and Watson has a story, if you can believe that, one where Moriarty (played by the criminally underused and probably overpaid Ralph Fiennes) has a presence, but is harshly pushed to the side in favour of an invisible antagonist you can figure out by spoilers by billing.Â 

On a completely unrelated note, Kelly MacDonald is in this movie and she continues to be brilliant and brilliantly Scottish in the things that she makes, and while her character is there for a bunch of anachronistic jokes and pushed to the side too, when her arc thins out it feels like it was a good idea made sour at the drop of a hat.

Somewhere, in this movie, there is a joke. I guess. I hope. Much like A Million Ways to Die in the West and other films of that ilk, the only thing that made me laugh was a heavy reference to a much better film that had humour in the fact it took you completely out of the movie you were watching, because it's safer.

Holmes and Watson is a hollow entry to round out the year of comedy movies. Alan Menken and Glenn Slater offer the second closest thing to a joke with an original song that's a parody of their work that's nothing compared to Vanelope's "I want" song parody in Ralph Breaks the Internet.Â 

Everything in this movie has been done better and bigger and funnier and smarter. Hell, even the overrated later episodes of BBC's Sherlock itself parodies itself better, even down to a drunk Sherlock scene that doesn't have to stoop so low as this movie does for an attempt of a laugh.

It joins a bunch of movies I would give no stars to if I could, but the sheer fact that somehow this movie made it from conception to the silver screen is some sort of commendation. Plus it has a Titanic joke that makes no sense, but it makes more sense than the entirety of the film.Â 

And before you say something, yes, the majority of jokes in this film are indeed out of time. And out of this world.

Which is not a good thing.Â 

1/5 Stars.

It was a little crass at moments (think Talladega Nights), but it made the audience laugh at several points, and I liked a lot of the tongue-in-cheek jokes they made about modern trends. Iâ(TM)m a pretty easy movie critic, maybe donâ(TM)t go see it if you are a movie snob or harsher critic, but otherwise I think the movie does what a comedy aims to do, and was suitably entertaining for the masses. Honestly the only reason I wrote this review, which is my first, was that I thought it was a bit unfair with how much bad press the movie was receiving...I didnâ(TM)t think it was half bad, at least not nearly as bad as critics made it out to be. And from what I could tell, the audience in my theatre at least seemed to generally feel the same, so it didnâ(TM)t seem to be just me who enjoyed it.

The onscreen chemistry between Will Ferrall and John C. Reilly makes this movie worth going to see. Our group of six showed up to the theatre to find the movie we went to see was sold out. It was either Holmes and Watson or an animated Marvel movie. Naturally, we opted for a comedic romp through Victorian England.

Holmes and Watson break all the rules that keep society together. They break all the rules on how white male landowners should conduct themselves by screaming at the top of their lungs for their female servant girl. The actress who plays the servant girl does a good job falling into the scene as she buttons up her gown and is followed around by whichever gent she was with when she was summoned by the unabashed crimes solvers. Then there is a American female doctor who has to prove herself to Holmes and Watson to be a doctor because there are no female Doctors in Victorian England. 

There are plenty of drug references to make fun of Sherlock Holmes  penchant for chasing the dragon. There are plenty of phallic jokes and opportunities for the characters to call each other wankers.  a wanker. Dr. House makes a special appearance as Holmes telepathic brother. How could they put Dr. Watson in the back with the elephant man? Billy Zane makes a surprise appearance as himself and he impresses on other ship boarders the size of his canoe. Holmes and Watson save the Titanic from sinking before it left England's shores to, well... sink. Ralph Fiennes plays the imposter and the real Dr. Moriarty. At the end, Dr. Moriarty is hiding out in Wyoming, leaving room for a sequel of Holmes and Watson hunting Dr. Moriarty in the Wild West. They have to wear a good disguise. Handle bar mustache will suffice

There are enough light hearted quips about Trump and American politics to have a sequel set in the West. England gave us our freedom, we should at least have a good USA sequel. If Holmes and his wrongly convicted counterpart (Holmes almost sends Dr. Watson to the gallows) can't save the Queen's life (despite killing her, they do save her in the end) at least they have a chance to make England great!

This is not academy award winning but certainly good joke writing and worthy of many a good laugh. The final bit with Watson saving Titanic was hilarious and the fact is driven home when Holmes says "you can thank Watson that your family's will be safe and sound on board the maiden voyage of Titanic!" I quite enjoyed the film, and so took some thought to understand why the reviews have been so negative. Sure it's not a movie you're going to watch over and over again, but it got a few laughs, and both being British myself, as well as having seen previous Sherlock films, I was able to pick up on most of the references that may have been missed by the average viewer. I think the biggest downfall for this film is that the jokes do not hit a wide audience. The humour is particularly British, using British Slang and phrases. They also took some political agendas both British and American and made jokes of rather touchy subjects. 

In short, if you do not know much about Sherlock, England or Will Ferrell's type of humour, this movie is not for you.

Worse than little Brittan, where one of the main leads labeled it comedian's comedy, but what about everybody else?  It's this which stops Will from being a truly great actor like the off beat comedian of old Tom Hanks (believe it or not, see his early 80's work).

So, what is it, off beat american comedy applied over British comedy going too far.  British comedy works because they withstrain themselves, use tension on the joke, channel and direct themselves.  I was looking at a bit of the American comedy overlay in this, but Will trying to polish his succulent bitch vegetable, encouraging Watson to kill himself off handedly repeatedly and trying to pump the queen, are all classic examples of over reach, even Watson trying to hold the Queens hand, needy.  Take them away, and other parts of the dead Queen V incident, and yeah, it's better.  Put it this way, without those I could give it an extra star, or two.  I wouldn't mind seeing a second film a little toned down in more British style (British Comedy School, and then learn to play with that).  A new Cool Will 2.

The rest of the film, OK, a bit muddling in parts, three stars.  Appeals to certain people, and not to others (like reviews in here).  So, don't mistake it for a terrible movie, unless its not your cup of tea.

The more I think about why this movie sucks, the more I realize the key to a good Will Ferrell / John C Reilly movie is editing. Let the guys do their ad libs. Shoot hours and hours of footage. And then get a good editor to weave everything together into a 90 minute comedy. It was obvious that the editing sucked in this flick. The timing and pacing was off. The humor always seemed a beat behind. Hell...they should have edited the movie like they did the trailer. It was actually funnier than the film. If you're a huge, diehard fan of either Ferrell or Reilly and insist on seeing it, wait until the movie shows up on Netflix. For everyone else--just stay away.

Having seen the trailers on TV, I was most excited to see this movie. The trailers presented it as a fun, comedic take on a Sherlock Holmes story; that couldnï¿ 1/2 1/2(TM)t have been further from the truth. Instead, the ï¿ 1/2 1/2comedyï¿ 1/2 1/2ï¿ 1/2Â? relied mostly on profanity and strayed so far from the realm of Sherlock Holmes that it was almost unrecognizable. Holmes and Watson also threw in some political jokes which could have been funny if not for the horribly akward timing and anachronistic basis. (Minor Spoiler) While on the subject of horribly awkward timing, the uncomfortable musical number made little sense and, therefore, got little laughs.

That being said, there were a few funny moments in this monstrosity of a movie. (Minor Spoiler) In a scene where the Queen of England supposedly dies while taking a self photograph (selfie), Holmes and Watson struggle to hide her body, gaining genuine laughs through the use of slapstick. In addition to this moment, there are a few other good laughs in there albeit, not many.

Overall, Holmes and Watson presents hackneyed humor and downright odd portrayals of the famous Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson. By missing this movie, one misses absolutely nothing of importance, except for the bragging rights of saying one has made it through this thoroughly awful movie.

Sitting at a 0% on Rotten Tomatoes is a rare, but pretty terrible thing to have. Holmes and Watson currently is sitting at this legendary number, but is it really that bad? It's not good, but I didn't think this was absolutely the worst movie of 2018. From Director Etan Cohen who last brought us Get Hard (2015) Holmes and Watson is a comedic take on Sherlock Holmes and his partner Watson. Sherlock Holmes (Will Ferrell) and John Watson (John C Reilly) have just solved their most recent case revolving around the evil Dr. Moriarty (Ralph Fiennes) when the Queen (Pam Ferris) hires the duo to figure out a mystery surrounding a note saying the Queen will die within the week. Holmes and Watson are on the case and along with an American doctor named Grace Hart (Rebecca Hall) and her bumbling assistant Millie (Lauren Lapkus) they work to solve the case. This is literally the nicest I could have been here about the plot. It's incredibly simply, silly and predictable. Ferrell and Reilly have the same great chemistry they usually have, but its hindered with the whole Holmes and Watson personas. I almost feel like this would have worked better as an original tale and not as it was based on previous material. The movie is actually funny at times. It's incredibly dumb and maybe coming in with no expectations helped. I laughed a bit and enjoyed it overall. It's not perfect, or even particularly good. It has some moments that are funny, but this is definitely just a rental at best don't waste your time on this one in the theaters.

Holmes and Watson is your basic slapstick comedy that follows along with the style of a lot of films Will Farrell and John Reilly do. It's a bit like Step-Brothers and Talladega Nights. Holmes and Watson is a perfect example of taking a relatively interesting concept, then throwing it out the window to make lazy modern references to things like selfies and Trump.  Nearly every joke falls flat and most of the supporting cast deliver dead pan performances.  Let me spoil the only two interesting moments; Braun Stroman (literally named freaking Brawn) shows up for a handicap wrestling match against Holmes and Watson, and Hugh Laurie (playing Holmes' brother) has a psychic conversation with Holmes which was actually pretty humorous.  But neither of those things justify sitting through this boring mess of a comedy.

I'd just like to point out first that I actually created an account here just to tell other people how terrible this movie is.  In all my years on earth, I have never walked out of a movie because it was a worthless trash heap.  This was my first.  The movie is simply not funny.  I went hoping to laugh at anything but this was total garbage.  The only semblance of humor to be had didn't even come from the leads in the movie but were often the product of sight gags.  The jokes were stale, mistimed, and weak.  There were jokes from items that had not be a pop-culture reference for nearly a decade.  In the middle of an already meaningless jumble of story, the movie even attempts to hop on a soapbox and claim some sort of political relevancy which can be humorous if done with a deft hand but this just came across as misplaced and pointless.  I believe the last straw for me was watching someone who has been in some of the funniest movies I have ever seen stalling out through an hour and fifteen minutes of runtime only to say, "I swear that if he breaks out into song, I am out of here."  ...then he did.  And I was.  Don't bother with this massive miss.  Save yourself the frustration.  Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly owe me $7.

This movie is getting panned so hard, but I was amused all the way through.  Will Farrell brings a Peter Sellers aesthetic to the role, almost as if Inspector Clouseau were standing in for Sherlock Holmes, and if you're a big fan of the overly reverent depiction of the Holmes character so carefully cultivated by the highbrow television series, you're probably going to hate this movie. It's full of gross-out humor and increasingly ludicrous setpieces, the autopsy scene as a good example, that get so ridiculous and over the top that you can't believe that not only did they "go there", but they kept going and going.  Two and a half stars because I'm still amused an hour later. Your mileage may vary.

No one laughed at this movie? Really? No one found this funny? I knew I was going to love this movie the second the little girl grabbed (young) Sherlock's turtle and threw it shouting (I paraphrase), "What kind of stupid dog is this!?" ThisNo one laughed at this movie? Really? No one found this funny? I knew I was going to love this movie the second the little girl grabbed (young) Sherlock's turtle and threw it shouting (I paraphrase), "What kind of stupid dog is this!?" This is not a satire - it's a total send up, and if you love Sherlock Holmes but realize how freaking inherently goofy the famous detective is, and how the Holmes/Watson relationship is so similar to the hilarious dynamic between Ricky Bobby and Cal Naughton, Jr. - you must appreciate this. There is a plot for anyone paying attention. Sherlock refuses to feel anything (he uncries!), and learns that he needs to understand love in order to solve crimes. They have a fricking full out Hollywood musical number at the end which alone makes the film as brilliant as any Will Ferrell/John C. Reilly film you've ever seen. Honestly, were all these negative reviews written by people who hate comedy?  Also - the not-so-subtle digs at American culture are spot on and hilarious. Pay attention. Slapstick humor, gross-out humor, plus witty dialogue ("A lady doctor!" "How do you spell doctor?" "Does doctor mean something different in America?") equals another Will Ferrell/John C. Reilly triumph. New favorite movie.

This "comic" take on Sherlock Holmes stars Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly as the titular duo. I put the quotes around comic, because this film dredges the bottom of the comedy barrel and comes up flailing with a flat farce. I didn't laffThis "comic" take on Sherlock Holmes stars Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly as the titular duo. I put the quotes around comic, because this film dredges the bottom of the comedy barrel and comes up flailing with a flat farce. I didn't laff once during the entire movie. Much of the silliness is just that: silly (with some equally uninspired contemporary references). Reilly has a few mildly amusing moments with Queen Victoria, but that's still pretty anemic. There is absolutely nothing to recommend this miserable coupling.

If you're a fan of Will Ferrell's early films, Anchorman, The Ballad of Ricky Bobby etc and in particular Stepbrothers, you'll absolutely love this. I wanted to see why the critics gave it such a low score and I think I understand...theyIf you're a fan of Will Ferrell's early films, Anchorman, The Ballad of Ricky Bobby etc and in particular Stepbrothers, you'll absolutely love this. I wanted to see why the critics gave it such a low score and I think I understand...they think the absolute stupidity of it is somehow accidental. If you go into a film starring these two guys expecting some kind of thrilling plot and something at all serious then you're missing the point, this is just pure, farcical lunacy which for me works on every level. The characters of Holmes and Watson are parodied so effectively, it's obvious the writers know them well and are fans of Holmes. This film is as quotable as Anchorman and I think that over time it will also achieve cult status. Any film that Rotten tomatoes gives 3% should spike your interest. I read people were walking out of cinemas but the one I was in was full of people roaring with laughter and the film even got an applause at the end, which I've never seen before. I recommend you make your own mind up about this film and don't listen to people who don't appreciate this kind of bizarre and daft comedy. The writing is top notch and Ferrell and Reilly are a joy to watch

'Holmes & Watson' is an annoying and uninspired comedy that completely misuses the reliable talents of Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. The film focuses on how Dr. John Watson (Reilly) was once contemplating suicide, but stumbles across a'Holmes & Watson' is an annoying and uninspired comedy that completely misuses the reliable talents of Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. The film focuses on how Dr. John Watson (Reilly) was once contemplating suicide, but stumbles across a clever and mysterious man named Sherlock Holmes (Ferrell), and the two guys seem to get along and hit it off and become a duo. We see that Holmes and Watson crack many cases and solve many crimes, until they one day let the evil Moriarty (Ralph Fiennes) escape making everyone believe that he is innocent. The film then ponders along with unfunny scenes followed by even more unfunny scenes, we see that the duo are invited to meet the Queen, and discover that there was a murder and that the Queen's life is in potential danger, so the duo get on the case to find out who the culprit could be. There is no clever moments in this film, I usually admire the sharply funny Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly, whether they are together ('Step Brothers'), or when they're apart. The film, written and directed by Etan Cohen seems to restrain them from doing anything genuinely funny, and instead they are resorted to just screaming to the top of their lungs, talking and talking about unfunny things, or just making faces at each other without any worthy punchline. It's a largely misconceived comedy that badly tries to squeeze a laugh out of the audience without any use of subtlety and uses an Adam Sandler type approach. Sometimes less is more.

Holmes & Watson is a comedic take on Arthur Conan Doyle's classic detective stories, featuring Sherlock Holmes and John Watson. Written and directed by Etan Cohen, the film is widely considered one of the biggest flops of 2018. The movie hasHolmes & Watson is a comedic take on Arthur Conan Doyle's classic detective stories, featuring Sherlock Holmes and John Watson. Written and directed by Etan Cohen, the film is widely considered one of the biggest flops of 2018. The movie has been criticized for its poor slapstick humor, sexual innuendo and a lack of chemistry between the lead actors Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. The cast, which includes Kelly Macdonald, Rebecca Hall, Ralph Fiennes, Steve Coogan, Hugh Laurie, Pam Ferris and Rob Brydon, are also said to be wasted in this poorly written script. The story takes place in 1881 London and follows Watson as he meets and befriends Holmes, becoming his assistant and later moving in together to become the ultimate crime-solving duo. However, the film fails to live up to the humor and storytelling of previous adaptations and is criticized for its inconsistent and anachronistic portrayal of Victorian London. Overall, it's a movie best avoided by both fans of the original stories and comedy lovers.________________________Holmes & Watson es una versión cómica de las clásicas historias de detectives de Arthur Conan Doyle, con Sherlock Holmes y John Watson. Escrita y dirigida por Etan Cohen, la película es ampliamente considerada como uno de los mayores fracasos de 2018. La película ha sido criticada por su pobre humor, sus insinuaciones sexuales y la falta de química entre los actores principales Will Ferrell y John C. Reilly. También se dice que el elenco, que incluye a Kelly Macdonald, Rebecca Hall, Ralph Fiennes, Steve Coogan, Hugh Laurie, Pam Ferris y Rob Brydon, está desperdiciado en este guión mal escrito. La historia tiene lugar en Londres en 1881 y sigue a Watson cuando conoce y se hace amigo de Holmes, se convierte en su asistente y luego se mudan juntos para convertirse en el dúo definitivo para resolver crímenes. Sin embargo, la película no está a la altura del humor y la narración de adaptaciones anteriores y es criticada por su interpretación inconsistente y anacrónica del Londres victoriano. En general, es una película que es mejor evitar tanto para los fanáticos de las historias originales como para los amantes de la comedia.

rt_summary: Detective Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson join forces to investigate a mysterious murder at Buckingham Palace. It seems like an open-and-shut case as all signs point to Professor James Moriarty, the criminal mastermind and longtime nemesis of the crime-solving duo. When new twists and clues begin to emerge, the world's greatest sleuth and his trusted assistant must now use their legendary wits and ingenious methods to catch the killer before the queen becomes the next victim.
meta_summary: A humorous take on Arthur Conan Doyle's classic mysteries featuring Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson.
